original: @1b # // gal te bsgoms pa'i stobs las rnam pa gsal ba tshad ma yin na 'o na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: @1b # // gal te bsgoms pa'i stobs las rnam pa gsal ba tshad ma yin na 'o na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the clarity of aspect due to the power of meditation is valid knowledge, then conceptual consciousness would be valid knowledge,

original: rnam pa gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gsal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has a clear aspect.

original: gzhan du na tshad ma yin pas don la rnam pa mi gsal bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gzhan du na tshad ma yin pas don la rnam pa mi gsal bar 'dod na /
translated: Otherwise, if you assert that valid knowledge does not have a clear aspect with regard to its object,

original: 'o na rang gi ngo bo la yang 'dod par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi ngo bo la yang 'dod par bya'o zhe na /
translated: then you must also assert that it does not have a clear aspect with regard to its own nature.

original: ma yin te gsal ba'i rnam pa de nyid ni rang gi ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te gsal ba'i rnam pa de nyid ni rang gi ngo bo yin te /
translated: That is not so, because that clear aspect itself is its own nature,

original: don la ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: don la ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: but that is not the case with regard to the object.

original: des na de rang gi ngo bo la rnam par mi rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: des na de rang gi ngo bo la rnam par mi rtog pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is direct perception with regard to its own nature,

original: don la rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pas don la ni dran pa yin la /üîΩrang gi ngo bo la ni dran pa ma yin par mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: don la rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pas don la ni dran pa yin la / rang gi ngo bo la ni dran pa ma yin par mngon sum nyid do //
translated: but it is memory with regard to the object, because it is conceptual with regard to the object.

original: de rang gi ngo bo la ni ma 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bo la ni ma 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: It is nondeceptive with regard to its own nature,üîΩbut it is deceptive with regard to the object.

original: don la ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: don la ni 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know this?

original: rang gi ngo bo ni gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because its own nature is not known by another.

original: tha dad phyir ram /
analyzed: tha dad phyir ram /
translated: Or, because it is different.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo ni myong ba gzhan gyis rig pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo ni myong ba gzhan gyis rig pa yin te /
translated: The nature of another is known by another‚Äôs experience.

original: de'i phyir des de rnam pa gzhan du rig pa'i phyir gnod la /
analyzed: de'i phyir des de rnam pa gzhan du rig pa'i phyir gnod la /
translated: Therefore, it is damaged by the fact that it knows that in another aspect.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is mistaken.

original: rang gi ngo bo la ni dran pa mi srid de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la ni dran pa mi srid de /
translated: Memory is impossible for one‚Äôs own nature,

original: de ni de nyid kyi tshe skyes pa dang rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de nyid kyi tshe skyes pa dang rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises and is known at that time.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo yang sngar yod pa yin na /üîΩ@2a * // da ltar med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo yang sngar yod pa yin na / @2a * // da ltar med pa'i phyir /
translated: If one‚Äôs own nature existed previously,

original: ci ltar dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ltar dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: how could it be remembered,üîΩbecause it does not exist now?

original: ci ste de nyid kyis da ltar dran na 'di ni khyim bya shi zin pas skad 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste de nyid kyis da ltar dran na 'di ni khyim bya shi zin pas skad 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is remembered by that itself, then this is like a dead crow cawing.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: rtog pa'ang rang rig la mi 'dod //
analyzed: rtog pa'ang rang rig la mi 'dod //
translated: Conceptual thought also is not asserted to be reflexive awareness,

original: don la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don la rnam par rtog pa'i phyir //
translated: because it is a conception of an object.

original: lkog gyur rab tu ma grub pas //
analyzed: lkog gyur rab tu ma grub pas //
translated: Since it is not established as hidden,

original: rang gi ngo bor mi rtog phyir //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor mi rtog phyir //
translated: it does not conceive its own nature.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.

original: de nyid kyis de bzung ba na mngon du byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de bzung ba na mngon du byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is apprehended by that, and when it is apprehended, it is perceived.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang rig pa'i mngon sum du brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang rig pa'i mngon sum du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúperception of self-awareness.‚ÄùüîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / shes gang gang la sgra don 'dzin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes gang gang la sgra don 'dzin //
translated: Any cognition that apprehends the meaning of a word

original: de ni de la rtog pa yin //
analyzed: de ni de la rtog pa yin //
translated: is conceptual with respect to that.

original: rang gi ngo bo'ang sgra don min //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'ang sgra don min //
translated: Its own nature is not the meaning of a word;

original: de phyir de la kun mngon sum //
analyzed: de phyir de la kun mngon sum //
translated: therefore, it is directly perceived.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Whether it is conceptual or not,

original: gzhan gyi'ang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi'ang rung ste /
translated: it is not the meaning of a word.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni sgra'i don ma yin zhing spyi ma yin la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni sgra'i don ma yin zhing spyi ma yin la /
translated: Its own nature is not the meaning of a word, nor is it a universal,

original: mngon par zhen pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: nor is it an object of adherence.

original: de lta yin dang / sgra sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ram spyi dang 'dre ba med pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang / sgra sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ram spyi dang 'dre ba med pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa yin la /
translated: If that is so, then it is nonconceptual because it is not connected to words or because it is not mixed with universals.

original: rtog pa ni sgra'i don 'dzin pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa ni sgra'i don 'dzin pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: Conceptual cognition is a cognition that apprehends the meaning of a word.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa gsal ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa gsal ba nyid ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Why is it not clear?

original: de ni gsal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ni gsal ba nyid yin te /
translated: It is clear.

original: ma yin no zhes ci ltar brjod /
analyzed: ma yin no zhes ci ltar brjod /
translated: How can you say that it is not?üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / de yi rang bzhin btang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar / de yi rang bzhin btang ba'i phyir /
translated: because it has abandoned its own nature,

original: mi gsal zhes ni brjod pa yin //
analyzed: mi gsal zhes ni brjod pa yin //
translated: it is said to be unclear.üîΩHow can it be understood

original: rang gi rang bzhin btang ngo zhes //üîΩbya bar ci ltar khong du chud //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin btang ngo zhes // bya bar ci ltar khong du chud //
translated: that it has abandoned its own nature?

original: rang gi ngo bo ni dor bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni dor bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: One‚Äôs own nature cannot be abandoned.

original: @2b de dor na rig pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @2b de dor na rig pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were abandoned, it would be without awareness.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: de lta na ni rang rig pa med cing gzhan rig pa med pa'i phyir thams cad med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rang rig pa med cing gzhan rig pa med pa'i phyir thams cad med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, since there is no awareness of itself and no awareness of another, everything would be absolutely nonexistent.

original: 'on te don gyis go bas rig pa yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te don gyis go bas rig pa yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that it is not aware of itself because it is aware of its object, that is not so.

original: don gyis go ba rang gi ngo bo nyid rig pa kho nas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don gyis go ba rang gi ngo bo nyid rig pa kho nas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: The awareness of an object is to be understood only through awareness of itself.

original: ci ste de la yang don gyis go ba yod na de yang de ltar yin pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: ci ste de la yang don gyis go ba yod na de yang de ltar yin pas thug pa med do //
translated: But if you say that there is awareness of an object in that awareness, then that awareness would also be aware of itself, and so on ad infinitum.

original: gal te don gyis go ba don myong ba grub pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te don gyis go ba don myong ba grub pa yin na /
translated: If the awareness of an object is established by the experience of the object,

original: don myong ba la don go bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: don myong ba la don go bas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of understanding the object when the object is experienced?

original: don grub pa na yin gyi don myong ba grub pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don grub pa na yin gyi don myong ba grub pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: When the object is established, it is established. But the experience of the object is not established.

original: don grub pa de gang yin /
analyzed: don grub pa de gang yin /
translated: What is the establishment of the object?

original: gal te skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is arising,

original: don thams cad rig par thal lo //
analyzed: don thams cad rig par thal lo //
translated: it follows that all objects are cognized.

original: 'on te don shes pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te don shes pa yin na /
translated: But if the object is the consciousness,

original: de'i don 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: the meaning of that is as follows.

original: don shes pa las don shes pa rig pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur bas tshig gi tshul legs so //
analyzed: don shes pa las don shes pa rig pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur bas tshig gi tshul legs so //
translated: It would be the statement ‚ÄúThe object is cognized by the consciousness of the object,‚Äù and that is a good way of putting it.

original: 'on te shes par gyur pa'i don las don rig pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te shes par gyur pa'i don las don rig pa yin na /
translated: But if the object is cognized by the object that is the consciousness,

original: don gyi shes par gyur pa zhes bya ba ci yin /
analyzed: don gyi shes par gyur pa zhes bya ba ci yin /
translated: what is the object that is the consciousness?

original: shes pa la snang ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa la snang ba'o zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is the appearance in the consciousness,

original: shes pa ma shes na shes pa la snang ba ji ltar shes /
analyzed: shes pa ma shes na shes pa la snang ba ji ltar shes /
translated: how is the appearance in the consciousness known if the consciousness is not known?

original: snang bzhin pa'i don mngon sum nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa'i don mngon sum nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the object that is appearing is direct perception,

original: mngon sum gyis grub na ni de kho na ltar yin la rag mod /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub na ni de kho na ltar yin la rag mod /
translated: if it is established by direct perception, then of course it is just as you say.

original: don gzhan rtogs pas ci bya /
analyzed: don gzhan rtogs pas ci bya /
translated: But what is the use of knowing another object?

original: mngon sum ni de nyid yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni de nyid yin te /
translated: It is direct perception itself.

original: de lta ma yin na mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi 'thad do //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would not be tenable.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: gal te shes pa mngon sum ma yin na mngon sum nyid dang 'di nyid mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te shes pa mngon sum ma yin na mngon sum nyid dang 'di nyid mi 'thad do //
translated: If cognition is not direct perception, then direct perception itself is not tenable.

original: gal te shes pa mngon sum ma yin na /üîΩmig gi byed pa yod na 'di 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te shes pa mngon sum ma yin na / mig gi byed pa yod na 'di 'gyur la /
translated: If cognition is not direct perception,

original: gzhan du ma yin pa'i phyir shes pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin pa'i phyir shes pas ci zhig bya /
translated: then what is the use of cognition, since it would be due to the functioning of the eye and not due to anything else?

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mngon sum yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mngon sum yin no zhe na /
translated: If the engagement of the ear, etc. is direct perception,

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa gang yin /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa gang yin /
translated: what is the engagement of the ear, etc.?

original: shes pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa'o zhe na /
translated: If it is cognition,

original: shes pa lkog tu gyur pa de ci ltar shes /
analyzed: shes pa lkog tu gyur pa de ci ltar shes /
translated: how is that hidden cognition known?

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa nyid las shes so zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa nyid las shes so zhe na /
translated: If it is known from the engagement of the ear, etc.,

original: rna ba la sogs pa 'jug pa'i mngon sum ni des shes na /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa 'jug pa'i mngon sum ni des shes na /
translated: if the direct perception of the engagement of the ear, etc. knows it,

original: shes pa go ga las yin /
analyzed: shes pa go ga las yin /
translated: how is cognition known?üîΩIf it were otherwise, what would be the use of the engagement of the ear, etc.?

original: de lta ma yin na rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pas ci zhig bya zhe na ci khyed ci dgos pa la ltos nas dngos po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pas ci zhig bya zhe na ci khyed ci dgos pa la ltos nas dngos po rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Do things arise in dependence on what is needed?

original: dngos po rnams ni rgyu nyid las //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rgyu nyid las //
translated: Things arise from their own causes.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur te dgos pa min //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur te dgos pa min //
translated: But it is not necessary for the object to be present.

original: gzhan du khyed kyi dgos pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan du khyed kyi dgos pa ni //
translated: Otherwise, your object

original: med par dngos po 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med par dngos po 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: would not occur without a cause.

original: gal te rna ba mngon du phyogs par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te rna ba mngon du phyogs par 'gyur mod /
translated: If the ear is directed toward the sound,

original: shes pa la ci zhig 'ongs /
analyzed: shes pa la ci zhig 'ongs /
translated: what happens to the cognition?

original: @3a * // gal te shes pa ma skyes na don lkog tu gyur pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: @3a * // gal te shes pa ma skyes na don lkog tu gyur pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the cognition is not produced, the object is completely hidden.

original: gal te shes pa skyes kyang don la ci zhig 'byung /
analyzed: gal te shes pa skyes kyang don la ci zhig 'byung /
translated: If the cognition is produced, what happens to the object?

original: de lta na yang lkog tu gyur pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang lkog tu gyur pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, it would be completely hidden.

original: shes pa skyes pa ni don gyi mngon sum du gyur pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa skyes pa ni don gyi mngon sum du gyur pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The production of the cognition is not the manifestation of the object,

original: de lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is hidden, and it follows, absurdly, that the cognition would be hidden.

original: mthong ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is seen,

original: 'o na ni ci ltar mthong ba de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni ci ltar mthong ba de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be as it is seen.

original: khyed kyi yang ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: khyed kyi yang ci ltar zhe na /
translated: What about your position?

original: don shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa de'i rnam pa nyid do //
analyzed: don shes pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa de'i rnam pa nyid do //
translated: The so-called cognition of the object is the aspect of that cognition.

original: de yang rang rig pas rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang rig pas rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: And that is to be understood through reflexive awareness.

original: gang gis thug pa med par 'gyur ba de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis thug pa med par 'gyur ba de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa gzhan gyis rtogs par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be understood by another cognition having the same aspect.

original: des na shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgrub par byed pa ni rang rig pa kho na yin par rigs so //
analyzed: des na shes pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgrub par byed pa ni rang rig pa kho na yin par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the proof of the nature of cognition is only autocognition.

original: gal te bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba gsal bar snang ba mngon sum yin na /
analyzed: gal te bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba gsal bar snang ba mngon sum yin na /
translated: If direct perception is that which appears clearly due to the power of meditation,

original: 'o na ni rmi lam gyi shes pa yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni rmi lam gyi shes pa yang mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: then even the consciousness in a dream would be direct perception.

original: mi slu ba yang de la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba yang de la yod pa yin te /
translated: Nondeception also exists in that case,

original: der yang 'gro ba dang thob pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: der yang 'gro ba dang thob pa yod pa yin no //
translated: because going and obtaining exist there.

original: 'di ni med de /
analyzed: 'di ni med de /
translated: This is not so.üîΩDelusion, conventional knowledge,

original: 'khrul dang kun rdzob shes pa dang // rjes dpag rjes su dpag las byung //
analyzed: 'khrul dang kun rdzob shes pa dang // rjes dpag rjes su dpag las byung //
translated: inference, and what arises from inference,

original: dran dang 'dod pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dran dang 'dod pa las byung ba'o //
translated: memory, and desire.

original: mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang rab rib bcas //
translated: Direct perception-like is obscured by cataracts.

original: mngon sum ltar snang ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Direct perception-like is of two kinds:

original: rtog bcas dang rtog med do //
analyzed: rtog bcas dang rtog med do //
translated: conceptual and nonconceptual.

original: yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is also of four kinds:

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: mngon sum ltar snang rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang rnam pa bzhi //
translated: There are four kinds of apparent direct perception.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa rnam gsum dang // rten bslad pa las byung ba can //
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa rnam gsum dang // rten bslad pa las byung ba can //
translated: There are three kinds of conceptual cognition, and one kind of cognition that arises from a defective basis.

original: rtog pa med pas gcig yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa med pas gcig yin no //
translated: The latter is non-conceptual.

original: gnyis po de nyid rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum du phye ba las rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis po de nyid rnam par rtog pa rnam pa gsum du phye ba las rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: These two are divided into three kinds of conceptual cognition, making four kinds in all.

original: mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Direct perception is free from conceptual thought.

original: des na rtog pa rnam pa gsum yang mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: des na rtog pa rnam pa gsum yang mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the three kinds of conceptual cognition are apparent direct perception.

original: de la 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur rtog pas 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur rtog pas 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: Among them, a mistaken cognition is apparent direct perception because it engages its object by conceiving a mirage, etc. to be water.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa la don gzhan sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / de'i ngo bor rtog pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa la don gzhan sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / de'i ngo bor rtog pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is apparent direct perception because it superimposes another object on what exists conventionally and because it engages its object by conceiving it to be its nature.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa ni sngar nyams su myong ba rtog pas 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang de'i 'bras bu la sogs pa'i shes pa ni sngar nyams su myong ba rtog pas 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Inference and the cognition of its result, etc. are not direct perception because they engage their objects by conceptual thought that remembers a previous experience.

original: 'od zer g-yo ba'i smig rgyu'i tshogs snang ba ni mngon sum @3b nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'od zer g-yo ba'i smig rgyu'i tshogs snang ba ni mngon sum @3b nyid yin la /
translated: The appearance of a mass of shimmering light rays is direct perception itself.

original: chu la sogs par rtog pa ni mngon sum ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: chu la sogs par rtog pa ni mngon sum ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: The conception of water, etc. is a semblance of direct perception,

original: chu mngon sum du ma byas pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu mngon sum du ma byas pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the aspect of not perceiving water directly.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa dag la yang gzugs la sogs pa tsam 'dzin pa kho na mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa dag la yang gzugs la sogs pa tsam 'dzin pa kho na mngon sum yin la /
translated: Even in regard to things that exist conventionally, the apprehension of mere form, etc. is direct perception.

original: de'i 'du ba can gyi rgyur 'dod pa'i yan lag can ni mngon sum du byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'du ba can gyi rgyur 'dod pa'i yan lag can ni mngon sum du byas pa ma yin te /
translated: The possessor of the parts, which is asserted to be the cause of that, is not perceived,

original: reg pa la sogs pa sngar mthong ba'i don gzhan sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / shes pa snga ma snga mas brtags pa'i rdzas kyang brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: reg pa la sogs pa sngar mthong ba'i don gzhan sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / shes pa snga ma snga mas brtags pa'i rdzas kyang brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the contact, etc. superimpose other objects that have been seen previously, and because the substance that is imagined by the previous cognition is also imagined.

original: yan lag can ni gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par 'gar yang mngon sum la snang ba med do ;
analyzed: yan lag can ni gzugs la sogs pa las tha dad par 'gar yang mngon sum la snang ba med do ;
translated: The possessor of the parts never appears as different from form, etc. in any direct perception.

original: ; rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa ni rtags kyi shes pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rtags can gyi shes pa ni sngar myong ba med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ; rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa ni rtags kyi shes pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rtags can gyi shes pa ni sngar myong ba med pa ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge that is inference is the knowledge of the reason. The knowledge that is the effect of that, the knowledge that has the reason, is not without prior experience.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa 'di yang kha cig tu ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa 'di yang kha cig tu ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: This knowledge that is inference is, in some cases, direct perception.

original: kha cig tu ni mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: In some cases, it is not direct perception.

original: du ba glo bur ba las me rtogs par ro //
analyzed: du ba glo bur ba las me rtogs par ro //
translated: For example, the knowledge of fire from the inference of smoke.

original: de na ni sngar myong ba rtog pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de na ni sngar myong ba rtog pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, there is no prior experience of the conception.

original: rtog pa med par ji ltar rtags las rtogs she na /
analyzed: rtog pa med par ji ltar rtags las rtogs she na /
translated: How can there be knowledge from a reason without conception?

original: de kho na ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na ltar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen just as it is.

original: mthong ba ni gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: mthong ba ni gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that what is seen is otherwise.

original: ci'i phyir rtog pa'i dbye ba bstan /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtog pa'i dbye ba bstan /
translated: Why is the classification of conception taught?

original: dper brjod pa du ma'i don du'o zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: dper brjod pa du ma'i don du'o zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: For the sake of many examples.

original: mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no difference in definition.

original: du ma tsam bstan pa na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩdo ni med de /
analyzed: du ma tsam bstan pa na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na / do ni med de /
translated: If mere multiplicity is taught, there would be an absurd consequence.

original: dgos pa gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa gzhan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is another purpose.

original: 'di ltar / dbang skyes min pa grub don du //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dbang skyes min pa grub don du //
translated: In order to establish that it is not born of the senses,

original: gnyis bshad 'khrul ba mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis bshad 'khrul ba mthong phyir ro //
translated: two are mentioned, because error is seen.

original: rjes dpag sogs grub brjod pa ni //
analyzed: rjes dpag sogs grub brjod pa ni //
translated: The statement that it is established by inference, etc.,

original: snga ma gnyis nyid sgrub phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma gnyis nyid sgrub phyir ro //
translated: is in order to establish the first two.

original: smig rgyu la chur shes pa la pha rol dag 'di ni dbang po las skyes pa nyid do zhes 'khrul te /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur shes pa la pha rol dag 'di ni dbang po las skyes pa nyid do zhes 'khrul te /
translated: With regard to the cognition of water in a mirage, others err, saying, ‚ÄúThis is born of the senses.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba'i shes pa 'khrul pa med pa nges pa'i bdag nyid ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba'i shes pa 'khrul pa med pa nges pa'i bdag nyid ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid 'di la /
translated: Thus, the definition of perception is a cognition that is nonerroneous and certain, and arises from the contact of a sense faculty with an object.

original: 'khrul pa med pa smos pa bya ba ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa gcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa smos pa bya ba ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa gcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of nonerroneous in this definition is in order to exclude the cognition of water in a mirage.

original: gal te 'di dbang po las skyes pa ma yin na ni tshig dang po kho nas bzlog pa'i phyir don 'di la 'khrul pa med pa smos pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gal te 'di dbang po las skyes pa ma yin na ni tshig dang po kho nas bzlog pa'i phyir don 'di la 'khrul pa med pa smos pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If it is not born of the senses, then since it is excluded by the first definition alone, what is the point of mentioning nonerroneous in this definition?

original: don med par skyes pa zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don med par skyes pa zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is in order to exclude the cognition of two moons, which is not born of the senses but is erroneous.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de ni don phrad pa smos pa nyid kyis bzlog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang po smos pas ni dbang @4a * //
analyzed: de ni don phrad pa smos pa nyid kyis bzlog pa'i phyir ro // dbang po smos pas ni dbang @4a * //
translated: because the mere mention of the object‚Äôs contact with the sense faculty refutes that.

original: po las ma skyes pa bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: po las ma skyes pa bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The mention of the sense faculty refutes that it is not produced from a sense faculty.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa'i yul can la gzhan dag dbang po las skyes par rlom pa la ni rtsod pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa'i yul can la gzhan dag dbang po las skyes par rlom pa la ni rtsod pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: There is no dispute that the subject that exists conventionally is produced from a sense faculty.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa brjod pa ni don med do //
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa brjod pa ni don med do //
translated: Well then, it is pointless to state inference, etc.

original: des na dbang po las skyes pa ma yin par sgrub pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: des na dbang po las skyes pa ma yin par sgrub pa ma yin te ;
translated: Therefore, it is not established that it is not produced from a sense faculty,

original: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa dbang po las ma skyes pa ni grub zin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa dbang po las ma skyes pa ni grub zin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is already established that inference, etc., are not produced from a sense faculty.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: rjes dpag la sogs grub zin kyang //
analyzed: rjes dpag la sogs grub zin kyang //
translated: Although inference, etc., are established,

original: sgrub byed yin phyir smos pa nyid //
analyzed: sgrub byed yin phyir smos pa nyid //
translated: they are mentioned because they are the proof.

original: thams cad du ni grub pa nyid //
analyzed: thams cad du ni grub pa nyid //
translated: Everything is not established

original: dpe nyid du ni rab tu sbyor //
analyzed: dpe nyid du ni rab tu sbyor //
translated: as an example.

original: ma grub pas ni ma grub pa sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pas ni ma grub pa sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Something that is not established does not establish something else.

original: gang gis snga ma gnyis bsgrub par 'gyur ba 'dir 'khrul pa rgyu ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis snga ma gnyis bsgrub par 'gyur ba 'dir 'khrul pa rgyu ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of error here, by which one establishes the former two?üîΩReply: The cause of error is sometimes the conceptual thought that superimposes,

original: bshad pa / brda rten pa dang don gzhan can //
analyzed: bshad pa / brda rten pa dang don gzhan can //
translated: which has a basis in convention and a different object,

original: sgro 'dogs rnam par rtog pa dag / mngon sum nyer 'jug can nyid phyir //üîΩ'ga' tshe 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs rnam par rtog pa dag / mngon sum nyer 'jug can nyid phyir // 'ga' tshe 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: because it engages directly with perception.

original: brda la brten pa ni yan lag can te /
analyzed: brda la brten pa ni yan lag can te /
translated: That which has a basis in convention is the whole.

original: de rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu ni brda tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu ni brda tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of its stability is merely the convention.

original: don gzhan ni chu'o //
analyzed: don gzhan ni chu'o //
translated: The different object is water.

original: sgro 'dogs pa ni bla lhag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa ni bla lhag tu sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Superimposition is the superimposition of something extra.

original: rnam rtog ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog ni dran pa'o //
translated: Conceptual thought is memory.

original: chu ni sngar mthong ba yin pa'i phyir dran par byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chu ni sngar mthong ba yin pa'i phyir dran par byas pa yin gyi /
translated: Water is remembered because it was seen before.

original: de sgro 'dogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de sgro 'dogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the superimposition of that,

original: 'ba' zhig la mthong ba ni bden par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig la mthong ba ni bden par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere seeing of it appears to be real.

original: yang na bzlog ste /
analyzed: yang na bzlog ste /
translated: Or, the reverse is also possible.

original: sgro 'dogs pa ni chu yin la rnam par rtog pa ni yan lag can yin pa 'am /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa ni chu yin la rnam par rtog pa ni yan lag can yin pa 'am /
translated: The superimposition is water, and the conceptual thought is the whole.

original: gnyi gar gnyi ga yin no //
analyzed: gnyi gar gnyi ga yin no //
translated: Or, both are both.

original: tha dad pa dang sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam rtog dag res 'ga' dbang po las skyes pa'i mngon sum dang nye bar 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam rtog dag res 'ga' dbang po las skyes pa'i mngon sum dang nye bar 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conceptual thoughts of difference and superimposition sometimes engage with the direct perception that arises from the sense faculties.

original: nye bar 'jug pa de nyid ni 'dir 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nye bar 'jug pa de nyid ni 'dir 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That engagement is the cause of error in this context.

original: de nyid dam des 'khrul pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dam des 'khrul pa'i rgyu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is that itself or it causes error by means of that.

original: de 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa /
analyzed: de 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa /
translated: That is the cause of error.

original: de de'i dpe'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pa yin no //üîΩci ltar lkog tu gyur don can //
analyzed: de de'i dpe'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pa yin no // ci ltar lkog tu gyur don can //
translated: That is inferred by means of its example.üîΩHow is it that memory and so on

original: dran pa la sogs rtog pa 'di //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs rtog pa 'di //
translated: are conceptual thoughts that engage concealed objects?

original: brda la ltos pa'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: brda la ltos pa'i ngang tshul can //
translated: They are in the nature of relying on symbols.

original: mngon sum don la 'dzin mi byed /
analyzed: mngon sum don la 'dzin mi byed /
translated: They do not apprehend the object of direct perception.

original: de ltar nyams myong dran med par //
analyzed: de ltar nyams myong dran med par //
translated: In that way, without the experience of memory,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag la //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag la //
translated: in a pot and so on,

original: shes yong yin pas de yang ni //
analyzed: shes yong yin pas de yang ni //
translated: there is no knowledge, therefore that also

original: mngon sum las ni yongs nyams 'gyur //üîΩrjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum las ni yongs nyams 'gyur // rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa la ltos pa yin la /
translated: is completely lost from direct perception.üîΩConceptual thought is in the nature of relying on the apprehension of a connection.

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa nyid kyang brda yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa nyid kyang brda yin no //
translated: The apprehension of a connection is a symbol.

original: des na 'brel pa las lkog tu @4b gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa las lkog tu @4b gyur pa'i don rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not direct perception, because it is the understanding of a thing that is hidden from view by means of a relation.

original: mngon du byed pas ni der 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon du byed pas ni der 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is direct perception when there is direct experience.

original: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang dbang po gang yang rung ba cig gis gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de las lhag par gyur pa'i ro la sogs pa dag sngon gyi rjes su 'brangs nas dran pa yin no //üîΩro la sogs pa nyid dran pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang dbang po gang yang rung ba cig gis gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de las lhag par gyur pa'i ro la sogs pa dag sngon gyi rjes su 'brangs nas dran pa yin no // ro la sogs pa nyid dran pa yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, in the case of a pot, etc., when a certain sense faculty, such as the eye, etc., understands a certain thing, such as form, etc., then, on the basis of that, one remembers the other things, such as taste, etc., that are not directly experienced.

original: yan lag can ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can ni ma yin no zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the whole that is remembered, but only the taste, etc.

original: ro la sogs pa las tha dad par der mtshon pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro la sogs pa las tha dad par der mtshon pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because the whole is not perceived as distinct from the taste, etc.

original: dkar po gang yin pa de nyid rtsub mo yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i yul ni yan lag can yin no //
analyzed: dkar po gang yin pa de nyid rtsub mo yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i yul ni yan lag can yin no //
translated: The object that is understood as a unity, such as ‚Äúthe white rough cloth,‚Äù is the whole.

original: 'di ltar re zhig kha dog dang reg pa ni gcig nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig kha dog dang reg pa ni gcig nyid ma yin te /
translated: For, first of all, color and tactility are not one.

original: des na gal te yan lag can med na gcig tu rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na gal te yan lag can med na gcig tu rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if the possessor of parts does not exist, the cognition of unity would not occur.

original: gal te yan lag can yod pa de lta na yang kha dog dang reg pa la sogs pa gzhi mthun par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can yod pa de lta na yang kha dog dang reg pa la sogs pa gzhi mthun par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But even if the possessor of parts exists, how could color, tactility, etc., be the same substratum?

original: de dag gcig pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gcig pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not the same.

original: gzhi gcig pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi gcig pa'i phyir gcig nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are the same because they are the same substratum,

original: nye bar btags pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: then they would be mere designations.

original: 'di la nye bar btags pa'i rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di la nye bar btags pa'i rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: But there is no cognition of mere designations.

original: rtogs pa yod kyang nye bar btags pas ni yan lag can mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa yod kyang nye bar btags pas ni yan lag can mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even if there were cognition, the possessor of parts would not be established by designation,

original: de lta ma yin na yang nye bar btags nas gzhi mthun pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yang nye bar btags nas gzhi mthun pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even if it were not so, it would be possible to designate the same substratum.üîΩBecause of the same object,üîΩbecause of application to the same object,

original: yul gcig pa nyid yin phyir dang // don gcig la ni sbyor ba dang // de 'gyur na ni 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: yul gcig pa nyid yin phyir dang // don gcig la ni sbyor ba dang // de 'gyur na ni 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: and because of the transformation of one,

original: gcig tu tha snyad byed par 'dod //
analyzed: gcig tu tha snyad byed par 'dod //
translated: one is accepted as the designation.

original: reg bya'i yul gang yin pa de nyid gzugs kyi yin par rtogs te /
analyzed: reg bya'i yul gang yin pa de nyid gzugs kyi yin par rtogs te /
translated: The object of tactility is understood to be the object of form.

original: des na gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the attachment to their oneness is excessive.

original: chu la sogs pa 'dzin par reg bya'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid la gzugs kyi byed pa yang 'jug par rtogs shing reg pa mnyes par gyur pa na gzugs kyang sdud pa la sogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa 'dzin par reg bya'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid la gzugs kyi byed pa yang 'jug par rtogs shing reg pa mnyes par gyur pa na gzugs kyang sdud pa la sogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: The effect of the tactile object, which is the grasping of water, etc., is also recognized as the operation of form. When the tactile object is pleasant, form also is pleasant, such as in the case of a pleasant touch. Therefore,

original: 'di gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du lhag par zhen te //
analyzed: 'di gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du lhag par zhen te //
translated: the attachment to the convention ‚Äúthis is one‚Äù is excessive.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa las de dag gzhi tha dad par tha dad yin na de de las tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa las de dag gzhi tha dad par tha dad yin na de de las tha dad par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are different from form, etc., they would be perceived as different from it.

original: ma rtogs na ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can med pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rtogs na ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can med pa yin no //
translated: If they are not perceived, then they do not have the characteristic of being perceived.

original: ci ste yan lag can med na phan tshun ci ste ma 'gyes she na /
analyzed: ci ste yan lag can med na phan tshun ci ste ma 'gyes she na /
translated: If the whole does not exist, why are they not dispersed?

original: yan lag can ni yod na yang //
analyzed: yan lag can ni yod na yang //
translated: Even if the whole exists,

original: de gsum ci ste gyes ma 'gyur //
analyzed: de gsum ci ste gyes ma 'gyur //
translated: why are they not dispersed?

original: 'phro 'du'i 'brel stobs las she na //
analyzed: 'phro 'du'i 'brel stobs las she na //
translated: Because of the power of the connection of the whole, they are not dispersed.

original: de yang @5a * //
analyzed: de yang @5a * //
translated: But that connection

original: bye bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: bye bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: is also dispersed.

original: 'di nyid rang bzhin yin zhe na //
analyzed: 'di nyid rang bzhin yin zhe na //
translated: If you say that this is the nature of the parts,

original: 'di nyid dang por brjod par bya //üîΩrang gi rgyu las gzugs sogs kyi //
analyzed: 'di nyid dang por brjod par bya // rang gi rgyu las gzugs sogs kyi //
translated: This should be stated first.üîΩThe intrinsic reality of form and so on

original: rang bzhin 'di yin 'thad par ldan //üîΩ'phrod par 'du ba rtag pa la //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di yin 'thad par ldan // 'phrod par 'du ba rtag pa la //
translated: is tenable as derived from its own cause.üîΩBut how could it be tenable

original: de ltar bsam pa ga la yod //
analyzed: de ltar bsam pa ga la yod //
translated: that the permanent is conjoined?üîΩIf the possessor of parts is different, then in that case it would be a third.

original: gal te yan lag can gzhan yod na de lta na yang gsum par gyur pa yin zhe na gsum po yang phan tshun ci ste mi gyes /
analyzed: gal te yan lag can gzhan yod na de lta na yang gsum par gyur pa yin zhe na gsum po yang phan tshun ci ste mi gyes /
translated: But why would the three not separate?

original: ci ste mi gyes pa'i rgyu 'phrod pa 'du ba yin na /
analyzed: ci ste mi gyes pa'i rgyu 'phrod pa 'du ba yin na /
translated: If the cause of their nonseparation is their conjunction,

original: de yang ci ste mi gyes /
analyzed: de yang ci ste mi gyes /
translated: why would that not separate?

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba yang lan ma yin te /
translated: It is not a response to say, ‚ÄúIts intrinsic reality is just that.‚Äù

original: de ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la sogs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin par 'gyur mod /
translated: That would be the intrinsic reality of form and so on.

original: don gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: don gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the point of positing another object?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de ni rang gi rgyu las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de ni rang gi rgyu las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The intrinsic reality of form and so on is derived from its own cause.

original: de ni rig pa dang ldan gyi 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu med pa la rang bzhin de yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni rig pa dang ldan gyi 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rgyu med pa la rang bzhin de yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: It is tenable that it is endowed with awareness. But how could that intrinsic reality exist without a cause of conjunction?

original: gang gis de ltar 'phrod pa 'du ba rang bzhin de ni 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rten gyi rang gi rgyu las byung ba yin no//üîΩzhe na ; de ltar brgyud pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /üîΩgang gis 'phrod pa 'du bas de dag mi 'gyes par byed pa'ang gi rgyu las de dag nyid de 'gyur ba yin la /üîΩde'i rgyu nyid mi 'gyes par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /üîΩ'di'i mchog pa ci zhig yod na gang gi don du brgyud pa 'dod /üîΩde lta bu nyid du mthong ngo zhe na ;üîΩmthong ba gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir gal te mthong na ni 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar 'phrod pa 'du ba rang bzhin de ni 'phrod pa 'du ba'i rten gyi rang gi rgyu las byung ba yin no// zhe na ; de ltar brgyud pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste / gang gis 'phrod pa 'du bas de dag mi 'gyes par byed pa'ang gi rgyu las de dag nyid de 'gyur ba yin la / de'i rgyu nyid mi 'gyes par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir / 'di'i mchog pa ci zhig yod na gang gi don du brgyud pa 'dod / de lta bu nyid du mthong ngo zhe na ; mthong ba gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir gal te mthong na ni 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: The collection of causes that produces the contact of the eye with form, etc. is the cause of the contact of the eye with form, etc.üîΩWhat is the use of this extended discussion?üîΩThe cause of the contact of the eye with form, etc. is the cause of the non-separation of those that are separated.üîΩThe cause of the non-separation of those that are separated is the cause of the contact of the eye with form, etc.üîΩWhat is the use of this extended discussion?üîΩIf you see it in this way,üîΩthen you cannot deny that the cause of the contact of the eye with form, etc. is the cause of the non-separation of those that are separated.üîΩIf you see it in this way, then you cannot deny that the cause of the non-separation of those that are separated is the cause of the contact of the eye with form, etc.

original: mthong ba ni phan tshun 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid yin gyi de las lhag pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ni de dag nyid kyi rang bzhin du brtag go //
analyzed: mthong ba ni phan tshun 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid yin gyi de las lhag pa ni med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ni de dag nyid kyi rang bzhin du brtag go //

original: de'i phyir yan lag can du lhag par sgro btags pa ni mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag can du lhag par sgro btags pa ni mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the superimposition of a whole is not direct perception.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i rigs pa rgyas par bstan pa'i don du dpe dang don nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i rigs pa rgyas par bstan pa'i don du dpe dang don nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the reasoning extensively, the example and meaning are set forth.

original: rab rib bcas smos pa ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: rab rib bcas smos pa ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of mentioning ‚Äúwith cataracts‚Äù?

original: rab rib las byung ba yang rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes kha cig zer bas de bzlog pa'i phyir de smos so //
analyzed: rab rib las byung ba yang rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes kha cig zer bas de bzlog pa'i phyir de smos so //
translated: Some say that even what arises from cataracts is conceptual, so that is mentioned in order to refute that.

original: de lta ma yin na dran pa la sogs pa smos pas 'di yang zin pa'i phyir logs shig tu bkod pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dran pa la sogs pa smos pas 'di yang zin pa'i phyir logs shig tu bkod pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then since memory and so on are mentioned, it would be pointless to set it forth separately, since it would already be included.

original: gal te rtog pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rtog pa med pa yin na /
translated: If it is without conceptuality,

original: rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then because it is free from conceptuality, it would be direct perception.

original: rtog pa dang bral lo cog ni mngon sum ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral lo cog ni mngon sum ma yin gyi /
translated: Not all that is free from conceptuality is direct perception,

original: 'on kyang ma 'khrul par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ma 'khrul par gyur pa'o //
translated: but rather it is nonerroneous.

original: rtog pa dang @5b bral ba ma 'khrul ba mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: rtog pa dang @5b bral ba ma 'khrul ba mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: That which is free from conceptuality and nonerroneous is direct perception,

original: thams cad ni ma yin te 'di ltar /
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin te 'di ltar /
translated: but not all of it is.

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i yul brtags te //
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba'i yul brtags te //
translated: And examine the specific objects.üîΩ

original: de dang bral ba la spyir btang ba 'jug go //
analyzed: de dang bral ba la spyir btang ba 'jug go //
translated: The general rule is applied to the case where there is no exception.

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the exception?

original: 'dir ni bzhi pa dmigs bsal te //
analyzed: 'dir ni bzhi pa dmigs bsal te //
translated: Here the fourth is the exception.

original: des ni nyer gnod las skyes brjod //
analyzed: des ni nyer gnod las skyes brjod //
translated: It is said to arise from the impairment of the sense faculty.

original: de lta rab rib 'ba' zhig ni //
analyzed: de lta rab rib 'ba' zhig ni //
translated: In that way, only cataracts

original: nyer gnod mtshon par byed pa yin //
analyzed: nyer gnod mtshon par byed pa yin //
translated: are the illustrators of impairment.

original: rtog pa gsum las bzhi pa rab rib las byung ba smos pa ni dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa gsum las bzhi pa rab rib las byung ba smos pa ni dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: From among the three types of conceptions, the fourth, which arises from cataracts, is mentioned as the exception.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba spyis mngon sum du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba spyis mngon sum du 'gyur ba /
translated: The statement ‚Äúfree from conception‚Äù is the general rule, which is direct perception.

original: rab rib bcas zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis mngon sum ltar snang bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rab rib bcas zhes bya ba'i khyad par gyis mngon sum ltar snang bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúwith cataracts‚Äù is the exception, which is a semblance of direct perception.

original: khyad par brjod pa ni spyi brjod pa'i gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par brjod pa ni spyi brjod pa'i gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The statement of the exception is the refutation of the statement of the general rule.

original: 'di la tshad ma gang yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma gang yod ce na /
translated: What is the valid knowledge in this case?

original: spyir rtogs pa ni khyad par rtogs pas gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: spyir rtogs pa ni khyad par rtogs pas gnod pa yin te /
translated: In general, the realization of the general is refuted by the realization of the particular.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / mi mthun phyogs la sngar ma mthong //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mi mthun phyogs la sngar ma mthong //
translated: Previously unseen in the discordant class,

original: tsam gyis rtog pa dang bral las //üîΩgang tshe lhag ma dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: tsam gyis rtog pa dang bral las // gang tshe lhag ma dang ldan pa'i //
translated: But the mere word does not free us from conceptualization.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'jug byed pa //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'jug byed pa //
translated: When there is an inference that is incomplete,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur de la //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur de la //
translated: then there is an absurd consequence,

original: gsal bar khyad par gnod byed yin //
analyzed: gsal bar khyad par gnod byed yin //
translated: and the explicit statement is contradicted.

original: des na de las gzhan nyid la //
analyzed: des na de las gzhan nyid la //
translated: Therefore, in the case of something other than that,

original: snga ma de ni 'jug byed nyid //üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs la sngar ma mthong ba tsam gyis spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum mam /
analyzed: snga ma de ni 'jug byed nyid // mi mthun pa'i phyogs la sngar ma mthong ba tsam gyis spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum mam /
translated: the former is the one that is operative.

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis gnod par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis gnod par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that an inference based on a general rule is not contradicted by perception or another inference, just because one has not seen a counterexample in the past.

original: des ni spyi dang khyad par dag la gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pa yin la /
analyzed: des ni spyi dang khyad par dag la gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yin pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, perception establishes that universals and particulars are the objects of contradiction and noncontradiction,

original: don de ston pa'i tshig dag gi gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: don de ston pa'i tshig dag gi gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po yang de nyid yin no //
translated: and the words that express those objects are also the means of contradiction and noncontradiction.

original: 'o na slob dpon ci'i phyir spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa las mtshan nyid 'chad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na slob dpon ci'i phyir spyir mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa las mtshan nyid 'chad ce na /
translated: Well, why does the master state the definition of inference for oneself in general after inference for others?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, he does not.

original: slob dpon gyis ni khyad par du mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa nyid bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni khyad par du mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa nyid bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The master accepts that inference for oneself is just inference that is nonerroneous with regard to a specific object.

original: de'i don gang yin pa de ni tshig gcig gis bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i don gang yin pa de ni tshig gcig gis bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the meaning of that cannot be taught in one statement,

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bas te brjod do //
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bas te brjod do //
translated: he states it by way of an exception.

original: 'o na spyi'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa dang / lhan cig tu ma 'khrul pa smos pa ma byas /
analyzed: 'o na spyi'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba smos pa dang / lhan cig tu ma 'khrul pa smos pa ma byas /
translated: Well, if inference for others is nonerroneous with regard to a general object, why does he not state ‚Äúfree from conceptuality‚Äù and ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù together?

original: glang po che'i 'khrul khas blangs pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: glang po che'i 'khrul khas blangs pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: What is to be done about the elephant‚Äôs trunk?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, he does not.

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba rab rib bcas pa smos pas ma 'khrul pa smos pa'i don thob bam /
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba rab rib bcas pa smos pas ma 'khrul pa smos pa'i don thob bam /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnonerroneous‚Äù is obtained by stating the exception ‚Äúwith visual aberration.‚Äù

original: gzhan du yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan du yang rung ste /
translated: It is also suitable to state it elsewhere.

original: khyad par ci yod /üîΩrtog pa dang @6a * //
analyzed: khyad par ci yod / rtog pa dang @6a * //
translated: What is the difference?

original: bral ba smos pa'i de ma thag pa nyid kyis thob po zhe na /
analyzed: bral ba smos pa'i de ma thag pa nyid kyis thob po zhe na /
translated: It is obtained immediately by stating ‚Äúfree from conceptuality.‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: don du mtshungs pa ma yin pa dag la de ma thag pa rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: don du mtshungs pa ma yin pa dag la de ma thag pa rgyu ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that what is not similar is an antecedent condition.

original: tshad ma'i yul gyi gnod bya gnod byed kyi ngo bo yang ci nas bstan par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar byas so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul gyi gnod bya gnod byed kyi ngo bo yang ci nas bstan par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir de ltar byas so //
translated: And it is in order to show that the object of a valid cognition is the object that is damaged or undamaged by another valid cognition that this is done.

original: gnod par byed pa ni gdon mi za bar de ma thag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa ni gdon mi za bar de ma thag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: For it is not necessarily the case that what damages is immediately antecedent.

original: de ci'i phyir ma 'khrul pa nyid smos par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir ma 'khrul pa nyid smos par mi byed ce na /
translated: Why is non-error not mentioned?

original: de ni bden te /
analyzed: de ni bden te /
translated: That is true,

original: mngon sum ni mngon du byed pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni mngon du byed pa yin la /
translated: but direct perception is the manifestation of an object.

original: de yang ma 'khrul pa smos pas bstan par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma 'khrul pa smos pas bstan par nus pa yin no //
translated: And that can be shown by mentioning non-error.

original: mngon du byed pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa ni ma 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa ni ma 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which is not the mode of manifestation is not non-erroneous,

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is conceptual is erroneous.üîΩBut others maintain that even that which is conceptual is non-erroneous in the mode of manifestation.

original: pha rol dag ni rtog pa dang bcas pas kyang mngon du byed pa'i rnam pa ma 'khrul pa 'dod pas de'i dbang du byas nas 'di gnyis brjod do //
analyzed: pha rol dag ni rtog pa dang bcas pas kyang mngon du byed pa'i rnam pa ma 'khrul pa 'dod pas de'i dbang du byas nas 'di gnyis brjod do //
translated: So, from their point of view, these two are mentioned.

original: de skad du yang gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas mtshan nyid khyad par du byas so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas mtshan nyid khyad par du byas so zhes bshad do //
translated: In this way, the definition is distinguished in terms of the other system.

original: thams cad kyang rnam par rtog pa mad pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rnam par rtog pa mad pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: All of these are just conceptualizations.üîΩMoreover,

original: yang na / gnod bya dang ni gnod byed kyi //
analyzed: yang na / gnod bya dang ni gnod byed kyi //
translated: the entire method of refutation and that which is to be refuted

original: tshul kun rtog pa po la ltos //
analyzed: tshul kun rtog pa po la ltos //
translated: depends on the conceptualizer.

original: gnod byed mthong ba med pas sngar //
analyzed: gnod byed mthong ba med pas sngar //
translated: Since the refutation is not seen,

original: spyi nyid du ni rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: spyi nyid du ni rtogs pa yin //
translated: the universal itself is first understood.

original: 'dir khyad par bzhed pa yin no zhes slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ma shes pa /
analyzed: 'dir khyad par bzhed pa yin no zhes slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ma shes pa /
translated: Here, the master‚Äôs intention is that the distinction is accepted.

original: gnod byed byed pa mthong ba las phyis khyad par de yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod byed byed pa mthong ba las phyis khyad par de yang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the refutation is seen, later the distinction is understood.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig la ni tshad ma'i rtsa ba nyid med pa'i phyir gnod bya gnod byed yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig la ni tshad ma'i rtsa ba nyid med pa'i phyir gnod bya gnod byed yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the words of the Buddha are not produced by a person, they are not refuted and do not refute.

original: skyes bus byas pa la ni sngar gyi blo 'khrul pa tshad ma'i rtsa ba can gyi blo phyi mas shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa la ni sngar gyi blo 'khrul pa tshad ma'i rtsa ba can gyi blo phyi mas shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since those produced by a person are the root of valid knowledge, the later mind that is the root of valid knowledge understands the previous erroneous mind.

original: rig byed las ni blo 'khrul pa yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: rig byed las ni blo 'khrul pa yang mi skye'o //
translated: But the Vedas do not produce a deluded mind.

original: de lta na ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: If that were so, they would not be a valid cognition,

original: thams cad de lta bu yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de lta bu yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that everything would be like that.

original: gnod pa med na tshad ma nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa med na tshad ma nyid do zhe na /
translated: If there is no contradiction, they are a valid cognition.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: brtags na don gzhan nyid do zhes phyis yang gnod par byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags na don gzhan nyid do zhes phyis yang gnod par byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because later, when examined, it is possible to contradict them, saying that they are something else.

original: de lta bu ni tshad ma la yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu ni tshad ma la yang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, they would be a valid cognition.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: tshad ma ni brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ni brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a valid cognition is stable.

original: de lta yin dang rig byed smra ba dag gis tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i lung spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rig byed smra ba dag gis tshad ma dang 'gal ba'i lung spangs pa yin te /
translated: If that were so, the proponents of the Vedas would have abandoned scriptures that contradict valid cognition,

original: de lta ma yin na don brjod pa bshad pa rgyu mtshan med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don brjod pa bshad pa rgyu mtshan med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because otherwise the explanation of the expression of meaning would be without a reason.

original: des na gnod bya gnod byed ni @6b skyes bus byas pa'i tshig kho na la yin no //
analyzed: des na gnod bya gnod byed ni @6b skyes bus byas pa'i tshig kho na la yin no //
translated: Therefore the object of contradiction and the means of contradiction are only the words of a person.

original: rab rib bcas zhes bya ba nyid gnod par byed pa yin gyi mig ser la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rab rib bcas zhes bya ba nyid gnod par byed pa yin gyi mig ser la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The word ‚Äúwith‚Äù is the actual refutation, not ‚Äújaundiced‚Äù and so on.

original: bshad pa des ni nye bar gnod pa las skyes pa thams cad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa des ni nye bar gnod pa las skyes pa thams cad brjod pa yin no //
translated: This explanation applies to all cases of impairment.

original: rab rib ni nye bar gnod pa mtshon pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab rib ni nye bar gnod pa mtshon pa yin gyi /
translated: ‚Äú Jaundiced‚Äù is an example of impairment.

original: nye bar gnod pa gzhan bzlog pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'di ltar / rab rib don gyis stong nyid kyis //
analyzed: nye bar gnod pa gzhan bzlog pa ni ma yin no // 'di ltar / rab rib don gyis stong nyid kyis //
translated: It is not a refutation of other impairments.üîΩThus:

original: mngon du byed nyid ma yin phyir //
analyzed: mngon du byed nyid ma yin phyir //
translated: Because the object of the jaundiced eye is not perceived by the absence of jaundice,

original: mngon sum ltar snang bar bsams te //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang bar bsams te //
translated: it is thought to be a case of apparent perception,

original: mngon sum nyid ni bsal bar byas //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ni bsal bar byas //
translated: but perception itself is refuted.

original: don gyis stong pa de ni mig ser gyi stobs bdo bas mig gi stobs 'gribs pa dag gi shes pa la yang cha tsam yang ma god par yod do //
analyzed: don gyis stong pa de ni mig ser gyi stobs bdo bas mig gi stobs 'gribs pa dag gi shes pa la yang cha tsam yang ma god par yod do //
translated: The object of the jaundiced eye is not perceived by the absence of jaundice, because the object of the jaundiced eye exists without the slightest impairment in the consciousness of those whose eyes are affected by jaundice, due to the strength of the jaundice and the weakness of the eyes.

original: des na rig pa smra ba dag gis rab rib bcas zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: des na rig pa smra ba dag gis rab rib bcas zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the logicians should understand that the word ‚Äúwith‚Äù is an example.

original: rab rib ni nye bar gnod pa ma lus pa mtshon par byed pa'o //üîΩgzhan dag na re /üîΩ'di ni rtog pa dang bral ba mos pa'i bzlog pa'i dpe yin gyi /
analyzed: rab rib ni nye bar gnod pa ma lus pa mtshon par byed pa'o // gzhan dag na re / 'di ni rtog pa dang bral ba mos pa'i bzlog pa'i dpe yin gyi /
translated: The eye disease is the cause of the false perception of the hairs.

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: But others say that the example of the eye disease is not a counterexample to the thesis that the mind is free from conceptualization.

original: de la bshad pa ni /üîΩde yang yid kyi zhes kha cig //
analyzed: de la bshad pa ni / de yang yid kyi zhes kha cig //
translated: The author replies:

original: sdo dang zla gnyis la sogs blo'i //üîΩdbang po'ang rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: sdo dang zla gnyis la sogs blo'i // dbang po'ang rgyu yin zhes bya ba'i //
translated: Some say that the eye disease is the cause of the false perception of the hairs.

original: gzhung 'di dang ni de dag 'gal //
analyzed: gzhung 'di dang ni de dag 'gal //
translated: But this contradicts the treatise, which says that the cause of the false perception of the hairs is the eye faculty itself.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa ltar yid nyid yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di ni smig rgyu la chur shes pa ltar yid nyid yin no //
translated: The cognition of the two moons, etc., is mental, like the cognition of water in a mirage.

original: 'di ltar smig rgyu dag la dang por ni dbang po'i shes pa ma 'khrul pa nyid skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar smig rgyu dag la dang por ni dbang po'i shes pa ma 'khrul pa nyid skye la /
translated: For in the case of a mirage, first of all, a nonerroneous sense consciousness arises.

original: phyis chu nyams su myong ba'i bag chags sad pa las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas chur shes pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis chu nyams su myong ba'i bag chags sad pa las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pas chur shes pa yin no //
translated: Then, from the activation of the latent potentialities of the experience of water, there arises a conceptual consciousness that apprehends water.

original: sad pa de yang smig rgyu mthong ba nyid las yin te /
analyzed: sad pa de yang smig rgyu mthong ba nyid las yin te /
translated: And the activation of the latent potentialities is due to the perception of the mirage.

original: 'dra ba la brten pa'i smig rgyu ni de lta bu'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba la brten pa'i smig rgyu ni de lta bu'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mirage based on a reflection is an example of this.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang dang po ni zla ba'i yul can ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang dang po ni zla ba'i yul can ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, here the first cognition is nonerroneous with respect to the object, the moon.

original: phyis ni zla ba gnyis kyi rnam pa can rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: phyis ni zla ba gnyis kyi rnam pa can rtog pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Later, the cognition is erroneous with respect to the object, the moon.

original: de la kha cig na re /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:

original: g-yo ba med pa'i mig gnyis kyi dbus na gnas pa'i zla ba de nyid zur gnyis su rim gyis dmigs pa na dus phra ba'i phyir cig car bzhin du mtshon pa yin la /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i mig gnyis kyi dbus na gnas pa'i zla ba de nyid zur gnyis su rim gyis dmigs pa na dus phra ba'i phyir cig car bzhin du mtshon pa yin la /
translated: The moon, which is located between the two unmoving eyes, is gradually apprehended in two parts, but because the time is subtle, it is as if it is apprehended at once.

original: zur gnyis su gnyis ni sgro btags pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zur gnyis su gnyis ni sgro btags pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The two parts are superimposed as one.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They say:

original: dbang po rnam par reg pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: dbang po rnam par reg pa'i rgyu //
translated: The cause of the contact of the sense faculty

original: phra rab rdul dag yin mod kyi //üîΩder mi snang phyir de yul ni //
analyzed: phra rab rdul dag yin mod kyi // der mi snang phyir de yul ni //
translated: is the subtle particles.üîΩBut because the object does not appear as particles,

original: rdul phran ma yin dbang po bzhin //
analyzed: rdul phran ma yin dbang po bzhin //
translated: the object is not particles, like the sense faculty.

original: de lta bu 'am rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de dag nyid zla ba gnyis @7a * //
analyzed: de lta bu 'am rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa'i mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de dag nyid zla ba gnyis @7a * //
translated: Or else, the atoms of the eye, etc., which have become such or have changed in some other way, are the cause of the appearance of two moons and of blue, etc.

original: dang ; sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: dang ; sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhung dang 'gal lo //
translated: This contradicts the treatise.

original: zla ba gnyis su snang ba yid yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su snang ba yid yin no //
translated: The appearance of two moons is mental.

original: dbang po'i rgyu yin par brjod mi nus so //
analyzed: dbang po'i rgyu yin par brjod mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be said that the eye is the cause.

original: ci ste yid yin yang brgyud pas dbang po rgyu yin par mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: ci ste yid yin yang brgyud pas dbang po rgyu yin par mi 'gal lo //
translated: Even if it is mental, it is not contradictory that the eye is the cause indirectly.

original: dngos su dbang po rgyu yin na ni /
analyzed: dngos su dbang po rgyu yin na ni /
translated: If the eye were the direct cause,

original: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa yid yin par 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa yid yin par 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: it would contradict that the cognition of two moons is mental.

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: The response to that is this:

original: gal te brgyud pas rgyu yin na //
analyzed: gal te brgyud pas rgyu yin na //
translated: If it is the cause indirectly,

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul dag / dpyad pa 'di la yid kyi ni //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul dag / dpyad pa 'di la yid kyi ni //
translated: in this analysis of the object of the eye consciousness,

original: skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: how is it the occasion of the mental?

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gang yin zhes brgal zhing brtags pa na /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gang yin zhes brgal zhing brtags pa na /
translated: When the analysis and investigation is ‚ÄúWhat is the object of the eye consciousness?‚Äù

original: de'i rnam pa can nam gzhan du dngos su gang las dbang po'i shes pa skye'o zhes pha rol gyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can nam gzhan du dngos su gang las dbang po'i shes pa skye'o zhes pha rol gyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: The opponent must say something.

original: re zhig de'i rnam pa can nyid kyis ni yul nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig de'i rnam pa can nyid kyis ni yul nyid ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not the object itself that has the aspect of that,

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is impossible.

original: rdul phra rab dag la ril po gcig gi rnam pa rags pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag la ril po gcig gi rnam pa rags pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a coarse, single aspect does not exist in the subtle particles.

original: ci ste / de'i rnam pa can ma yin yang rgyu gang yin pa de yul yin na /
analyzed: ci ste / de'i rnam pa can ma yin yang rgyu gang yin pa de yul yin na /
translated: But if the cause of that is the object, even though it does not have the aspect of that,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that is also untenable.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin na dbang po bzhin du yul ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin na dbang po bzhin du yul ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If it is the cause of a consciousness that has a different aspect, then like the sense faculty, it is not the object.

original: de la gal te slob dpon brgyud pas rgyu yin par dgongs na /üîΩde'i tshe de lta bu'am /
analyzed: de la gal te slob dpon brgyud pas rgyu yin par dgongs na / de'i tshe de lta bu'am /
translated: If the master intended that the continuum of the cause is the object,üîΩthen at that time, he would not use the words ‚Äúin that way‚Äù or ‚Äúin another way,‚Äù etc.,

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis gzhan la dbang po yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba mi mdzad de /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis gzhan la dbang po yul nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba mi mdzad de /
