translated: because it would follow that the other, the sense faculty, would be the object.

original: rdul phra rab dag dngos su rgyu yin na yul yin par gzhan gyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag dngos su rgyu yin na yul yin par gzhan gyis brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If subtle particles are the actual cause, they are the object, as others have stated.

original: 'o na ni thal ba nyid mi rigs so zhes brjod par bya'o //üîΩ'di la yid kyi ni /
analyzed: 'o na ni thal ba nyid mi rigs so zhes brjod par bya'o // 'di la yid kyi ni /
translated: But then it is illogical to state that they are the object of the sense consciousnesses.

original: skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes brjod pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin // zhes brjod pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: What is the point of stating that the mental consciousnessüîΩis the object of the sense consciousnesses?

original: bsam pa ni /
analyzed: bsam pa ni /
translated: The intention of the statement is as follows:üîΩThe subtle particles that are mutually exclusive

original: rdul phran phan tshun dben pa dag / dang po so sor snang ba yin //
analyzed: rdul phran phan tshun dben pa dag / dang po so sor snang ba yin //
translated: appear individually at first.

original: rnam par rtag pa'i shes pa las //
analyzed: rnam par rtag pa'i shes pa las //
translated: From the consciousness that conceives them,

original: ril po'i rnam par snang bar 'gyur //üîΩgzhan dag na re /
analyzed: ril po'i rnam par snang bar 'gyur // gzhan dag na re /
translated: the appearance of a whole arises.

original: ril po gcig tu snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa yin la /
analyzed: ril po gcig tu snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa yin la /
translated: Others say: The appearance as a single whole is a conceptual consciousness.

original: rdul phra rab de dag ni brgyud pas de'i yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir yul yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag ni brgyud pas de'i yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir yul yin te /
translated: Since those subtle particles are the indirect cause of that, they are the object,

original: dper na dran pa'i yul don yin pa bzhin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: dper na dran pa'i yul don yin pa bzhin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: just as the object of memory is the object of the memory consciousness.

original: slob dpon gyis /üîΩder mi snang phyir de yul ni //üîΩrdul phran ma yin dbang po bzhin //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis / der mi snang phyir de yul ni // rdul phran ma yin dbang po bzhin //
translated: The master ≈öƒÅntarak·π£ita says:üîΩThey are not objects because they do not appear to that consciousness,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: like the sense faculties.

original: dper na dbang po brgyud par rgyu nyid yin yang yul ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na dbang po brgyud par rgyu nyid yin yang yul ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, the eye sense faculty is the cause in the continuum of the eye sense faculty, but it is not the object.

original: rdul phra rab dag kyang yin no //üîΩgzhan du gyur pa'i dbang po ni //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dag kyang yin no // gzhan du gyur pa'i dbang po ni //
translated: In the same way, the atoms are the cause in the continuum of the atoms.

original: @7b zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa'i brgyud pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: @7b zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa'i brgyud pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The eye sense faculty that has changed is the cause in the continuum of the consciousness.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: The author responds:

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul dag / dpyad par 'di la yid kyis ni //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul dag / dpyad par 'di la yid kyis ni //
translated: In this analysis of the object-field of the sense consciousness,

original: skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: how can the mind be the object-field?

original: yid nyid yin na ni yul dpyad pa legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yid nyid yin na ni yul dpyad pa legs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the mind is the object-field, it is not a good object-field,

original: yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no object-field.

original: de ltar yang 'di la tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi la rigs par brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'di la tshad ma cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi la rigs par brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Since there is not the slightest valid cognition in this regard, the master has stated a principle.

original: thal bar 'gyur bas brtsad pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde nyid brjod pa yid kyi ni //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur bas brtsad pa ni ma yin no // de nyid brjod pa yid kyi ni //
translated: This is not a debate in which a consequence is stated.üîΩThe author responds:üîΩHow can the mind be the object-field

original: skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: in this analysis of the object-field?

original: gzhan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan brjod pa ni /
translated: The author responds:

original: gal te zla ba gnyis kyis shes pa la sogs pa yid la dbang po'i rgyur brjod na ni /
analyzed: gal te zla ba gnyis kyis shes pa la sogs pa yid la dbang po'i rgyur brjod na ni /
translated: If the cognition of two moons, etc. is said to be the cause of the mental faculty,

original: de'i tshe yid nyid kyi yul dpyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yid nyid kyi yul dpyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the object of the mental faculty would be analyzed.

original: des na skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba lan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na skabs su ji ltar 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba lan yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could it be the case? This is the reply.

original: de ni mi 'thad do zhes bstan zin to //üîΩdbang rten gang yin gal te gang //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad do zhes bstan zin to // dbang rten gang yin gal te gang //
translated: That is not tenable, as has already been explained.üîΩIf the support of the faculty is that

original: dbang po yod med rjes 'jug can //
analyzed: dbang po yod med rjes 'jug can //
translated: which follows the presence or absence of the faculty,

original: de mtshungs gal te ldan 'gyur na //
analyzed: de mtshungs gal te ldan 'gyur na //
translated: if it were to be the same,üîΩwhy is it refuted here?

original: de 'di nyid na ci phyir 'gog / re zhig gal te zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di yid yin na ni /
analyzed: de 'di nyid na ci phyir 'gog / re zhig gal te zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di yid yin na ni /
translated: First, if this cognition of two moons, etc. were the mental faculty,

original: dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not follow the presence or absence of the faculty.

original: gal te dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug kyang de yid yin na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'jug kyang de yid yin na /
translated: Even if it follows the presence or absence of the faculty, if it is the mental faculty,

original: de lta na ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yang yid du thal lo //
analyzed: de lta na ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa yang yid du thal lo //
translated: then it would follow that the cognition of a pillar, etc. is also the mental faculty.

original: dang po ni rang gi rnam pa nyid shes la /
analyzed: dang po ni rang gi rnam pa nyid shes la /
translated: The first [cognition] cognizes its own aspect,

original: phyi'i don gyi rnam pa yid la snang ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi'i don gyi rnam pa yid la snang ba yin no //
translated: The form of an external object appears to the mind.

original: ci ste 'di la tshad ma med do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di la tshad ma med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no valid cognition in this case,

original: de lta na ni zla ba gnyis su snang ba yang yin pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni zla ba gnyis su snang ba yang yin pa'i phyir mtshungs so //
translated: then the appearance of two moons is the same.

original: ci ste gang zhig dbang po 'gyur bas 'gyur ba de dbang po la brten pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste gang zhig dbang po 'gyur bas 'gyur ba de dbang po la brten pa yin na /
translated: If something changes due to a change in the sense faculty,

original: de'i tshe yid nyid dbang po la brten par thal lo //
analyzed: de'i tshe yid nyid dbang po la brten par thal lo //
translated: then it follows that the mind itself is based on the sense faculty.

original: dbang po la brten pa yang 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa yang 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that what is based on the sense faculty changes,

original: 'o na gnyi ga yang dbang po las byung bar thal lo //
analyzed: 'o na gnyi ga yang dbang po las byung bar thal lo //
translated: then it follows that both are derived from the sense faculty.

original: dngos su'o zhe na /
analyzed: dngos su'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is directly,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: gzhan la 'gyur ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la 'gyur ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a change in the other is not seen.

original: 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas de yang rnam par 'gyur ba shes par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i rjes su 'brangs nas de yang rnam par 'gyur ba shes par bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is understood to change following that,

original: de yang yid nyid de ;
analyzed: de yang yid nyid de ;
translated: then that is the mind itself.

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di bzhin no zhes thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di bzhin no zhes thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it changes, it is like this. There is an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir 'di nyid dbang po las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyid dbang po las skyes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is produced from the sense faculty.

original: 'di yang sprul sogs 'khrul pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'di yang sprul sogs 'khrul pa bzhin //
translated: This is like the error of a double moon, etc.

original: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod na yang //üîΩldog 'gyur dbang po'i bslad pa ni //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod na yang // ldog 'gyur dbang po'i bslad pa ni //
translated: Even though there is a change in the sense organ,üîΩthe error of the sense organ does not cease.üîΩEven if the error is eliminated,

original: log kyang ldog par mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: log kyang ldog par mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: it is not eliminated.

original: de bzhin gzhan @8a * //üîΩgyi rgyu la ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan @8a * // gyi rgyu la ni //
translated: In the same way,üîΩsometimes the expression of another

original: brjod pa dag gis 'ga' tshe 'jog /
analyzed: brjod pa dag gis 'ga' tshe 'jog /
translated: depends on the cause.

original: mthong ba dran pa ltos 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: mthong ba dran pa ltos 'gyur zhing //
translated: If the memory of what was seen

original: yongs su gsal bar snang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar snang mi 'gyur //
translated: depends on the eye, it will not be clear.

original: gal te zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo yid yin na /
analyzed: gal te zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo yid yin na /
translated: If the cognition of a double moon, etc. is mental,

original: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod kyang log par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod kyang log par 'gyur ro //
translated: even though there is a change in the sense organ, it will be eliminated.

original: sbrul du 'khrul pa ni dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod kyang rnam par dpyad na ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sbrul du 'khrul pa ni dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod kyang rnam par dpyad na ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The error of a snake, even though there is a change in the sense organ, is eliminated when it is analyzed.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the error of a double moon, etc. is not.

original: ci ste nag po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can sbrul du 'khrul pa yang mi ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci ste nag po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can sbrul du 'khrul pa yang mi ldog pa nyid do //
translated: But the error of a snake, which has the characteristic of blackness, etc. is not eliminated.

original: sbrul du 'khrul pa ni mun pa dang bcas pa'i phyir su yin no //
analyzed: sbrul du 'khrul pa ni mun pa dang bcas pa'i phyir su yin no //
translated: The error of a snake is not eliminated because it is associated with darkness.

original: de la thag pa la sogs pa nag po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can ni rab rib med kyang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la thag pa la sogs pa nag po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin can ni rab rib med kyang yod pa yin no //
translated: The nature of a rope, etc., which is black, etc., exists even when there is no eye disease.

original: mig rab rib dang bral te gzhan du gyur kyang nag po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig rab rib dang bral te gzhan du gyur kyang nag po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of black, etc., does not exist even when the eye is free from disease and has been transformed.

original: de mig rnam par 'gyur ba yod na yang ldog par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de mig rnam par 'gyur ba yod na yang ldog par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could that be reversed even when the eye is transformed?

original: des na ldog pa ma grub byed du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ldog pa ma grub byed du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the reversal be established?

original: dbang po'i bslad pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i bslad pa ni /
translated: The corruption of the sense faculties

original: log kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is not reversed even when the error is reversed.

original: zhes gang brjod ba de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: zhes gang brjod ba de yang mi rigs te /
translated: What was said is also unreasonable.

original: yid kyis chur 'khrul pa yang dbang po'i bslad pa la sogs pa la ni ma mthong ste /
analyzed: yid kyis chur 'khrul pa yang dbang po'i bslad pa la sogs pa la ni ma mthong ste /
translated: The error of water in the mind is not seen in the corruption of the sense faculties, etc.

original: sad pa'i rkyen tshad pas gdungs pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sad pa'i rkyen tshad pas gdungs pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist without the condition of waking, being tormented by heat.

original: chur 'khrul pa ni gzhan gyi rgyud la 'jug par ma mthong ste /
analyzed: chur 'khrul pa ni gzhan gyi rgyud la 'jug par ma mthong ste /
translated: The error of water is not seen to occur in another's continuum.

original: tshad pas gdungs pa gzhan gyi tshig las de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad pas gdungs pa gzhan gyi tshig las de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not occur like that from the words of another who is tormented by heat.

original: sprul du 'khrul pa yang mthong ba dran pa la ltos par ni ma mthong ste nag po la sogs pa ni dang po nyid 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sprul du 'khrul pa yang mthong ba dran pa la ltos par ni ma mthong ste nag po la sogs pa ni dang po nyid 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But the error of emanation does not depend on memory, because black and so on are seen from the beginning.

original: yongs su gsal bar snang ba yang rmi lam la sogs pa na yid kyi 'khrul pa la yang yod pa nyid do /
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar snang ba yang rmi lam la sogs pa na yid kyi 'khrul pa la yang yod pa nyid do /
translated: And the appearance of complete clarity also exists in mental error in dreams and so on.

original: des na yongs su gsal bar snang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di thams cad mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na yongs su gsal bar snang mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di thams cad mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, all of this, such as ‚Äúit would not appear completely clearly,‚Äù is untenable.

original: de yod na yod pa dang / de 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i brgyud pa'i 'bras bu la yang 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa dang / de 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i brgyud pa'i 'bras bu la yang 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it exists, it exists. If it changes, it changes. The result of the continuum is also just that.üîΩThe Explanation

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: de la nag po la sogs par //
analyzed: de la nag po la sogs par //
translated: The appearance of black and so on

original: snang ba gang de dbang skyes nyid //
analyzed: snang ba gang de dbang skyes nyid //
translated: is definitely arisen from the sense faculties.

original: ldog med la sogs chos dag ni //
analyzed: ldog med la sogs chos dag ni //
translated: The properties of not ceasing and so on

original: de yi yin phyir lan bzang min //
analyzed: de yi yin phyir lan bzang min //
translated: belong to that, so this is not a good response.

original: dbang po las byung ba'i nag por snang ba la sogs pa ni gdon me za bar de log na mi ldog pa ma yin na //
analyzed: dbang po las byung ba'i nag por snang ba la sogs pa ni gdon me za bar de log na mi ldog pa ma yin na //
translated: The appearance of black and so on that arises from the sense faculties definitely does not cease when that ceases.

original: yongs su gsal bar snang ba yang dbang pos bskyed pa nyid yin gyi yid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar snang ba yang dbang pos bskyed pa nyid yin gyi yid ni ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of a clear image is produced by the sense faculty, not by the mental faculty.

original: nyi mas gdungs @8b pa la sogs pa'i stobs las yid kyang 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: nyi mas gdungs @8b pa la sogs pa'i stobs las yid kyang 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But the mental faculty is transformed by the power of the sun‚Äôs heat, etc.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: yongs su gsal na de rtog pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dbang po las byung ba dang khyad par med do //
analyzed: yongs su gsal na de rtog pa med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dbang po las byung ba dang khyad par med do //
translated: If the image is clear, it is no different from what arises from the sense faculty, because it is nonconceptual.

original: de lta yin dang rab rib bcas smos pa ni dmigs kyis bsal ba las nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rab rib bcas smos pa ni dmigs kyis bsal ba las nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the phrase ‚Äútogether with the visual faculty‚Äù is not redundant because it is an exception.

original: gzhan dag ni yid yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas par sems pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni yid yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bcas par sems pa yin gyi /
translated: Others think that the mental faculty is conceptual, because it is thought.

original: yid tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not just the mental faculty.

original: 'di ltar rtog pa med pa gcig yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa med pa gcig yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: In this way, only the fact that it is nonconceptual is to be established.

original: mngon sum ltar snang ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang ba ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of apparent direct perception:

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: conceptual and nonconceptual.

original: de yang 'khrul pa thams cad rtog ba dang bcas pa nyid yin na bsal ba de'i tshe 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de yang 'khrul pa thams cad rtog ba dang bcas pa nyid yin na bsal ba de'i tshe 'gyur gyi /
translated: Moreover, if all errors are associated with conceptualization, then they are eliminated when conceptualization is eliminated.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise.

original: 'o na ni gsal bar snang yang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo yid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni gsal bar snang yang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo yid yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is the case that the cognition of a double moon, etc., appears clearly, then the mind is the mind.

original: yid ma yin te /
analyzed: yid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the mind,

original: bsgoms pa med par yang 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pa med par yang 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be cultivated.

original: yid ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal ba gsal ba la brten pa yin no ;
analyzed: yid ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal ba gsal ba la brten pa yin no ;
translated: The mind is clear on the basis of the clear cultivation of the power of meditation.

original: ; de med pa'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa nyid bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: ; de med pa'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa nyid bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: Since that is not the case, it is not possible to refute the fact that it arises from the sense faculty.

original: rnam pa gsal ba'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa gsal ba'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis nyid de /
translated: The cause of clear form is twofold:

original: dbang po dang bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang bsgoms pa'o //
translated: the sense faculty and meditation.

original: de la yang bar chod pa'i bsgoms pa yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang bar chod pa'i bsgoms pa yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But in that case, there is the cultivation of the obstruction.

original: 'o na ni phyi rol gyi don gyi brjod pa dang bral ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni phyi rol gyi don gyi brjod pa dang bral ba yin gyi /
translated: But if that is the case, then it is free from the expression of external objects.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: 'o na gang zhig dper 'gyur ba sbrul du 'khrul pa'i yid dang / chu la sogs par 'khrul pa'i yid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig dper 'gyur ba sbrul du 'khrul pa'i yid dang / chu la sogs par 'khrul pa'i yid gang yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the mind that is mistaken with respect to a snake, and what is the mind that is mistaken with respect to water, etc.?

original: phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed par snang ba'o /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed par snang ba'o /
translated: They are the appearances of benefit and harm.

original: phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed par snang ba ni dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod kyang ldog la /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang gnod pa byed par snang ba ni dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod kyang ldog la /
translated: The appearances of benefit and harm are reversed when there is a change in the sense organ,

original: dbang po'i bslad pa log kyang mi ldog go //
analyzed: dbang po'i bslad pa log kyang mi ldog go //
translated: but they are not reversed when the sense organ is damaged.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro //üîΩde lta yin dang / gnyid log pa 'am sad pa na //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar ro // de lta yin dang / gnyid log pa 'am sad pa na //
translated: The same is true of the others.

original: gsal bar snang ba can blo gang //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba can blo gang //
translated: If that is so, then with respect to the mind that has a clear appearance, whether it is asleep or awake,

original: de ni rtog med gnyi gar yang //
analyzed: de ni rtog med gnyi gar yang //
translated: it is non-conceptual in both cases.

original: de lta min na rtog pa yin //
analyzed: de lta min na rtog pa yin //
translated: If it were not so, it would be conceptual.

original: yid dam gzhan gnyi gar yang rtog pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: yid dam gzhan gnyi gar yang rtog pa med pa nyid de /
translated: The mind and the other are both non-conceptual.

original: gsal ba nyid yin na rtog pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to ;
analyzed: gsal ba nyid yin na rtog pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin to ;
translated: If they are clear, they are non-conceptual. This has been explained.

original: ; de phyir de rtog med na yang //
analyzed: ; de phyir de rtog med na yang //
translated: Therefore, even though it is non-conceptual,

original: tshad ma nyid ni bkag pa ste //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ni bkag pa ste //
translated: its validity is refuted,

original: slu ba'i phyir ro de'i don du'ang //
analyzed: slu ba'i phyir ro de'i don du'ang //
translated: because it is deceptive.

original: mngon sum ltar snang gnyis su bshad //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang gnyis su bshad //
translated: Two kinds of seeming direct perception are explained.

original: slob dpon gyis rnam par rtog pa dang / 'khrul pa dag gis mngon sum ltar snang ba rnam pa gnyis nyid bstan te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rnam par rtog pa dang / 'khrul pa dag gis mngon sum ltar snang ba rnam pa gnyis nyid bstan te /
translated: The master has taught two kinds of seeming direct perception, due to conceptualization and error.

original: rab rib las byung bas nye bar mtshen  pa'i @9a * //
analyzed: rab rib las byung bas nye bar mtshen  pa'i @9a * //
translated: The contamination of the eye is due to cataracts.üîΩThe contamination of the mind is due to the contamination of the eye and so on.

original: bslad pa dag go zhes bya bas rnam par rtog pa'i sde tshan las logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslad pa dag go zhes bya bas rnam par rtog pa'i sde tshan las logs shig tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are taught separately from the category of conceptualization.

original: de lta ma yin na logs shig tu ston pa'i dgos pa med pas na mi mkhas pa nyid brjod pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na logs shig tu ston pa'i dgos pa med pas na mi mkhas pa nyid brjod pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, there would be no need to teach them separately, and it would be a cause for saying that the master is not learned.

original: 'o na 'khrul pa ni yid kyi 'khrul pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na bshad pa de ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'khrul pa ni yid kyi 'khrul pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na bshad pa de ci ltar zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúError is the object of mental error,‚Äù how do you explain that?

original: de ni gzhan gyi 'dod pas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi 'dod pas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is explained by the assertions of others.

original: gang gi dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba ni mngon sum yin no zhes mtshan nyid yin pa de'i ltar na /
analyzed: gang gi dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba ni mngon sum yin no zhes mtshan nyid yin pa de'i ltar na /
translated: If the definition of direct perception is ‚Äúthat which arises from the contact of a sense faculty and an object,‚ÄùüîΩthen, according to that,

original: 'khrul pa ni yid kyi 'khrul pa'i yul yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni yid kyi 'khrul pa'i yul yin no zhes bya bar rnam par gnas so //
translated: Error is the object of mental error.

original: dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba nyid ni 'khrul pa nyid du mi srid de /
analyzed: dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba nyid ni 'khrul pa nyid du mi srid de /
translated: It is not possible that what arises from the contact of a sense faculty and an object is error.

original: lhag par gyur pas yid kyi lhag par rnam par rtogs pa gang yin pa de la 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag par gyur pas yid kyi lhag par rnam par rtogs pa gang yin pa de la 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: That which is mental, which is a special form of conception, is error.

original: don med par dbang po tsam las skyes pa gang yin pa de yang 'khrul pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: don med par dbang po tsam las skyes pa gang yin pa de yang 'khrul pa ma yin nam //
translated: But what arises from a sense faculty alone, without an object, is not error.

original: de ci ltar kyi 'khrul pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ci ltar kyi 'khrul pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How can that be the object of error?

original: ma yin te de ni don smos pas gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te de ni don smos pas gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because it is clear that it is mentioned as an object.

original: de ni yod kyang med pa dang 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni yod kyang med pa dang 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: Even though it exists, it is as if it does not exist.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: It is said:

original: dbang po don las skyes pa la //
analyzed: dbang po don las skyes pa la //
translated: From the sense faculty and the object,

original: brjod pa la sogs srid ma yin //
analyzed: brjod pa la sogs srid ma yin //
translated: there is no possibility of speech, etc.

original: zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: brjod pa la sogs pa dag ni yid nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa la sogs pa dag ni yid nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Speech, etc., should be understood as mental.

original: gal te brjod du med pa la sogs pa sel bar byed pa'i tshig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te brjod du med pa la sogs pa sel bar byed pa'i tshig ni ma yin no //
translated: If the words ‚Äúnot expressible‚Äù and so on are not eliminations,

original: 'on te ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ci zhe na /
translated: then what are they?

original: rang gi ngo bo brjod pa lhur byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo brjod pa lhur byed pa yin no //
translated: They are statements of the nature of perception.

original: dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de 'di ltar 'gyur ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The cognition that arises from the contact of a sense faculty with its object is like this, but not any other.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: zhen pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba bstan par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhen pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba bstan par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: because the statement ‚Äúhaving the nature of adherence‚Äù would not be a statement of the object to be known.

original: dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung pa nyid zhen pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang don phrad pa las byung pa nyid zhen pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The cognition that arises from the contact of a sense faculty with its object does not have the nature of adherence,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang zhen pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang zhen pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because inference also has the nature of adherence.

original: de'i phyir zhen pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes sel bar byed pa nyid du 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhen pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni mngon sum yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes sel bar byed pa nyid du 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to eliminate other types of cognition by saying, ‚ÄúThat which has the nature of adherence is perception, but not any other.‚Äù

original: ci ste cung zad sel bar byed pa yin la cung zad ni ngo bo brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste cung zad sel bar byed pa yin la cung zad ni ngo bo brjod pa yin no //
translated: But if it is said that it is a slight elimination, then it is a slight expression of the nature.

original: des na dbang po don phrad pa las byung ba dang zhen pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa dang / brjod pa med par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na dbang po don phrad pa las byung ba dang zhen pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa dang / brjod pa med par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, that which arises from the contact of the sense faculty with its object and has the nature of adherence is non-mistaken and inexpressible.

original: de ni mi rigs te 'khrul pa med pa nyid ni brjod par rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te 'khrul pa med pa nyid ni brjod par rigs te /
translated: That is illogical, because non-mistakenness is suitable to be expressed.

original: da ltar na tshad ma nyid yin @9b no ;
analyzed: da ltar na tshad ma nyid yin @9b no ;
translated: Otherwise, it would be a valid cognition.

original: ; brjod du med pa'i yul can gyis ci bya /
analyzed: ; brjod du med pa'i yul can gyis ci bya /
translated: What is the use of an inexpressible object?

original: de ltar tshad mar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te gzhan du yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar tshad mar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te gzhan du yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not like that, because it is not a valid cognition elsewhere either.

original: des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: Therefore, this is mere prattle.

original: rang gi ngo bo brjod na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo brjod na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If its own nature is expressed, there is an absurd consequence.

original: bdag la sogs pa dang phrad pa yang brjod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa dang phrad pa yang brjod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It follows that contact with the self, etc. is expressed.

original: ci ste mngon sum nyid la thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa de nyid brjod pa yin gyi bdag la sogs pa thun mong ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste mngon sum nyid la thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa de nyid brjod pa yin gyi bdag la sogs pa thun mong ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the uncommon characteristic of direct perception is stated, and not the common characteristic of self and so on,

original: de lta bu ni 'o na sel bar byed pa'i khyad par yin gyi rang gi ngo bo brjod pa lhur byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'o na sel bar byed pa'i khyad par yin gyi rang gi ngo bo brjod pa lhur byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then it is the uncommon characteristic that is the distinguishing factor, and not the statement of its own nature that is the distinguishing factor.

original: 'dis ni yod pa dang phrad pa la sogs pa yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni yod pa dang phrad pa la sogs pa yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also clarifies the phrase ‚Äúhaving contact with existence‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'di mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di mtshan nyid yin par 'gyur ram /
translated: In this case, is this the definition?

original: rnam pa gzhan du bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo brjod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du bsgrub pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo brjod pa yin /
translated: Or is it the statement of its own nature for the purpose of establishing it in another way?

original: de la gal te yod pa dang phrad pa na zhes bya ba mtshan nyid yin na ni yod pa'i don can mngon sum yin pa 'am /
analyzed: de la gal te yod pa dang phrad pa na zhes bya ba mtshan nyid yin na ni yod pa'i don can mngon sum yin pa 'am /
translated: If ‚Äúhaving contact with existence‚Äù is the definition, then it should be stated that direct perception has the meaning of existence,

original: dbang po las skyes pa gnod pa med pa mngon sum yin no zhes de skad brjod par bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa gnod pa med pa mngon sum yin no zhes de skad brjod par bya ba yin no ;
translated: or that direct perception is that which is produced from the sense faculties and is undamaged.

original: / ci ste chos la rgyu mtshan ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo rjes su brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: / ci ste chos la rgyu mtshan ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo rjes su brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the expression ‚Äúarisen from the senses‚Äù is used to indicate the nature of the object, not to indicate its cause,

original: de lta na yang dbang po las skyes pa zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang dbang po las skyes pa zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
translated: then you should simply say ‚Äúarisen from the senses‚Äù and not ‚Äúarisen from the senses and from objects.‚Äù

original: don med par gzhan gyis brjod pa ci bya /üîΩgzhan yang rjes su brjod pa tsam ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: don med par gzhan gyis brjod pa ci bya / gzhan yang rjes su brjod pa tsam ni mi 'thad do //
translated: What is the point of adding something meaningless?

original: 'di ltar / rig byed smra ba'i dpyod pa las //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rig byed smra ba'i dpyod pa las //
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that the expression ‚Äúarisen from the senses‚Äù is used to indicate the nature of the object.üîΩIn the NyƒÅyamukha,

original: phyi rol don ni bsgrub pa la //
analyzed: phyi rol don ni bsgrub pa la //
translated: it is said that the external object is established

original: 'bad bya des na mtshan nyid kyis //
analyzed: 'bad bya des na mtshan nyid kyis //
translated: by the characteristics of the object itself,

original: gzhan rnams sel bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: gzhan rnams sel bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: not by the exclusion of other things.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dag ni rang gi gzhung gi rjes su 'brangs nas mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa dag ni rang gi gzhung gi rjes su 'brangs nas mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du 'dod do //
translated: BuddhapƒÅlita and others, following their own texts, assert that perception is characterized by the absence of conceptual thought.

original: des na de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir nges par mtshan nyid gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir nges par mtshan nyid gzhan du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to exclude that, the characteristic of perception must be stated in a different way.

original: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes par smra ba dang / stong pa nyid smra ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de gsal ba'i phyir mtshan nyid gzhan nyid byed na mdzes so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes par smra ba dang / stong pa nyid smra ba dang rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de gsal ba'i phyir mtshan nyid gzhan nyid byed na mdzes so //
translated: Because the characteristics of the Sugatas are in agreement with the proponents of consciousness and the proponents of emptiness, it is certainly fitting that another characteristic be made in order to clarify them.

original: rdeg 'chos pas ni rda mo 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdeg 'chos pas ni rda mo 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: One cannot hold a lute by beating it.

original: mtshan nyid byas na skyon ci yod //
analyzed: mtshan nyid byas na skyon ci yod //
translated: What is the fault in making a characteristic?

original: tshad mas ma grub ste /
analyzed: tshad mas ma grub ste /
translated: It is not established by a valid cognition.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de la nges pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de la nges pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The ascertained characteristic

original: tshad mas grub pa brjod pa yin //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa brjod pa yin //
translated: is said to be established by a valid cognition.

original: 'dir ni phan tshun rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: 'dir ni phan tshun rgyu yin phyir //
translated: Here, because they are mutually dependent,

original: gcig kyang rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig kyang rab tu 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: even one is not established.

original: phan tshun brten pa'i phyir gcig kyang mi 'grub pas na mtshan nyid byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa'i phyir gcig kyang mi 'grub pas na mtshan nyid byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Since they are mutually dependent, even one is not established, therefore it is not made by a characteristic.

original: gal te @10a * //
analyzed: gal te @10a * //
translated: If that is so,

original: de lta na ni tshad mas rab tu ma grub pa rjes su brjod par yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni tshad mas rab tu ma grub pa rjes su brjod par yang mi rigs so //
translated: then it is not reasonable to speak of what is not established by a valid cognition.

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pas grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pas grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say it is established by what is known in the world,

original: gal te de lta na ni chos kyang 'jig rten gyi grags pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dpyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni chos kyang 'jig rten gyi grags pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dpyod par mi bya'o //
translated: If that is so, then Dharma would be just what is renowned in the world, and so it should not be analyzed.

original: chos 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir don dam par mi 'grub pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: chos 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir don dam par mi 'grub pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Because Dharma is seen to be mistaken, it is not established ultimately.

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: dpyod pa 'dis kyang chos 'khrul pa //
analyzed: dpyod pa 'dis kyang chos 'khrul pa //
translated: then this analysis is also mistaken with regard to Dharma.

original: dbyig pa yis ni zlog gam ci //
analyzed: dbyig pa yis ni zlog gam ci //
translated: Is it to be stopped by a stick?

original: gzhan du de srid dus su lugs //
analyzed: gzhan du de srid dus su lugs //
translated: Otherwise, it would be a rule for that time,

original: gzhan la mis yang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan la mis yang med par 'gyur //
translated: and there would be no other person.

original: de'i phyir rjes su brjod pa yang tshad mas grub pa nyid bya ba yin la de bzhin du mtshan nyid kyang kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su brjod pa yang tshad mas grub pa nyid bya ba yin la de bzhin du mtshan nyid kyang kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the expression of a definition is also to be established by valid cognition, and in the same way, the definition is also faultless.

original: bde bar gshegs pas kyang mtshan nyid byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas kyang mtshan nyid byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The Sugata does not create a definition,

original: rab tu grags pa'i don rjes su brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i don rjes su brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he expresses the meaning that is well known.

original: ci ltar chos la rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar chos la rgyu mtshan ma yin pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that Dharma is not a reason,üîΩhe says:

original: rjes su brjod pa de bzhin du rgyu mtshan nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yin pas gnyi gar yang mtshungs so//
analyzed: rjes su brjod pa de bzhin du rgyu mtshan nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yin pas gnyi gar yang mtshungs so//
translated: The reason is the same in both cases.

original: 'di yang ci lta ba de ltar sngar bstan zin to //üîΩdes na don gyis shes pa ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di yang ci lta ba de ltar sngar bstan zin to // des na don gyis shes pa ni mngon sum mo zhes bya ba 'di ni mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: And this is just as was explained earlier.üîΩTherefore, the definition of perception is simply this: ‚Äúthat which is non-errone-neous with respect to its object.‚Äù

original: gnyug ma'i don med pa'i phyir de las zhes bya ba 'di ni don gang zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba de nyid las zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: gnyug ma'i don med pa'i phyir de las zhes bya ba 'di ni don gang zhig mngon sum gyis mthong ba de nyid las zhes rtogs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom that‚Äù means that the object that is perceived is the same as that which is perceived.

original: des na zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the perception of two moons and so forth is excluded.

original: de ni de nyid las byung ba ma yin te 'on kyang gzhan las yin no //
analyzed: de ni de nyid las byung ba ma yin te 'on kyang gzhan las yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the object arises from that, but rather that it arises from something else.

original: 'o na ci ltar slob dpon gyis //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar slob dpon gyis //
translated: How is it that the master [DignƒÅga] said:

original: gang zhig de snang de las min //
analyzed: gang zhig de snang de las min //
translated: That which appears as that does not arise from that.

original: lnga po bsags la dmigs pa yin //
analyzed: lnga po bsags la dmigs pa yin //
translated: It is the apprehension of a collection of five.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rdul phra rab dag las skye ba na de'i rnam pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rdul phra rab dag las skye ba na de'i rnam pa can ma yin no //
translated: When the eye consciousness and so forth arise from the atoms, they do not have the aspect of that.

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i yang dmigs pa nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyang dmigs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa'i yang dmigs pa nyid yin na ni mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab kyang dmigs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the object of a consciousness that has a form of something else because it is a cause, then it follows that the atoms of the eye and so on are objects,

original: de lta bu 'am gzhan du gyur pa de dag kyang zla ba gnyis dang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: de lta bu 'am gzhan du gyur pa de dag kyang zla ba gnyis dang sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad ce na /
translated: because they are causes of a consciousness that appears as two moons or blue and so on.

original: 'di ni don dam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated from the ultimate point of view.

original: rtsod pa'i sgrub pa'i tshig ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i sgrub pa'i tshig ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa yin no //
translated: The words of the syllogism are from the point of view of what is accepted in the world.

original: 'jig rten na rdul phra rab la sogs pa mi rtog ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na rdul phra rab la sogs pa mi rtog ste /
translated: The world does not conceive of atoms and so on.

original: 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa'i mngon sum ni 'di tsam zhig yin la rnam par dpyad na ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rab tu grags pa'i mngon sum ni 'di tsam zhig yin la rnam par dpyad na ni mi 'thad do //
translated: This much is the direct perception that is well known in the world, but when analyzed it is not tenable.üîΩThe words ‚Äúfrom that object‚Äù

original: don de @10b las zhes ma grub dang // ma nges nyid du gsal ba yin //
analyzed: don de @10b las zhes ma grub dang // ma nges nyid du gsal ba yin //
translated: make it clear that it is not established and is uncertain.

original: rdul phran dag la 'dod na 'di //
analyzed: rdul phran dag la 'dod na 'di //
translated: If you assert that it is atoms,

original: ma nges pa ni nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It is not ascertained.

original: rdul phra rab nyid skyed par byed pa yin pas de dag dmigs pa nyid yid na ni mig la sogs pas ma nges so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab nyid skyed par byed pa yin pas de dag dmigs pa nyid yid na ni mig la sogs pas ma nges so //
translated: If it is the case that the atoms are the producers, then the eye, etc. are not ascertained.

original: ci ste de las zhes bya ba snang ba la brjod na de'i tshe ma grub po ;
analyzed: ci ste de las zhes bya ba snang ba la brjod na de'i tshe ma grub po ;
translated: But if it is said that the appearance is from that, then it is not established.

original: ; dus mtshungs pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ; dus mtshungs pa de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is simultaneous in time is not a producer.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pas ma nges pa yang yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pas ma nges pa yang yin no //
translated: And it is not ascertained by the two moons, etc.

original: ci ste dus mtshungs kyang skyed par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste dus mtshungs kyang skyed par byed pa yin na /
translated: But if it is the case that it is a producer even though it is simultaneous,

original: de yang mi rigs te tshogs pa ni dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te tshogs pa ni dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not reasonable, because the collection is not a thing.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pas ma nges pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pas ma nges pa yang yin no //
translated: And it is not ascertained by a mistaken consciousness.

original: ci ste sngar yod pa skyed par byed pa yin na de yang ma grub po //
analyzed: ci ste sngar yod pa skyed par byed pa yin na de yang ma grub po //
translated: But if it is the case that it is a producer of what already exists, that is not established.

original: shes pa las sngar dngos po ni //
analyzed: shes pa las sngar dngos po ni //
translated: A thing prior to consciousness

original: shes pa de yis 'dzin ma yin //
analyzed: shes pa de yis 'dzin ma yin //
translated: is not apprehended by that consciousness.

original: gzhan gyis 'dzin na de la yang /üîΩbrgal zhing rtag pa 'di nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'dzin na de la yang /üîΩbrgal zhing rtag pa 'di nyid do //
translated: If it is apprehended by another,üîΩthen the same objection and response apply to that.

original: rjes su dpag pas shes na ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas shes na ni //
translated: If it is known through inference,

original: de yang mngon sum ma yin te //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum ma yin te //
translated: then it is not direct perception.

original: phan tshun rgyur ni gyur pa na /
analyzed: phan tshun rgyur ni gyur pa na /
translated: When they become mutually causal,

original: dang por 'byung bar gyur pa gang //
analyzed: dang por 'byung bar gyur pa gang //
translated: what is the first to arise?üîΩNeither direct perception nor inference

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / gar yang dus mtshungs yod ma yin //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag dag / gar yang dus mtshungs yod ma yin //
translated: exist at any time simultaneously.

original: de yi phyir na don dam du //
analyzed: de yi phyir na don dam du //
translated: Therefore, in reality,

original: mtshan nyid 'di ni ma grub po //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di ni ma grub po //
translated: this definition is not established.

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa la ltos na ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa la ltos na ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: But if we consider what is accepted in the world, there is no contradiction.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mngon sum mo zhes gang brjod pa de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mngon sum mo zhes gang brjod pa de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: It is also not tenable to say that the engagement of the ear and so on is direct perception.

original: rna ba la sogs 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs 'jug pa ni //
translated: Is the engagement of the ear and so on

original: 'khrul pa la yang yod min nam //
analyzed: 'khrul pa la yang yod min nam //
translated: not also found in error?

original: rna ba la sogs 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs 'jug pa ni //
translated: The engagement of the ear and so on

original: shes pa med par mtshon pa min //
analyzed: shes pa med par mtshon pa min //
translated: is not indicated without consciousness.

original: 'jug par 'dod pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma tshol ba yin na /
analyzed: 'jug par 'dod pa'i mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma tshol ba yin na /
translated: If you seek a valid cognition such as direct perception that engages its object,

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ma shes pa ci ltar mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ma shes pa ci ltar mtshan nyid yin /
translated: how can the engagement of the ear and so on be its definition if it is not known?

original: ma rtogs pa de ji ltar 'di 'jug par byed pa yin /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa de ji ltar 'di 'jug par byed pa yin /
translated: How can that which is not understood engage it?

original: ci ste mngon sum nyid kyis rna ba la sogs pa 'jug pa rtogs na 'o na ni de mngon sum de'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste mngon sum nyid kyis rna ba la sogs pa 'jug pa rtogs na 'o na ni de mngon sum de'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: But if you understand the engagement of the ear, etc. by direct perception itself, then you must state the definition of that direct perception.

original: des na mngon sum ni mngon sum du byed pa yin la /
analyzed: des na mngon sum ni mngon sum du byed pa yin la /
translated: And so the answer is that direct perception is that which perceives,

original: de yang rang nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid lan yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang nyid rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid lan yin no //
translated: and that itself is the understanding of itself.

original: de lta yin dang mngon du byed pa de nyid ma 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang mngon du byed pa de nyid ma 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: If that were so, then that which perceives would have the definition of non-error.

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa la yang rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa yod pas ci ltar mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa la yang rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa yod pas ci ltar mtshan nyid du 'gyur /
translated: But since the engagement of the ear, etc. exists even in erroneous consciousness, how could that be the definition?

original: 'on ta don la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med na /
analyzed: 'on ta don la 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir skyon med na /
translated: But if there is no fault because it engages its object,

original: don la 'jug pa ni don la mngon sum du phyogs pa yin la de 'khrul pa la yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: don la 'jug pa ni don la mngon sum du phyogs pa yin la de 'khrul pa la yod pa nyid do //
translated: then the engagement of the object is the direct perception of the object, and that exists even in error.

original: @11a * // ci ste de ni ngo bo rig pa nyid yin na de lta na ni 'o na rang gi ngo bo rig pa zhes de nyid mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: @11a * // ci ste de ni ngo bo rig pa nyid yin na de lta na ni 'o na rang gi ngo bo rig pa zhes de nyid mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: But if it is the awareness of its own nature, then the definition is just that, ‚Äúit is the awareness of its own nature.‚Äù

original: de yang rtogs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ming gzhan dang ldan pa mngon du byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ming gzhan dang ldan pa mngon du byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is only the manifestation of the non-apprehension of the other name.

original: de'i phyir gzhan ni mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan ni mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the other is not the characteristic.

original: yang tshad ma 'di'i 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang tshad ma 'di'i 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the result of this valid cognition?

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa ste /
translated: The understanding of the object of comprehension.

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las so zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag las so zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that the understanding of the object of comprehension depends on valid cognition.

original: de ni shes pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ni shes pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't that just consciousness?

original: de yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
translated: And since that is the result, what is the valid cognition?

original: kha cig na re dbang po dang don phrad pa dang / lta ba dang khyad par gyi shes pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re dbang po dang don phrad pa dang / lta ba dang khyad par gyi shes pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say it is the contact of sense faculty and object, and the consciousness that distinguishes.

original: de ni mi 'thad de ;
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de ;
translated: That is not tenable.

original: gang las 'gyur ba de nyid rtogs pa'i sgrub byed du rigs so //
analyzed: gang las 'gyur ba de nyid rtogs pa'i sgrub byed du rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that what causes it is the proof of understanding.

original: re zhig shes pa skye ba ni dbang po nyid las yin par mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: re zhig shes pa skye ba ni dbang po nyid las yin par mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it seen that the arising of consciousness is from the sense faculty itself?

original: des na rtogs pa'i sgrub byed kyang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: des na rtogs pa'i sgrub byed kyang de nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, that itself is the proof of understanding.

original: gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of examining others?

original: mthong ba spangs nas gzhan du ni //
analyzed: mthong ba spangs nas gzhan du ni //
translated: Apart from what is seen,

original: rtog pa rigs par mi ldan te //
analyzed: rtog pa rigs par mi ldan te //
translated: there is no conception that is reasonable.

original: de ltar min na gzhal bya la //
analyzed: de ltar min na gzhal bya la //
translated: If it were otherwise, then there would be no end to the objects of cognition,

original: thug med bzlog pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: thug med bzlog pa med par 'gyur //
translated: and the regress would be unavoidable.

original: de ni med de bya ba sgrub par byed //
analyzed: de ni med de bya ba sgrub par byed //
translated: But that is not so, for the means of accomplishment is established.üîΩWhatever is the means of accomplishing all actions

original: ces te / las kun gyi ni sgrub byed dag / thams cad ma yin gang las 'bras //
analyzed: ces te / las kun gyi ni sgrub byed dag / thams cad ma yin gang las 'bras //
translated: is not everything, but rather that from which the result arises.

original: gang yin de ni de sgrub byed //
analyzed: gang yin de ni de sgrub byed //
translated: That is the means of accomplishing that.

original: gal te gcig la nus pa mthong //
analyzed: gal te gcig la nus pa mthong //
translated: If the capacity is seen in one,

original: zhes te gcig po de gzhan dag tu yang sgrub par byed par rtog na gang 'ga' zhig gi sgrub par byed pa blangs pas 'dod pa thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad tshegs chung dus bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes te gcig po de gzhan dag tu yang sgrub par byed par rtog na gang 'ga' zhig gi sgrub par byed pa blangs pas 'dod pa thams cad sgrub pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad tshegs chung dus bde bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one imagines that the means of accomplishing that is also in others, then since one would take up the means of accomplishing some, all desires would be accomplished. Therefore, all transmigrators would easily abide in happiness.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te de'i phyir bya ba gang gang las 'grub par mthong ba de nyid de la sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te de'i phyir bya ba gang gang las 'grub par mthong ba de nyid de la sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so. Therefore, whatever action is seen to accomplish something, that alone is the means of accomplishing it, not anything else.

original: de la nyams myong tsam du ni //
analyzed: de la nyams myong tsam du ni //
translated: But in mere experience,

original: 'dra ba'i bdag can shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i bdag can shes pa ni //
translated: the cognition of the nature of similarity

original: gang gis las ni so so la //
analyzed: gang gis las ni so so la //
translated: is the differentiation of the individual actions;

original: rnam 'byed de bdag 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rnam 'byed de bdag 'gyur ba yin //
translated: thus, it is the transformation of the self.

original: grangs can pa'i nyams su myong ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa thams cad la yod pa tsam du mtshungs te /
analyzed: grangs can pa'i nyams su myong ba ni sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa thams cad la yod pa tsam du mtshungs te /
translated: The experience of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya is the same in all cases, such as blue and yellow, and so on.

original: des na rnam par gzhag par 'dod pa'i don bzhin du thams cad rnam par 'jog pa 'am /
analyzed: des na rnam par gzhag par 'dod pa'i don bzhin du thams cad rnam par 'jog pa 'am /
translated: Therefore, either everything is posited in accordance with the object that is asserted to be posited,

original: ma yin na ni rnam par ma bzhag pa bzhin du rnam par bzhag par 'os pa yang mi 'gyur te de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin na ni rnam par ma bzhag pa bzhin du rnam par bzhag par 'os pa yang mi 'gyur te de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or, if it is not, then it is not suitable to posit it in accordance with what is not posited, because there is no difference between them.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / ci ltar de ni rtogs byed dngos //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ci ltar de ni rtogs byed dngos //
translated: The object that is the cause of the cognition

original: de ltar de ni rtogs byed min //
analyzed: de ltar de ni rtogs byed min //
translated: is not the object of that cognition.

original: gang tshe rtogs byed de 'dod tshe //
analyzed: gang tshe rtogs byed de 'dod tshe //
translated: When you assert that it is the cause of the cognition,

original: rtogs byed min par cis mi 'dod//
analyzed: rtogs byed min par cis mi 'dod//
translated: why do you not assert that it is not the object of the cognition?

original: @11b byed pa med pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par can bdag gir byed na 'di la byed do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @11b byed pa med pa'i gnas skabs las khyad par can bdag gir byed na 'di la byed do zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the special state of the self is taken to be the state that is not an action, then it would be understood that it is an action.

original: gal te khyod kyis ma rtogs su chug mod de ltar yang ci 'dir rang gi ngo bo las nyams par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis ma rtogs su chug mod de ltar yang ci 'dir rang gi ngo bo las nyams par 'gyur ram /
translated: Even if you do not understand it, what is the point?

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin yang mi shes na de'i tshe don de ngas ma shes pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin yang mi shes na de'i tshe don de ngas ma shes pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If you do not understand the nature of the object, then you simply do not understand the object.

original: des na 'jal byed ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'jal byed ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition.

original: skyes bu'i bdag nyid 'jig rten 'di //
analyzed: skyes bu'i bdag nyid 'jig rten 'di //
translated: The nature of the person

original: spyad bya'i dngos po rtogs par byed //
analyzed: spyad bya'i dngos po rtogs par byed //
translated: is understood through the object of engagement.

original: de yang bdag nyid mi shes pas //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid mi shes pas //
translated: Since it is not understood by itself,

original: longs spyod legs par rnam par gnas //
analyzed: longs spyod legs par rnam par gnas //
translated: it is well established as an object of engagement.

original: bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa'i zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi blos bdag de ltar rnam par 'jog go zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa'i zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi blos bdag de ltar rnam par 'jog go zhe na /
translated: If you say that the self is posited in that way by the mind that has the nature of attachment to pleasure, blue, and so on,

original: 'o na de nyid longs spyod pa po yin pas rigs pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid longs spyod pa po yin pas rigs pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: then since that very mind is the experiencer, what is the use of other principles?

original: bde ba la sogs pa zhen pa'i rang bzhin ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa zhen pa'i rang bzhin ni bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: The nature of attachment to pleasure and so on is the aspect of pleasure and so on. Therefore the aspect itself is the valid cognition.

original: blos zhen pa'i don skyes bus sems pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: blos zhen pa'i don skyes bus sems pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object of the intellect‚Äôs adherence is the person,

original: blo de gang yin zhing zhen pa gang yin la skyes bu yang gang zhig yod pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: blo de gang yin zhing zhen pa gang yin la skyes bu yang gang zhig yod pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: then you must explain what that intellect is, what the adherence is, and what the person is.

original: blo ni byed pa /
analyzed: blo ni byed pa /
translated: The intellect is the agent.

original: zhen pa ni las /
analyzed: zhen pa ni las /
translated: Adherence is the action.

original: skyes bu ni byed pa po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skyes bu ni byed pa po yin no zhe na /
translated: The person is the agent.

original: skyes bus don rtogs pa des na zhen pa'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir blos ci bya /
analyzed: skyes bus don rtogs pa des na zhen pa'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir blos ci bya /
translated: Since the person understands the object, what is the use of the intellect, since it is the agent of adherence?

original: zhen pa'i sgrub byed ni blo yin la skyes bu ni rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: zhen pa'i sgrub byed ni blo yin la skyes bu ni rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the means of accomplishing adherence is the intellect, and the person is the understander,

original: rtogs pa dang zhen pa la khyad ma mthong ngo ;
analyzed: rtogs pa dang zhen pa la khyad ma mthong ngo ;
translated: we do not see any difference between understanding and adherence.

original: ; de'i rnam pa mngon du byed pa yin la zhen pa rtogs pa yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: ; de'i rnam pa mngon du byed pa yin la zhen pa rtogs pa yang de nyid yin no //
translated: It is the manifestation of its aspect, and the understanding of adherence is just that.

original: de'i rnam pa nyid zhen pa yin gyi mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nyid zhen pa yin gyi mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Adherence is just the aspect of that, but it is not the manifestation.

original: gal te de rnams blo yin na /
analyzed: gal te de rnams blo yin na /
translated: If those are the intellect,

original: mi ni ci ltar rtogs byed yin //
analyzed: mi ni ci ltar rtogs byed yin //
translated: how is the person the understander?

original: de dngos mngon du byed phyir na //
analyzed: de dngos mngon du byed phyir na //
translated: Since it manifests the real thing,

original: de ltar don nyid cis ma yin //
analyzed: de ltar don nyid cis ma yin //
translated: why is it not just the object?

original: gal te de'i rnam pa can gyi blo mngon du byed na don nyid de ltar 'gyur pa'i phyir don gyi rnam pa'i blo ni don med do //
analyzed: gal te de'i rnam pa can gyi blo mngon du byed na don nyid de ltar 'gyur pa'i phyir don gyi rnam pa'i blo ni don med do //
translated: If you claim that the object itself becomes like that when a cognition that has its aspect is manifested, then the cognition that has the aspect of the object would be meaningless.

original: blos don gyi rnam pa rtogs pa des na yul ring po ma yin par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: blos don gyi rnam pa rtogs pa des na yul ring po ma yin par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you claim that the object is not distant because the cognition that has the aspect of the object realizes it,

original: bdag khyab pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad yul thag ring po can ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag khyab pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad yul thag ring po can ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: then since the self is all-pervading, nothing would be distant.

original: yul thag ring po zhes bya bar mi rtogs shing de'i rnam pa can gyi blo las ma rtogs pa'i don zhes kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul thag ring po zhes bya bar mi rtogs shing de'i rnam pa can gyi blo las ma rtogs pa'i don zhes kyang mi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: You would not realize that the object is distant, and you would not realize that the object is not realized by a cognition that has its aspect.

original: don med na de'i rnam pa can gyi blo ga las she na /
analyzed: don med na de'i rnam pa can gyi blo ga las she na /
translated: If the object does not exist, how could there be a cognition that has its aspect?

original: ma yin te don rnams kyi de'i rnam pa nyid ni blo kho na las 'dod pa yin na de ci ltar 'di phyin ci log tu 'gyur /
analyzed: ma yin te don rnams kyi de'i rnam pa nyid ni blo kho na las 'dod pa yin na de ci ltar 'di phyin ci log tu 'gyur /
translated: No, because the aspect of objects is asserted to be the cognition itself. How could that be mistaken?

original: rang gi bzhin ltar ma 'phos pa ni rtogs par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi bzhin ltar ma 'phos pa ni rtogs par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: You cannot realize it without transferring it, like your own face.

original: @12a * // ma yin te rang gi bzhin ni yul rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir me long la sogs par 'pho bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: @12a * // ma yin te rang gi bzhin ni yul rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir me long la sogs par 'pho bar 'dod kyi /
translated: No, for the face is not transferred into the mirror, since it is not a suitable object.

original: gzhan ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But the other is not like that.

original: me long yang ma 'phos par ci ltar rtogs /
analyzed: me long yang ma 'phos par ci ltar rtogs /
translated: And how is the mirror known if it is not transferred?

original: de yang blo'i me long du 'phos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang blo'i me long du 'phos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is transferred into the mirror of the mind.

original: 'o na ni blo yang blo'i me long gzhan nam gzhan du 'phos par 'dod dgos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni blo yang blo'i me long gzhan nam gzhan du 'phos par 'dod dgos so //
translated: But then you must admit that the mind is transferred into another mirror of the mind.

original: blo ni rig pa ma yin pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: blo ni rig pa ma yin pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: The mind is not a knower.

original: bdag lkog tu gyur cing blo yang lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir 'gro ba ldongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag lkog tu gyur cing blo yang lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir 'gro ba ldongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self is hidden and the mind is hidden, then the world is blind.

original: bdag lkog tu gyur pa ma yin na des don nyid rig la rag mod 'dir blos ci bya /
analyzed: bdag lkog tu gyur pa ma yin na des don nyid rig la rag mod 'dir blos ci bya /
translated: If the self is not hidden, then it is enough that it knows the object itself. What does the mind do here?

original: byed pa med par ci ltar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa med par ci ltar mthong zhe na /
translated: How can it see without an agent?

original: mig la sogs pa byed pa yin no ;
analyzed: mig la sogs pa byed pa yin no ;
translated: The eye, etc. are the agents.

original: ; nang gi byed pa dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: ; nang gi byed pa dgos so zhe na /
translated: An internal agent is necessary.

original: nang gi nang gi byed pa yang dgos pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
analyzed: nang gi nang gi byed pa yang dgos pa'i phyir thug pa med do //
translated: But then there is an infinite regress because an internal agent is also necessary.

original: dgos pa med pa ni byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa ni byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not a cause without a purpose.

original: de dag gis skyes bu gsal bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gis skyes bu gsal bar byed do zhe na /
translated: But it is the cause of the manifestation of the person.

original: ma yin te byed pa med pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba las 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te byed pa med pa nyid ni mngon par gsal ba las 'dzin par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: No, because that which is inactive cannot be the cause of manifestation.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni don gyi rnam pa can du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni don gyi rnam pa can du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self is the object of the idea of ‚ÄúI.

original: me long bzhin du der yang rnam pa rnam par 'gyur ba byed pa can ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: me long bzhin du der yang rnam pa rnam par 'gyur ba byed pa can ma yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù But it is not the cause of the manifestation of the idea of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù as a mirror is of the manifestation of a reflection.

original: ma yin te me long la brten nas de'i rnam pa can gyi blo skye ba des na rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ma yin te me long la brten nas de'i rnam pa can gyi blo skye ba des na rnam par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: No, because the idea of ‚ÄúI‚Äù arises in dependence on the mirror, and therefore it is a manifestation.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te rnam par ma gyur na 'phos pa'i don ci yin /üîΩme long du ni bzhin gyi rnam pa can 'khrul pa'i blo skye la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te rnam par ma gyur na 'phos pa'i don ci yin / me long du ni bzhin gyi rnam pa can 'khrul pa'i blo skye la /
translated: Otherwise, if it were not a manifestation, what would be the meaning of ‚Äútransferred‚Äù?üîΩIn a mirror, the idea of a face arises in error.

original: 'dir yang yul gyi rnam pa'i blo 'khrul pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir yang yul gyi rnam pa'i blo 'khrul pa nyid de /
translated: In the same way, the idea of an object arises in error.

original: don dam par yul gyi rab tu dbye ba ni med de 'gro ba ni gtso bo dang skyes bu tsam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par yul gyi rab tu dbye ba ni med de 'gro ba ni gtso bo dang skyes bu tsam gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: In reality, there is no division of objects, because the world has the nature of primal substance and the self.

original: 'o na 'gro ba gtso bo'i bdag nyid kyang 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na 'gro ba gtso bo'i bdag nyid kyang 'khrul pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But then the world, which has the nature of primal substance, would be illusory.

original: de bzhin du skyes bu'i bdag nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu'i bdag nyid kyang ngo //
translated: And so would the self, which has the nature of a person.

original: 'di yang phyis rnam pa gzhan du bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang phyis rnam pa gzhan du bstan par bya ste /
translated: This will be explained later in another way.

original: grangs can gyi 'jug pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grangs can gyi 'jug pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But not by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya theory of evolution.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba 'ba' zhig po 'di gang gis 'di ni sngon po 'di ni ser po zhes bya ba la sogs pa las dang las la rnam par 'byed pa de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba 'ba' zhig po 'di gang gis 'di ni sngon po 'di ni ser po zhes bya ba la sogs pa las dang las la rnam par 'byed pa de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur dgos so //
translated: Therefore, this mere experience must be of the nature of that which distinguishes this from that, such as ‚Äúthis is blue‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is yellow.‚Äù

original: gal te rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rna ba la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it said that the engagement of the ear and so on is the valid knowledge of perception?

original: de skad ni brjod na rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de skad ni brjod na rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Although that is said, it is not reasonable.

original: 'di ltar / bdag nyid 'gyur min rgyud dag la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bdag nyid 'gyur min rgyud dag la //
translated: Because: The self does not transform in a continuum.

original: tha dad yod kyang tha dad kyi //
analyzed: tha dad yod kyang tha dad kyi //
translated: Even if there is a difference,

original: las la tha dad med pa 'di //
analyzed: las la tha dad med pa 'di //
translated: this person, who is undifferentiated in regard to all actions such as seeing,

original: tha dad par nges byed ma yin //
analyzed: tha dad par nges byed ma yin //
translated: is not the determiner of the difference.

original: dbang po la @12b sogs pa'i tha dad pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i las thams cad la tha dad pa med pa'i skyes bu 'di tha dad par nges par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la @12b sogs pa'i tha dad pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i las thams cad la tha dad pa med pa'i skyes bu 'di tha dad par nges par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The difference of the sense faculties, etc. does not determine the difference of this person who is undifferentiated in regard to all actions such as seeing.

original: de ni de'i byed pa po 'am shes par byed pa nyid kyis nges par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de ni de'i byed pa po 'am shes par byed pa nyid kyis nges par byed pa yin /
translated: He is determined by his being the agent or the knower.

original: byed pa po nyid kyis nges par byed pa ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: byed pa po nyid kyis nges par byed pa ni mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that he is determined by his being the agent,

original: de rtag pa'i phyir dang rnam pa dang bcas par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtag pa'i phyir dang rnam pa dang bcas par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is permanent and because it would follow, absurdly, that he would have aspects.

original: rnam pa med na skyon de nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa med na skyon de nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If he were without aspects, then that very error would ensue,

original: rang gi bdag nyid kho na rig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kho na rig par thal ba'i phyir ro //
