analyzed: don ltar yin na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'brel pa'i phyir rang bzhin ma lus pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'khyog po dang / gseng po la sogs pa'i chos kyang gsal bar snang bar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is like the object, then because there is contact in all respects, the entire nature would be perceived, and therefore crooked, hidden, and so on would also be clearly seen.

original: kha dog kyang ste dbyibs tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: kha dog kyang ste dbyibs tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not just shape that is seen, but also color.

original: de bzhin du rigs la sogs pa ma lus pa mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs la sogs pa ma lus pa mngon par gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the entire class and so on would be clearly seen.

original: thag ring po la sogs par byed pa'i nus pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: thag ring po la sogs par byed pa'i nus pa med do zhe na /
translated: But it is not possible to see it from a distance, etc.

original: gal te nus pa med na thams cad kyi tshe mi 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nus pa med na thams cad kyi tshe mi 'dzin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not possible, then it is not seen at all.

original: gang gis de ltar gyur pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs pa ni de lta bu nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de ltar gyur pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'i tshogs pa ni de lta bu nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But the collection of atoms is the cause of the perception of a composite figure.

original: dbyibs ni kha dog las tha mi dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbyibs ni kha dog las tha mi dad pa nyid do //
translated: But the figure is not different from the color.

original: dbyibs ni kha dog las tha dad pa'i nges pa med do //
analyzed: dbyibs ni kha dog las tha dad pa'i nges pa med do //
translated: There is no certainty that the figure is different from the color.

original: kha dog med kyang mun pa nges par gzung ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog med kyang mun pa nges par gzung ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: But darkness is perceived even without color.

original: der yang kha dog nag po dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der yang kha dog nag po dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But there is the perception of black color there.

original: mun pa dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir kha dog mi dmigs so zhe na /üîΩde yang mi 'thad de dmigs pa @18a * //
analyzed: mun pa dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir kha dog mi dmigs so zhe na / de yang mi 'thad de dmigs pa @18a * //
translated: But darkness is not a substance, so color is not perceived there.

original: ni dngos po med pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni dngos po med pa nyid du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not tenable, because it is not logical that a non-entity is perceived.

original: snang ba la yang mig btsams pas rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba la yang mig btsams pas rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But it is perceived when the eyes are closed in the dark.

original: de ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because that is a delusion.

original: gcig 'khrul ba'i phyir thams cad du 'khrul pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig 'khrul ba'i phyir thams cad du 'khrul pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that all cognitions are erroneous because one is erroneous.

original: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would lead to absurdity.

original: des na 'di skad ces shes pa 'ga' zhig ni 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: des na 'di skad ces shes pa 'ga' zhig ni 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it should be said that some cognitions are erroneous,

original: 'ga' zhig ni ma 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni ma 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: and some are not erroneous.

original: des na snang ba nyid la bden pa'i dbyibs 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na snang ba nyid la bden pa'i dbyibs 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, it is only in the case of illumination that there is apprehension of the true shape,

original: mun par ni ma yin la /
analyzed: mun par ni ma yin la /
translated: not in the case of darkness.

original: nye ba nyid du yin gyi rgyang ring por ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nye ba nyid du yin gyi rgyang ring por ni ma yin no //
translated: It is only in the case of the near that there is apprehension, not in the case of the distant.

original: des na bdag nyid thams cad kyi 'dzin pa 'am mi 'dzin par rigs so //
analyzed: des na bdag nyid thams cad kyi 'dzin pa 'am mi 'dzin par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that there is apprehension of the entire self, or there is no apprehension.

original: de tha dad med kyang gang las //
analyzed: de tha dad med kyang gang las //
translated: Even though it is not different,

original: tha dad de 'di'i tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: tha dad de 'di'i tshad ma nyid //
translated: from that, there is difference. This is its authority.

original: don tha dad pa med kyang shes pa tha dad pa ni rang la gnas pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid las yin gyi phyi rol gyi rnam pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don tha dad pa med kyang shes pa tha dad pa ni rang la gnas pa sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid las yin gyi phyi rol gyi rnam pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though there is no difference in the object, the difference in cognition is due to the aspect of blue, etc. that resides in itself, not due to an external aspect.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aspect itself is the authority.

original: 'on te shes pa rnam pa med pa yin yang 'dus byas pa las don so sor nges par rnam par gzhag pa byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa rnam pa med pa yin yang 'dus byas pa las don so sor nges par rnam par gzhag pa byed do zhe na /
translated: But even if consciousness is devoid of aspects, it is still the conditioned that is posited as the individual determinant of objects.

original: 'di bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di bshad pa /
translated: This is explained:

original: 'dus byas las min de yi dngos //
analyzed: 'dus byas las min de yi dngos //
translated: It is not the conditioned, because

original: med na de yang gzhag med phyir //
analyzed: med na de yang gzhag med phyir //
translated: if that does not exist, it is not tenable.

original: don so sor nges par gnas pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'dus byas pa ni /
analyzed: don so sor nges par gnas pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'dus byas pa ni /
translated: The conditioned that precedes the individual determination of objects

original: rang nyid so sor nges pas rnam par shes pa don so sor nges pa'i yul can du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid so sor nges pas rnam par shes pa don so sor nges pa'i yul can du byed pa yin no //
translated: makes itself the object of a consciousness that individually determines objects by means of its own individual determination.

original: des ni don gang ji ltar myong ba de lta bur gyur pa dran par 'gyur ba yin na rnam pa med par ni don nges par myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni don gang ji ltar myong ba de lta bur gyur pa dran par 'gyur ba yin na rnam pa med par ni don nges par myong ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is that one remembers an object just as it was experienced. But if there are no aspects, the object is not experienced as determined.

original: des na gang gi phyir de las don nges par rnam par 'jog pa de las 'du byas pa so sor nges par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir de las don nges par rnam par 'jog pa de las 'du byas pa so sor nges par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could the conditioned be individually determined from that, from which the object is determined?

original: phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error of mutual dependence would ensue.

original: nyams su myong ba so sor nges pa yin na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba so sor nges pa yin na /
translated: If experience is individually determined,

original: 'dus byas pa so sor nges par 'gyur la //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa so sor nges par 'gyur la //
translated: If the conditioned were ascertained,

original: 'dus ma byas pa so sor nges par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa so sor nges par 'gyur la /
translated: and the unconditioned were ascertained,

original: 'dus ma byas pa so sor nges na yang nyams su myong ba nges pa'i phyir gcig kyang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa so sor nges na yang nyams su myong ba nges pa'i phyir gcig kyang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then even though the unconditioned is ascertained, it would not be one, because the experience is ascertained.

original: gal te rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa tshad ma yin na /
translated: If a cognition that possesses an aspect is valid cognition,

original: de nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bya ba dang / sgrub byed dag gcig tu thal te /
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir bya ba dang / sgrub byed dag gcig tu thal te /
translated: then it follows that the object and the means of knowledge would be one, because the result is that itself.

original: rnam pa ni rtogs pa las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
analyzed: rnam pa ni rtogs pa las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes na /
translated: This is because the aspect is not different from the realization.

original: 'dir yang bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang bshad pa ni /
translated: Here, the explanation is as follows:

original: gal te bya byed gcig yin par //üîΩ'gal lo zhe na mi bden te //üîΩchos tha dad par khas len phyir //
analyzed: gal te bya byed gcig yin par // 'gal lo zhe na mi bden te // chos tha dad par khas len phyir //
translated: If the object and the means of knowledge were one,üîΩthere would be a contradiction.üîΩBut this is not true, because

original: dngos @18b su tha dad med par 'dod //
analyzed: dngos @18b su tha dad med par 'dod //
translated: we accept that the phenomena are different.üîΩAll aspects of the object and the means of knowledge

original: bya ba byed pa'i rnam pa dag / thams cad de ltar rnam par gnas //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rnam pa dag / thams cad de ltar rnam par gnas //
translated: are present in that way.

original: tha dad 'dod pa'i dngos rnams la'ang //
analyzed: tha dad 'dod pa'i dngos rnams la'ang //
translated: Even though the things that are asserted to be different

original: sgro 'dogs pas ni 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pas ni 'jug phyir ro //
translated: are engaged through superimposition.

original: gal te don dam par bya ba dang / sgrub byed dag gcig par mi 'thad do zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par bya ba dang / sgrub byed dag gcig par mi 'thad do zhes brjod na /
translated: If you say that ultimately action and the agent are not tenable as identical,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: byed pa pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bya ba ni byed pa po'i bdag nyid du 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa pa'i bdag nyid can gyi bya ba ni byed pa po'i bdag nyid du 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not contradictory for an action that has the nature of an agent to have the nature of an agent.

original: byed pa ni dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa ni dngos po las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: An action is not different from an entity.

original: 'phar ba dang 'bab pa dag ni sta re las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phar ba dang 'bab pa dag ni sta re las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Rising and falling are not different from an axe.

original: de nyid yul gzhan dang gzhan dag dang 'brel par skyed pa la de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin gyi /üîΩde dag rang gi ngo bo las gzhan ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de nyid yul gzhan dang gzhan dag dang 'brel par skyed pa la de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin gyi / de dag rang gi ngo bo las gzhan ni ma yin la /
translated: It is just that they are conventionally said to be so when they are produced in connection with other and other objects.üîΩThey are not different from their own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang gcig par 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang gcig par 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not contradictory for them to be identical to their own nature.

original: 'on te tha snyad du bya ba dang byed pa po gcig par 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tha snyad du bya ba dang byed pa po gcig par 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: But if you say that conventionally action and the agent are contradictory as identical,

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid de /üîΩchos tha dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid de / chos tha dad par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is precisely what we accept.üîΩBecause we accept that they are different phenomena.

original: rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i chos tha dad pa ni khas len pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i chos tha dad pa ni khas len pa nyid do //
translated: We do accept that they are different phenomena that are posited through conceptualization.

original: bya ba dang byed pa por rnam par gzhag pa thams cad ni de lta bu'i rnam pa can yin te /
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa por rnam par gzhag pa thams cad ni de lta bu'i rnam pa can yin te /
translated: All the presentations of action and agent are of this sort.

original: brtags pa'i tha dad pa can yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa'i tha dad pa can yin no //
translated: They are different in terms of conceptual differentiation.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni //
translated: From following and reversing,

original: gcig dang du mar brtas pas ni //
analyzed: gcig dang du mar brtas pas ni //
translated: from the increase of one and many,üîΩaction and agentüîΩare established as different.

original: bya ba dang ni byed po dag / tha dad tha snyad rnam par gnas re zhig ngo shes pa'i stobs kyis lha sbyin ni gcig nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin la de'i 'dug pa dang 'gro ba dag ni char rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang ni byed po dag / tha dad tha snyad rnam par gnas re zhig ngo shes pa'i stobs kyis lha sbyin ni gcig nyid rnam par gzhag pa yin la de'i 'dug pa dang 'gro ba dag ni char rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: First, by the power of recognition, Devadatta is established as one, and his sitting and walking are established as different.

original: des na de la bya ba dag tha dad du rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de la bya ba dag tha dad du rtog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, action is conceived as different in relation to him.

original: gang zhig de tha mi dad kyang tha dad pa de ni de las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de tha mi dad kyang tha dad pa de ni de las ldog pa yin no //
translated: But although not different from him, he is different from the reversal of him.

original: don dam par ni lha sbyin nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag las tha mi dad pa can tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni lha sbyin nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag las tha mi dad pa can tha dad pa yin no //
translated: In the ultimate, Devadatta himself is not different from the particular states.

original: des na 'jig rten na tha dad par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la yang gcig tu sgro btags nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten na tha dad par 'dod pa'i dngos po rnams la yang gcig tu sgro btags nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, although things that are different are accepted in the world, they are engaged by superimposing oneness on them.

original: de'i don bya ba byed pa po tha dad pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i don bya ba byed pa po tha dad pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the object and the agent of activity are posited as different.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But not ultimately.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa yang rtogs pa thams cad kyi khyab byed ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa yang rtogs pa thams cad kyi khyab byed ma yin la /
translated: Similarly, the aspect is not the pervader of all realizations,

original: rtogs pa ni rnam pa mtha' dag khyab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni rnam pa mtha' dag khyab par byed pa yin no //
translated: but realization is the pervader of all aspects.

original: des tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag tha dad par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: des tshad ma dang 'bras bu dag tha dad par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, valid knowledge and its effect are posited as different.

original: don dam par ni snang ba'i rnam pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni snang ba'i rnam pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
translated: But ultimately, the appearance of the aspect itself is the effect.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the aspect is valid knowledge,

original: don rig @19a * //
analyzed: don rig @19a * //
translated: and the cognition of the object

original: pa ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: pa ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: is the effect.

original: 'bras bu tshad ma las tha mi dad pa nyid dang de las kyang tshad ma tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu tshad ma las tha mi dad pa nyid dang de las kyang tshad ma tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: The effect is not different from valid knowledge, and valid knowledge is not different from that.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩbyed dang bcas par rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de skad du yang / byed dang bcas par rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus it is said:üîΩBecause it is realized as having an effect,

original: 'bras bu nyid ni tshad mar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ni tshad mar 'gyur //
translated: the effect itself becomes valid knowledge.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: So it is explained.

original: yang na 'dir yang rig pa 'bras bu yin /
analyzed: yang na 'dir yang rig pa 'bras bu yin /
translated: Or, here, awareness is the effect.

original: te rang rig pa nyid gnyis su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: te rang rig pa nyid gnyis su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: It is the effect of the consciousness that appears as dual.

original: 'jig rten don du gnyer ba'i 'bras bu don rig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten don du gnyer ba'i 'bras bu don rig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the awareness of the object that is sought by the world the effect?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang tshe don rig yod min tshe //
analyzed: gang tshe don rig yod min tshe //
translated: When there is no awareness of the object,

original: 'jig rten don don gnyer mi 'thad //üîΩnam yang ma mthong don la ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten don don gnyer mi 'thad // nam yang ma mthong don la ni //
translated: It is not tenable that the world seeks the object.

original: 'jig rten don gnyer srid ma yin //
analyzed: 'jig rten don gnyer srid ma yin //
translated: The world does not seek the objectüîΩThat is never seen.

original: thos pa yang brgyud nas mthong ba nyid la yin no //
analyzed: thos pa yang brgyud nas mthong ba nyid la yin no //
translated: Hearing is also seeing indirectly.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don rig pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don rig pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the awareness of the object such as blue the effect?

original: ji ltar don mi rig ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar don mi rig ce na /
translated: How is it that the object is not cognized?

original: 'di la brgal zhing brtag pa ni //üîΩdon rig gang yin so sor rig / mngon sum gang yin 'di nyid do //
analyzed: 'di la brgal zhing brtag pa ni // don rig gang yin so sor rig / mngon sum gang yin 'di nyid do //
translated: Here, the objection and response are:üîΩThe awareness of the object is the individual cognition,üîΩAnd that is perception.

original: de ni gang gis don rig yin //
analyzed: de ni gang gis don rig yin //
translated: How is it that the object is cognized by that?

original: de 'dra las yin 'khrul par 'gyur //
analyzed: de 'dra las yin 'khrul par 'gyur //
translated: It would be mistaken because of that.

original: gal te so sor nges pa 'am so sor rig par 'gyur pa'i yin na /
analyzed: gal te so sor nges pa 'am so sor rig par 'gyur pa'i yin na /
translated: If it is the individual ascertainment or individual cognition,

original: de'i tshe rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa nyid don rig pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad tsam kho na 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa nyid don rig pa yin pa'i phyir tha snyad tsam kho na 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: At that time, since consciousness itself, which has aspects, is the cognition of objects, it is only a mere convention.

original: don rig pa nyid ni mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: don rig pa nyid ni mi 'grub bo //
translated: The cognition of objects is not established.

original: 'on te de'i rang bzhin nyid las don rig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de'i rang bzhin nyid las don rig pa yin te /
translated: But if it is the nature of that consciousness itself to be the cognition of objects,

original: de lta bu med na de'i rang bzhin mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu med na de'i rang bzhin mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then if it were not like that, it would be impossible for it to be its nature.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: skra dang sbrang bu la sogs pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skra dang sbrang bu la sogs pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is mistaken with respect to hair, bees, and so on.

original: 'on te don rig pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don rig pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is the cognition of objects, what is it?

original: de nyid dpyad par bya ba yin //
analyzed: de nyid dpyad par bya ba yin //
translated: That is what should be investigated.

original: gal te don rig pa med na de'i tshe nyams su myong ba 'di gang la yin te /
analyzed: gal te don rig pa med na de'i tshe nyams su myong ba 'di gang la yin te /
translated: If there is no cognition of objects, then what is this experience?

original: nyams su myong ba ni myong bar bya ba'i mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni myong bar bya ba'i mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because experience is the culmination of what is to be experienced.

original: rab rib can la skra la sogs pa myong ba yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rab rib can la skra la sogs pa myong ba yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could there be an experience of hair and so on for one with myodesopsia?

original: gal te kha cig don la brten pa nyid du mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kha cig don la brten pa nyid du mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If someone says, ‚ÄúI see it to be based on objects,‚Äù

original: de nyid dpyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dpyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: But this is to be examined.

original: mthong ba ni yin na don gyi zhes ni mthong ba med de /
analyzed: mthong ba ni yin na don gyi zhes ni mthong ba med de /
translated: If it is seeing, then it is not seeing the object,

original: don ni mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te skyes pa tsam gyis don rig pa yin na mig kyang des rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don ni mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro // gal te skyes pa tsam gyis don rig pa yin na mig kyang des rig par 'gyur te /
translated: because the object is not seen.

original: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If consciousness is aware of the object merely by being born, then the eye would be aware of it, because it is the cause of the birth of consciousness.üîΩJust as one infers fire from smoke, so one infers the object from consciousness.üîΩBut just as the object is inferred from the effect, so the eye is also inferred.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu mthong ba las rjes su dpag pas don rjes su dpag par bya ba de bzhin du mig kyang yin pas de yang des rig pa dang / de nyid de'i rnam par brtag @19b par 'gyur ro //üîΩphyi rol gyi yul gyi rnam pas phyi rol nyid du brtag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu mthong ba las rjes su dpag pas don rjes su dpag par bya ba de bzhin du mig kyang yin pas de yang des rig pa dang / de nyid de'i rnam par brtag @19b par 'gyur ro // phyi rol gyi yul gyi rnam pas phyi rol nyid du brtag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the eye is also inferred from the effect.üîΩIf you think that the external object is inferred from the form of the external object,

original: ci me long gi rnam pas bzhin de'i yul du rtog gam /üîΩdes na bzhin ltar mtha' dad la gnas pa yin te /üîΩbzhin ltar gzugs brnyan gyis snang ba yin no zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: ci me long gi rnam pas bzhin de'i yul du rtog gam / des na bzhin ltar mtha' dad la gnas pa yin te / bzhin ltar gzugs brnyan gyis snang ba yin no zhes brtag par bya'o //
translated: is the face inferred from the form of the mirror?üîΩOr is the mirror inferred from the face?üîΩOr is the face inferred from the mirror?üîΩOr is the mirror inferred from the face?üîΩOr is the face imagined to be in the mirror?

original: rdul phran de dag gang gis na //
analyzed: rdul phran de dag gang gis na //
translated: Or is the mirror imagined to be in the face?

original: rags pas snang ba de 'drar byed //
analyzed: rags pas snang ba de 'drar byed //
translated: The gross form is the cause of the appearance of that form.

original: gal te rngul phra rab yul yin na de la rags pas snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba med pas ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: gal te rngul phra rab yul yin na de la rags pas snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yin pa'i phyir 'dra ba med pas ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i yul yin te /
translated: If the subtle atoms are the object, then the consciousness of the gross form does not exist, because there is no similarity. How can the atoms be the object of consciousness?

original: shing la sogs pa la gong bur 'dzin pa ltar 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa la gong bur 'dzin pa ltar 'khrul pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be just like the error of apprehending a pile of wood and so on as a person.

original: kha dog rnam par 'dra bar byed pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog rnam par 'dra bar byed pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the gross form is the cause of the appearance of the similarity of color, that is not so.

original: dbyibs ni kha dog las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs ni kha dog las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because shape is not different from color.

original: dbyibs kha dog gi bdag nyid yin na ni rags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyibs kha dog gi bdag nyid yin na ni rags pa nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If shape were the same as color, then it would be gross.

original: ci ste rags pa nyid ni 'dzin pa'i chos yin la /
analyzed: ci ste rags pa nyid ni 'dzin pa'i chos yin la /
translated: If you say that grossness is the quality of the apprehender,

original: kha dog ni gzung ba'i chos yin te /
analyzed: kha dog ni gzung ba'i chos yin te /
translated: and color is the quality of the apprehended,

original: mang po gzung ba na rags pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'grub pa yin gyi rngul phrar rab so so bdag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mang po gzung ba na rags pa zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'grub pa yin gyi rngul phrar rab so so bdag la ni ma yin no //
translated: then when many are apprehended, the convention of grossness is established, but not for each individual subtle atom.

original: sngon po nyid la sogs pa ni der so sor yin te des de ni gzung ba'i phyir yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po nyid la sogs pa ni der so sor yin te des de ni gzung ba'i phyir yin no zhe na /
translated: But the blue, etc. are each individually in that, because they are apprehended as that.

original: gal te de lta yin pa de lta na yang bar dang bcas pa dag la bar med par gzung ba'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin pa de lta na yang bar dang bcas pa dag la bar med par gzung ba'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid do //
translated: Even if that is so, there is error, because the intervals are apprehended as without intervals.

original: ma yin te bar yul ma yin pa nyid kyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin te bar yul ma yin pa nyid kyis mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: No, because the intervals are not visible, since they are not objects.

original: gal te de ltar na nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral pa'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po med pa yin pas bar med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral pa'i mtshan nyid ni dngos po med pa yin pas bar med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, since the definition of non-existence is the absence of all verbal description, it would be without intervals,

original: de'i phyir dngos po bar med pa nyid du brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po bar med pa nyid du brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: and therefore it would be reasonable to suppose that entities are without intervals.

original: bar med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bar med pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is not reasonable that they be without intervals.

original: ; dngos po cha shas dang bcas pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: ; dngos po cha shas dang bcas pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that entities have parts,

original: rnam par shes pa bzhin du dngos po cha med pa nyid du yin pas rdul phra rab tu grub po zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bzhin du dngos po cha med pa nyid du yin pas rdul phra rab tu grub po zhe na ma yin te /
translated: because, like consciousness, they are established as atoms, since entities are partless.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no connection.

original: dam bcas pa mngon sum gyis bsal ba'i phyir yang de mi rigs so //
analyzed: dam bcas pa mngon sum gyis bsal ba'i phyir yang de mi rigs so //
translated: And it is not reasonable that it be a direct perception, because it is contradicted by direct perception.

original: mngon su ma med par rjes su dpag pa yang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon su ma med par rjes su dpag pa yang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because inference does not occur without direct perception.

original: rags pa ni phra mo tshogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: rags pa ni phra mo tshogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the gross is the nature of an aggregation of the subtle,

original: 'di la sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'di la sngar lan btab zin pa'i phyir yang mi brjod do //
translated: we have already given an answer to this, so we will not elaborate.

original: de'i phyir de ni don dngos min //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni don dngos min //
translated: Therefore, it is not a real object.

original: yin yang 'khrul pa can yin pas /
analyzed: yin yang 'khrul pa can yin pas /
translated: Even if it were, it would be mistaken.

original: de myong ba yi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de myong ba yi ngo bo nyid //
translated: The nature of the experience of that

original: sgrub par byed pa nus ma yin //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nus ma yin //
translated: is not a proof.

original: don gyi rang @20a * //
analyzed: don gyi rang @20a * //
translated: The nature of the object

original: bzhin yang 'khrul pa yin pa de'i phyir de tsam gyis don rig go zhes bya bar mi 'grub po //
analyzed: bzhin yang 'khrul pa yin pa de'i phyir de tsam gyis don rig go zhes bya bar mi 'grub po //
translated: is also mistaken. Therefore, it is not established that consciousness of the object is merely that.

original: 'khrul pa nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Mistakenness itself is not a proof,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i don ni mi 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i don ni mi 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of proof is non-mistaken.

original: 'khrul pa yin yang sgrub byed yin na ni thams cad kyi sgrub par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin yang sgrub byed yin na ni thams cad kyi sgrub par byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were a proof even though mistaken, then everything would be a proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni yod pa nyid 'jog par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni yod pa nyid 'jog par byed pa yin na /
translated: If the proof is the establishment of existence,

original: 'khrul pa de ni res 'ga' med par yang 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid kyi phyogs 'phen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa de ni res 'ga' med par yang 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid kyi phyogs 'phen pa ma yin no //
translated: then that error would sometimes be nonexistent, and so it does not establish the position of existence.

original: de'i phyir yod pa nyid dang cig shes gcig gi tshe gcig la 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa nyid dang cig shes gcig gi tshe gcig la 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsam gyis don sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin tsam gyis don sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the mere nature of consciousness of blue, etc. does not establish the object, it is not ascertained.

original: gzhan yang / don gcig po'i myong ba rnams kyang 'dra ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang / don gcig po'i myong ba rnams kyang 'dra ba yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the experiences of a single object are similar,

original: de dag phan tshun rig par byed pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun rig par byed pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: then they are not the things that mutually cognize each other.

original: rgyu gzhan gyi myong ba 'dra ba yin yang myong bar bya ba 'am myong bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan gyi myong ba 'dra ba yin yang myong bar bya ba 'am myong bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though the experiences of other causes are similar, they are not the experiences of the object or the experiencer.

original: de 'dra ba dang de las byung //
analyzed: de 'dra ba dang de las byung //
translated: If they are similar to that and arise from that,

original: gal te myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: gal te myong ba'i mtshan nyid yin //
translated: then they have the characteristic of experience.

original: don mtshungs can gyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: don mtshungs can gyi rnam par shes //
translated: Consciousness has a similar object.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag myong 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag myong 'gyur //
translated: It is similar to that which is to be experienced in the next moment.

original: gal te gnag las skyes pa dang 'dra ba de des rig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnag las skyes pa dang 'dra ba de des rig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is similar to that which arises from black, then it is known by that.

original: 'o na ni de'i tshe yul mtshungs pa'i shes pa de ma thag pa yul yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i tshe yul mtshungs pa'i shes pa de ma thag pa yul yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the object of the consciousness of similar object is the object of the immediately preceding consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe snga ma la yang sngon po'i rnam pa can yin la de'i de ma thag pa las skyes pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snga ma la yang sngon po'i rnam pa can yin la de'i de ma thag pa las skyes pa /
translated: When the former is also the aspect of blue, and the latter arises from the immediately preceding,

original: phyi ma yang sngon po'i rnam pa can yin pa de'i tshe rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dra bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma yul yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma yang sngon po'i rnam pa can yin pa de'i tshe rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dra bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir snga ma yul yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the latter is also the aspect of blue, then the former is the object because it is the cause and because it is the similar producer.

original: 'on te gang las sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par skye ba rnam pa de dang ldan pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gang las sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par skye ba rnam pa de dang ldan pa'i yul yin no //
translated: But if the object is that from which the aspect of blue and so on arises, it is the object that possesses that aspect.

original: yul mtshungs pa'i shes pa la yod pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni de ma thag pa las byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yul mtshungs pa'i shes pa la yod pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni de ma thag pa las byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The aspect that exists in the consciousness of similar object is not derived from the immediately preceding condition.

original: de ltar ma yin na sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi de ma thag pa las ser por shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi de ma thag pa las ser por shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then immediately after the aspect of blue, there would be no cognition of yellow.

original: des na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de ma thag pas byas pa'i ma yin no zhes rtogs pas de yul nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa de ma thag pas byas pa'i ma yin no zhes rtogs pas de yul nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is understood that the aspect of blue, etc. is not produced by the immediately preceding condition, it is not the object.

original: gzhan dag smra ba ni gang gi tshe sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi de ma thag pa las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa sngon po'i rnam pa can skye ba de'i snga ma yul yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag smra ba ni gang gi tshe sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi de ma thag pa las rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa sngon po'i rnam pa can skye ba de'i snga ma yul yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Others say: When the conceptual cognition having the aspect of blue arises immediately after the one having the aspect of blue, the former is the object,

original: de ni rnam pa byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes so//
analyzed: de ni rnam pa byed pa po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes so//
translated: because it is the agent of the aspect.

original: @20b de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: @20b de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so.

original: myong ba ni dran pa'i yul yin par 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: myong ba ni dran pa'i yul yin par 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: It is accepted that the object of memory is experience.

original: de lta bu nyid du yang shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du yang shes pa yin te /
translated: And it is known in that way,üîΩbecause it is said:

original: 'di ltar / 'jig rten thams cad dran pa las //üîΩrjes su 'brang bas don myong ba //üîΩrtogs 'gyur dngos su don dag ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'jig rten thams cad dran pa las // rjes su 'brang bas don myong ba // rtogs 'gyur dngos su don dag ni //
translated: All the world follows memory,üîΩexperiencing the object.üîΩOne understands the object

original: rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: directly, but not the object itself.

original: gang gi tshe dran pa brjed pa med pa de'i tshe dran pa thams cad don myong ba la 'jug par rtogs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dran pa brjed pa med pa de'i tshe dran pa thams cad don myong ba la 'jug par rtogs so //
translated: When there is no forgetting, then it is understood that all memory engages the experience of an object.

original: des na 'di ni myong ba'i yul can du 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'di ni myong ba'i yul can du 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is accepted that memory has an experienced object.

original: khas blangs pa nyid skyon du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pa nyid skyon du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the mere acceptance of memory is faulty.

original: gzhan yang dran pa 'di ni yul med pa yin pas 'di'i yul bsams pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang dran pa 'di ni yul med pa yin pas 'di'i yul bsams pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Moreover, since this memory is without an object, what is the point of considering its object?

original: 'dir brjod pa ;
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa ;
translated: Here we say:

original: sngar gyi sngon po nyams su myong ba las bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal bar snang ba skyed pa gang yin pa de'i yul snga ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar gyi sngon po nyams su myong ba las bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal bar snang ba skyed pa gang yin pa de'i yul snga ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The object of that which is produced by the power of meditation, the clear appearance of the experience of the previous blue, is the previous blue.

original: ji ltar de de ma thag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de de ma thag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is that the antecedent condition?

original: de 'dra ba rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan bar du byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba rigs mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan bar du byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another consciousness of a similar type does not occur in between.

original: ji ltar de skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de skyed par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is that the productive cause?

original: 'di la lan btab zin to //
analyzed: 'di la lan btab zin to //
translated: This has already been answered.

original: bar du chod kyang skyed bar byed pa yin no zhes 'di ni bstan zin te //
analyzed: bar du chod kyang skyed bar byed pa yin no zhes 'di ni bstan zin te //
translated: But it is already explained that even if there is an interval, it is the producer.

original: yang na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid goms pa las gsal bar snang ba'i skyed par byed pa yin pas yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa nyid goms pa las gsal bar snang ba'i skyed par byed pa yin pas yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, the aspect of the conceptualization itself is the object, because it is the producer of the clear appearance that results from the cultivation of the aspect.

original: des na rnam pa de las ni don gnas pa ma yin no //üîΩrigs gang gang las byung ba des //
analyzed: des na rnam pa de las ni don gnas pa ma yin no // rigs gang gang las byung ba des //
translated: Therefore, the object is not the real entity that is the aspect.üîΩIt is not reasonable to understand the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúThe object is the cause of the arising of the aspect,‚Äù to mean that the object is the cause of the arising of the aspect because it is the cause of the arising of the aspect that is the same type as the aspect that exists.

original: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas don gyi rnam ba 'di ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyi rigs mthun pa las yin par gnas pa'i don du rtogs pa de ni mi rigs sol / des na de ma thag pa'i shes pa nyid yul yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rigs pas don gyi rnam ba 'di ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyi rigs mthun pa las yin par gnas pa'i don du rtogs pa de ni mi rigs sol / des na de ma thag pa'i shes pa nyid yul yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the immediately preceding consciousness itself is the object.

original: de lta na ni 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na /
translated: If that is so, then the statement,üîΩ‚ÄúI see this, I hear that,‚Äù

original: 'di mthong 'di thos zhes bya bar //üîΩgang la blo na nges pa de //üîΩde myong yin na gang gis de //
analyzed: 'di mthong 'di thos zhes bya bar // gang la blo na nges pa de // de myong yin na gang gis de //
translated: would not be reasonable.üîΩIf the object is that which is experienced,üîΩthen by what is the object established?

original: de yi sgrub byed yin 'dod pa //
analyzed: de yi sgrub byed yin 'dod pa //
translated: If it is claimed that the object is established by the experience,

original: snang dang mthong ba de dag gi //
analyzed: snang dang mthong ba de dag gi //
translated: then the proximity of the appearance and the seeing

original: nye ba de ni dpyad bya yin //
analyzed: nye ba de ni dpyad bya yin //
translated: must be investigated.

original: de dag 'brel pa la brten nas //
analyzed: de dag 'brel pa la brten nas //
translated: And in dependence on their connection,üîΩ

original: lta ba po yi nges de yin //üîΩgal te dong nas pa ni nges pa las yin no//
analyzed: lta ba po yi nges de yin // gal te dong nas pa ni nges pa las yin no//
translated: The ascertainment of the seer is due to the connection of those.üîΩIf the object is gone, the ascertainment is from memory.

original: des  par ni don las gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: des  par ni don las gzhan du mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The ascertainment is not from the object itself, because the object is not present.

original: 'di de ma thag pa'i rkyen las byung do zhes des pa ni med de /
analyzed: 'di de ma thag pa'i rkyen las byung do zhes des pa ni med de /
translated: There is no ascertainment from the immediately preceding condition,

original: 'on kyang nga'i myong ba 'di'i yul ni don yin gyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: 'on kyang nga'i myong ba 'di'i yul ni don yin gyi de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: but rather that the object of my experience is the object, not the immediately preceding condition.

original: don nyams su myong ba med par ni don no zhes nges par rag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don nyams su myong ba med par ni don no zhes nges par rag pa ma yin te /
translated: Without the experience of the object, there is no ascertainment that it is an object.

original: nges pa @21a * //
analyzed: nges pa @21a * //
translated: Ascertainment

original: ni myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ni myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: follows experience.

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this, we reply:

original: nyams su myong bas don rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyams su myong bas don rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The object is not ascertained by experience,

original: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i nges pa las yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni long ba gcig gis ni lam mi rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i nges pa las yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni long ba gcig gis ni lam mi rtogs kyi /
translated: but rather by the ascertainment that follows it. This is like how a blind person does not perceive the path,üîΩbut a sighted person does.

original: des khrid pa'i gnyis pas yin no zhes bya ba de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: des khrid pa'i gnyis pas yin no zhes bya ba de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: It is very strange that the second, which is guided by the first, should say, ‚ÄúIt is so.‚ÄùüîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / dngos su don las skyes pa yi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos su don las skyes pa yi //
translated: The cognition that actually arises from the objectüîΩdoes not see the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the object

original: shes pas gang zhig mi mthong ba'i //
analyzed: shes pas gang zhig mi mthong ba'i //
translated: is not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the objectüîΩis not the cognition that arises from the object.

original: don de de las gzhan pa yi //üîΩzhen pas yin zhes gzu lums yin //
analyzed: don de de las gzhan pa yi // zhen pas yin zhes gzu lums yin //
translated: The cognition that arises from the objectüîΩis not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the object

original: nges pa ni myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa ni myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no //
translated: is not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the objectüîΩis not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the objectüîΩis not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the objectüîΩis not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the object

original: des 'di ni don nyams su myong ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam ni ma yin no zhes nges pa nyid las rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: des 'di ni don nyams su myong ba yin gyi rang gi ngo bo tsam ni ma yin no zhes nges pa nyid las rtogs pa yin te /
translated: is not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the objectüîΩis not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the objectüîΩis not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the object

original: de lta ma yin na nges pa de lta bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nges pa de lta bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: is not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the objectüîΩis not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the object

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /üîΩnyams su myong ba nyid gang gi zhes mi shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te / nyams su myong ba nyid gang gi zhes mi shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: is not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the objectüîΩis not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the object

original: ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid du 'grub /üîΩ'o na nges pa ga las she na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid du 'grub / 'o na nges pa ga las she na /
translated: is not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the objectüîΩis not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the objectüîΩis not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the objectüîΩis not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the objectüîΩis not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the objectüîΩis not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the objectüîΩis not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the object

original: goms pa nyid las yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: goms pa nyid las yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: is not the cognition that arises from the object.üîΩThe cognition that arises from the objectüîΩis not the cognition that apprehends the object.üîΩThe cognition that apprehends the object

original: goms pa de yang myong ba nyid las yin pa'i phyir ga las phyin kyi log tu nges she na /
analyzed: goms pa de yang myong ba nyid las yin pa'i phyir ga las phyin kyi log tu nges she na /
translated: But since that habituation is due to experience, how can it be ascertained as erroneous?

original: 'di yang lan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang lan ma yin te /
translated: This is not a response.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin na ni 'ga' yang phyin ci log tu nges par mi 'gyur ba zhig na mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin na ni 'ga' yang phyin ci log tu nges par mi 'gyur ba zhig na mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: Because if that were so, then no one would be ascertained as having error, but they are seen to be.

original: des na 'di ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na 'di ni mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore this is not tenable.

original: gal te lta ba tsam ni rnam par 'byed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te lta ba tsam ni rnam par 'byed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say: The mere view does not distinguish,

original: des na nges pa kho nas don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed do zhe na /
analyzed: des na nges pa kho nas don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed do zhe na /
translated: but ascertainment definitely distinguishes the object and nonobject.

original: gal te de lta na ni nges pa yang rnam par 'byed par byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni nges pa yang rnam par 'byed par byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then ascertainment would not distinguish,

original: zla ba gnyis su shes pa ni zla ba gcig tu nges par byed pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su shes pa ni zla ba gcig tu nges par byed pa ma yin no ;
translated: because the cognition of two moons does not ascertain one moon.

original: ; ci ste goms pa las nges pa ni bye brag tu sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ; ci ste goms pa las nges pa ni bye brag tu sgrub par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say: Ascertainment is established as a distinguisher through habituation,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so,

original: goms pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa ni rgyu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because habituation is not a cause.

original: so sor nges par nyams su myong na nges pa de goms pa la 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor nges par nyams su myong na nges pa de goms pa la 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: If it is experienced individually, then the ascertainment is the cultivation of that.

original: don zhes nges pa yang don bya ba byed pa 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: don zhes nges pa yang don bya ba byed pa 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If ascertainment is the object, then the object is asserted to be the performance of a function.

original: don byed pa de ni snang ba gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: don byed pa de ni snang ba gzhan nyid do //
translated: That performance of a function is a different appearance.

original: snang ba las snang ba gzhan mi skye ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba las snang ba gzhan mi skye ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not that an appearance does not arise from an appearance.

original: des na nges pa las don gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nges pa las don gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object does not endure due to ascertainment.

original: ci ste nyams su myong ba de gang la yin zhes gang brjod pa de la yang brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ci ste nyams su myong ba de gang la yin zhes gang brjod pa de la yang brjod pa ni /
translated: If it is said that the experience is of what, then the response to that is:

original: de yi myong de bdag nyid de //
analyzed: de yi myong de bdag nyid de //
translated: The experience of that is of its own nature.

original: de gzhan 'ga' zhig gi ma yin //
analyzed: de gzhan 'ga' zhig gi ma yin //
translated: It is not of any other.

original: mngon sum so sor @21b rig bya yang //
analyzed: mngon sum so sor @21b rig bya yang //
translated: Even though it is individually cognized by direct perception,

original: de yi de ni bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: de yi de ni bdag nyid yin //
translated: that is its own nature.

original: don rnams kyi rang bzhin ni rgyu med par mi skye ba'i phyir 'di ga las zhes rgyu 'dri ba ni rigs kyi /
analyzed: don rnams kyi rang bzhin ni rgyu med par mi skye ba'i phyir 'di ga las zhes rgyu 'dri ba ni rigs kyi /
translated: Since the nature of objects does not arise without a cause, it is logical to ask, ‚ÄúWhat is its cause?‚Äù

original: 'di gad la yin zhes 'dri ba'i don de go gang zhig /'di ltar /
analyzed: 'di gad la yin zhes 'dri ba'i don de go gang zhig /'di ltar /
translated: But it is not logical to ask, ‚ÄúWhat is its object?‚Äù

original: myong 'di gang la zhes brjod la //
analyzed: myong 'di gang la zhes brjod la //
translated: In that case, the response to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the experience of that?‚ÄùüîΩis as follows:

original: gang tshe don la slar bzlog pa //
analyzed: gang tshe don la slar bzlog pa //
translated: When the meaning is reversed,

original: de tshe don 'di gang la zhes //
analyzed: de tshe don 'di gang la zhes //
translated: then the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of this?‚Äù

original: 'dri ba thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dri ba thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: will be endless.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dri ba ni rtsed mo yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i dri ba ni rtsed mo yin no //
translated: A question of this sort is a joke.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mthar thug pa ma mthong pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar don de gang las yin / de gang la de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthar thug pa ma mthong pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar don de gang las yin / de gang la de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the end is not seen.

original: yang brgal zhing brtag pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: yang brgal zhing brtag pa med do zhe na /
translated: Thus, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of this?‚Äù is not to be investigated further, because it is seen to be just like that.

original: gal te de lta na ni don mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni don mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then because the meaning is not seen,

original: myong ba yang rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: myong ba yang rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa yin te /
translated: experience also would abide in its own nature,

original: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is seen to be just like that.

original: gzhi brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhi brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of investigating the basis?

original: 'dis ni drug pa'i don la brgal zhing brtags pa yang spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni drug pa'i don la brgal zhing brtags pa yang spangs pa yin te /
translated: By this, the objection and investigation regarding the meaning of the sixth verse is also rejected.

original: de brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de brjod pa ni /
translated: To explain that, he says:

original: de gzhan 'ga' zhig gi ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de gzhan 'ga' zhig gi ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is not from any other.

original: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum du so sor rig par bya ba'i don dgag par nus /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum du so sor rig par bya ba'i don dgag par nus /
translated: But how can you refute the object that is directly perceived and individually known?

original: 'di ltar de dang ldan pa mngon sum gyis sngon po mthong ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dang ldan pa mngon sum gyis sngon po mthong ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: It is not so, because the eye consciousness that possesses that eye sense faculty sees blue.

original: don mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: don mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it is not so, because the object is not seen.

original: mngon sum rig bya de yi ni //
analyzed: mngon sum rig bya de yi ni //
translated: The object of direct perception is

original: rnam pa nyid yin don gzhan min //üîΩrnam pa de la sngon po zhes //
analyzed: rnam pa nyid yin don gzhan min // rnam pa de la sngon po zhes //
translated: just the appearance of that, not another object.üîΩThe convention ‚Äúblue‚Äù is designated

original: tha snyad 'dogs kyi gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs kyi gzhan ma yin //
translated: to that appearance, not to another.

original: de'i phyir sngon po'i bdag nyid can gyi myong ba ni sngon po myong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po'i bdag nyid can gyi myong ba ni sngon po myong ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the experience that has the nature of blue is the experience of blue,

original: dper na mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mchi gu'i lus zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, one says ‚Äúthe body of the lump.‚Äù

original: drug pa'i don zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: drug pa'i don zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not different merely by the name ‚Äúobject of the sixth.‚Äù

original: 'di ni rnam pa ji ltar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa ji ltar yang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it can be of any appearance.

original: yang na gal te de la myong ba gzhan med na de mngon sum du nyams su myong bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang na gal te de la myong ba gzhan med na de mngon sum du nyams su myong bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or, if there is no other experience of that, how can it be directly experienced?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so.

original: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i myong ba nyid kyis gsal bar mngon sum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i myong ba nyid kyis gsal bar mngon sum du 'gyur te /
translated: The experience that is its own nature is clearly manifest in direct perception.

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi mngon sum du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi mngon sum du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that it is the direct perception of something else.

original: de'i ngo bo ni gzhan gyir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni gzhan gyir mi 'gyur te /
translated: Its nature does not become something else.

original: de lta yin na gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would not be something else.

original: yang na rnam par shes pa lkog tu gyur pas na gang zhig myong ba de ni don yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang na rnam par shes pa lkog tu gyur pas na gang zhig myong ba de ni don yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Moreover, since consciousness is hidden, that which experiences it is the object.

original: gal te de lta na de'i myong ba de bdag nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na de'i myong ba de bdag nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, its experience would be its own nature.

original: gzhan la rig par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la rig par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would not be known to another.

original: gyur mod ci skyon zhe na /
analyzed: gyur mod ci skyon zhe na /
translated: What is the problem if that is the case?

original: de gzhan 'ga' zhig gi ma yin //
analyzed: de gzhan 'ga' zhig gi ma yin //
translated: It is not the case that it is something else.

original: @22a * // gal te don gyi bdag nyid yin na gzhan la yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad de mthong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: @22a * // gal te don gyi bdag nyid yin na gzhan la yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad de mthong bar 'gyur na /
translated: If it were the nature of the object, it would be like that for others as well, and everyone would see it.

original: gzhan la ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case for others.

original: gal te mngon sum gyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyis rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If it is known by direct perception,

original: bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But not by itself.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: gal te de'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs pas tha dad par rnam par bzhag nas de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de'i rang bzhin nyid rtogs pas tha dad par rnam par bzhag nas de ltar tha snyad byed pa yin no //
translated: If you posit that it is different because it is understood to have a nature of its own, then it is not the object of the experience.

original: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa gzhan gyis rig par bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, blue, etc., are not objects of the experience of another,

original: bdag nyid de kho na myong pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid de kho na myong pa yin no //
translated: because it is the self that experiences them.

original: yang na gal te don myong ba med na phyi rol gyi yul phyogs dang 'brang par spyod yul du 'gyur ba 'di ji ltar bya zhe na ;
analyzed: yang na gal te don myong ba med na phyi rol gyi yul phyogs dang 'brang par spyod yul du 'gyur ba 'di ji ltar bya zhe na ;
translated: Or, if there is no experience of objects, how can the external object be the object of experience, since it is not related to the experience?

original: bdag nyid myong ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid myong ba yin te /
translated: It is the self that experiences it,

original: sems nyid myong ba yin no //
analyzed: sems nyid myong ba yin no //
translated: because the mind itself is the experience.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi yul yin //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi yul yin //
translated: How can it be an external object?

original: de yang gzhan gyi ma yin te //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi ma yin te //
translated: And it is not the experience of another,

original: de'i phyir 'di ji ltar phyi rol du gyur pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ji ltar phyi rol du gyur pa yin /
translated: so how can it be external?

original: yang na de bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na de bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Or, it is of the nature of the self,

original: 'di thams cad ni bdag kho na yin no zhes khyed kyis kyang khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni bdag kho na yin no zhes khyed kyis kyang khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you also accept that all of this is the self.

original: de yang myong ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang myong ba yin no //
translated: And that is the experience.

original: de yang gzhan gyi ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang bdag kho na'i yin te /
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang bdag kho na'i yin te /
translated: It is not of another, but rather of the self alone,

original: de las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference from it.

original: de ni brjod pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni brjod pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that this is a verbal expression, it is not so,

original: mngon sum du so sor rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du so sor rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be known by direct perception.

original: gang gi phyir de mngon sum du rig par bya ba nyid ni bdag nyid kho nas yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de mngon sum du rig par bya ba nyid ni bdag nyid kho nas yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is to be known by direct perception, it is of the self alone, not of another.

original: gal te bdag tu smra bar thal lo zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag tu smra bar thal lo zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that this entails the theory of a self, it is not so,

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the experience of various things.

original: ma rig pa'i dbang gis bskyed pa'i phyir de ni myong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i dbang gis bskyed pa'i phyir de ni myong ba kho na'o //
translated: It is an experience only because it is produced by the power of nescience.

original: bdag tu smra ba ni nye bar mkho ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba ni nye bar mkho ba ma yin te /
translated: The theory of a self is not necessary,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rab tu zhi ba dang / rjes su mthun pa ni bdag med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rab tu zhi ba dang / rjes su mthun pa ni bdag med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: because the absence of self is favorable to the pacification of attachment, etc.

original: 'di nyid 'og nas ston pa ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'og nas ston pa ni //
translated: This is taught below:

original: des na nyams myong bya gzhan med //
analyzed: des na nyams myong bya gzhan med //
translated: Therefore, there is no other experience.

original: de la 'ang myong ba gzhan yod min //
analyzed: de la 'ang myong ba gzhan yod min //
translated: And there is no other experience of that.

original: der yang brtsad pa mtshungs phyir te //
analyzed: der yang brtsad pa mtshungs phyir te //
translated: And there is the same objection there,

original: de ni rang nyid gsal ba yin //
analyzed: de ni rang nyid gsal ba yin //
translated: because that is itself the illumination.

original: blos nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: blos nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Whatever is experienced by the mind is not other than that.

original: ji ltar myong bar bya ba med par de ltar brjod zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar myong bar bya ba med par de ltar brjod zin to //
translated: As it has been said, ‚ÄúThere is no experience without an object of experience.‚Äù

original: 'o na de myong bar byed pa gzhan myong ba'i blor 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de myong bar byed pa gzhan myong ba'i blor 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it is the mind that experiences that!

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not,

original: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of the nature of subject and object.

original: myong ba gzhan ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: myong ba gzhan ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: And another experience is not the experience of that, because it remains in its own nature.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi myong ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi myong ba yin /
translated: How can it be the experience of another?

original: mngon du byed pa la sogs pa spangs pa @22b yin no ;
analyzed: mngon du byed pa la sogs pa spangs pa @22b yin no ;
translated: It is not the case that it is not experienced at all.

original: ; de myong bar rjes su zhugs na yang de dag gcig nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: ; de myong bar rjes su zhugs na yang de dag gcig nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: And if it is engaged in the experience of that, they become identical.

original: de lta yin dang rang nyid kho na gsal ba yin gyi de las gzhan ni med do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rang nyid kho na gsal ba yin gyi de las gzhan ni med do zhes gnas so //
translated: And in that case, it remains that it is itself the illumination, and there is nothing other than that.

original: 'o na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that yogins realize the minds of others?

original: 'di ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained below.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is because it illuminates its own nature that it is like that.

original: de lta na 'o na rang gi ngo bo myong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na rang gi ngo bo myong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that is so, it would be called the experience of its own nature.

original: ji ltar sngon po myong ba zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po myong ba zhes brjod ce na /
translated: How could it be called the experience of blue?

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩde yi dngos te sngo sogs kyi //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / de yi dngos te sngo sogs kyi //
translated: Here we say:üîΩThe experience of the entity of that,üîΩblue, etc.,

original: rang bzhin nyams su myong ba'ang de //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyams su myong ba'ang de //
translated: is also that.

original: rang gi ngo bo myong gyur kyang //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo myong gyur kyang //
translated: Although it experiences its own nature,

original: sngo sogs myong bar snang ba yin //üîΩsngon po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngon po'i myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sngo sogs myong bar snang ba yin // sngon po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir sngon po'i myong ba yin gyi /
translated: it appears as the experience of blue, etc.

original: sngon po gzhan myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po gzhan myong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it is the nature of blue, it is the experience of blue, but it is not the experience of another blue,

original: 'ba' zhig myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the experience of something alone does not exist.

original: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang las tha dad pa de ni de'i rang bzhin gyis tha snyad kyi yul du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: That which is different from something is the object of a convention that is different from it.

original: 'di ltar gal te 'ba' zhig ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'ba' zhig ni //
translated: Thus, if it were so,

original: de lta bur ni nges par 'gyur //üîΩldog pa rang gi ngo bo la'ang //
analyzed: de lta bur ni nges par 'gyur // ldog pa rang gi ngo bo la'ang //
translated: it would be just as you have determined.üîΩBut since we see that the very nature of the object is reversed,

original: mthong ba de phyir de lta min //
analyzed: mthong ba de phyir de lta min //
translated: it is not so.

original: ji ltar sngon po myong ba zhes brjod pa de kho na ltar 'di myong ba sngon po'i rang bzhin yin no zhes rigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po myong ba zhes brjod pa de kho na ltar 'di myong ba sngon po'i rang bzhin yin no zhes rigs so //
translated: Just as it is proper to say that the experience of blue is of the nature of blue,

original: tha dad par bsnyad pa tsam gyis ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad par bsnyad pa tsam gyis ni tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not so by mere designation as different.

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar bag chags kyi stobs las kyang dmigs pa yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar bag chags kyi stobs las kyang dmigs pa yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that the designation of difference is due to the power of habitual propensities in some way or other.

original: ji ltar sngon po'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po'i rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed /
translated: How does it illuminate the nature of blue?

original: sgron ma la sogs pas gsal bar bya ba bum pa la sogs pa dag ni rang nyid gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pas gsal bar bya ba bum pa la sogs pa dag ni rang nyid gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The pot, etc., which are illuminated by the lamp, etc., are not themselves illuminators.

original: bdag nyid la ni byed par 'gal ba yang yin te ;
analyzed: bdag nyid la ni byed par 'gal ba yang yin te ;
translated: It is also contradictory for something to act upon itself,

original: ral gri'i so de nyid kyis gcod pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: ral gri'i so de nyid kyis gcod pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: just as the edge of a sword does not cut itself.

original: 'di la lan /
analyzed: 'di la lan /
translated: The reply to this is as follows.

original: ji ltar de yi bdag nyid phyir //üîΩgsal byed rab tu gsal ba na //
analyzed: ji ltar de yi bdag nyid phyir // gsal byed rab tu gsal ba na //
translated: How is it that the lampüîΩilluminates itself?

original: rang gi ngo bo gsal byed 'dod //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gsal byed 'dod //
translated: We maintain that it illuminates itself by its very nature.

original: de ltar blo bdag rig can yin //
analyzed: de ltar blo bdag rig can yin //
translated: Thus the mind is self-aware.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba zhes tshad ma gang las nges /
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba zhes tshad ma gang las nges /
translated: By what means of valid knowledge do you ascertain that it is contradictory for something to act upon itself?

original: dpe tsam gyis ni 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: dpe tsam gyis ni 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub ste /
translated: You cannot establish your thesis by mere analogy,

original: bzlog pa las yang sgron ma dper yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa las yang sgron ma dper yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the opposite is also exemplified.

original: gal te bum pa phyi rol gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sgron mas gsal bar bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa phyi rol gyi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sgron mas gsal bar bya ba yin na /
translated: If a lamp that has the nature of an external object illuminates a pot,

original: sgron ma yang de lta bu gzhan gyis gsal bar bya ba yin no zhes brgal zhing brtag pa ni ma yin no //üîΩbum pa yang sgron mas gsal bar @23a * //
analyzed: sgron ma yang de lta bu gzhan gyis gsal bar bya ba yin no zhes brgal zhing brtag pa ni ma yin no // bum pa yang sgron mas gsal bar @23a * //
translated: then it is not the case that the lamp is not also illuminated by another lamp.

original: ni byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ni byas pa ma yin te /
translated: A lamp does not illuminate a pot,

original: 'on kyang de las de ltar skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de las de ltar skyes pa yin no //
translated: but rather it is produced in that way.

original: ci ste sgron ma yang mig la sogs pa gzhan gyis gsal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste sgron ma yang mig la sogs pa gzhan gyis gsal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that a lamp is illuminated by another eye, etc.,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: mig la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa thams cad la thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni bum pa la sogs pa thams cad la thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye, etc. are common to all pots, etc.

original: 'di ltar mig yod kyang bum pa gsal bar byed pa sgron pa la ltos pa de bzhin du sgron ma yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig yod kyang bum pa gsal bar byed pa sgron pa la ltos pa de bzhin du sgron ma yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even though the eye exists, the lamp which illuminates the pot is dependent on it.

original: 'on te bum pa de ltar skye ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa de ltar skye ba nyid de /
translated: But if the pot is produced in that way,

original: de'i gsal bar byed pa ni mig la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gsal bar byed pa ni mig la sogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: its illumination is by the eye, etc.

original: de lta na ni 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na /
translated: If that is so, then

original: ji ltar sgron mas phyi rol don //
