analyzed: ji ltar sgron mas phyi rol don //
translated: just as the external object is illuminated

original: gsal bar byas pa yin min yang //üîΩgsal byed tha snyad yul yin ltar //
analyzed: gsal bar byas pa yin min yang // gsal byed tha snyad yul yin ltar //
translated: by the lamp, even though it is not so,üîΩso the eye, etc. are also accepted

original: mig la sogs pa 'ang 'dod par bya //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'ang 'dod par bya //
translated: as the object of the convention of illumination.

original: dper na de las de lta bu'i ngo bor skyes pa yin yang /
analyzed: dper na de las de lta bu'i ngo bor skyes pa yin yang /
translated: For example, even though it is produced in that way,

original: sgron ma la sogs pas bum pa gsal bar byas so zhes tha snyad du byed pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa las kyang de ltar skyes pas tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pas bum pa gsal bar byas so zhes tha snyad du byed pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa las kyang de ltar skyes pas tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: the pot is conventionally said to be illuminated by the lamp, etc. In the same way, it is conventionally said that it is produced from the eye, etc.

original: ci ste bum pa la sogs pa la ni gnyi ga gsal byed yin la /
analyzed: ci ste bum pa la sogs pa la ni gnyi ga gsal byed yin la /
translated: But in the case of a pot, etc., both are illuminators.

original: sgron ma la sogs pa la ni gcig nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa la ni gcig nyid do zhe na /
translated: But in the case of a lamp, etc., only one is an illuminator.

original: de lta na 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na /
translated: If that is so, then:

original: ji ltar srid pa 'ga' zhig la //
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa 'ga' zhig la //
translated: How could it be that in some cases

original: gsal byed gcig yin gzhan dag la //
analyzed: gsal byed gcig yin gzhan dag la //
translated: One is an illuminator and in others

original: gnyis ni gzhan pa dag la ni //
analyzed: gnyis ni gzhan pa dag la ni //
translated: Both are, and in still others

original: gcig kyang med na ci zhig chad //üîΩshin tu nus pa med pa la ni gnyis yin la gzhan la gcig yin zhing /
analyzed: gcig kyang med na ci zhig chad // shin tu nus pa med pa la ni gnyis yin la gzhan la gcig yin zhing /
translated: Not even one is?üîΩIf it is said that in the case of the very incapable, both are illuminators, in the case of others, one is an illuminator, and in the case of others, not even one is an illuminator, this is the intrinsic reality of things, so what is nihilistic about this?

original: gzhan dag la ni gcig kyang med do zhes bya ba 'di dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'di la chad pa ci yod ci ste rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni gcig kyang med do zhes bya ba 'di dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'di la chad pa ci yod ci ste rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod na /
translated: But if it is said that it is contradictory for something to act on itself,

original: gang tshe de yi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: gang tshe de yi rang bzhin ni //
translated: If that is its intrinsic reality,

original: de yin de tshe ci zhig 'gal //
analyzed: de yin de tshe ci zhig 'gal //
translated: Then what is contradictory about it?

original: rang gi ngo bo 'gal na ni //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo 'gal na ni //
translated: If it is contradictory for something to have its own intrinsic reality,

original: 'di kun thams cad nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di kun thams cad nyams par 'gyur /
translated: Then all of this would be undermined.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that is contradictory to its intrinsic reality.

original: de lta yin na ni 'ga' yang rang gi ngo bor mi 'gyur bas thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni 'ga' yang rang gi ngo bor mi 'gyur bas thams cad 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then since nothing would become its own nature, everything would be destroyed.

original: chad pa ni khyad par can du skyed pa yin pas de nyid kyis de nyid skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chad pa ni khyad par can du skyed pa yin pas de nyid kyis de nyid skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Since cessation is the generation of a distinctive state, it does not generate that very state itself,

original: don nyid don rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don nyid don rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for an object itself to act on itself.

original: rang gsal bar byed pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: rang gsal bar byed pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: The nature of self-illumination

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo yin pas de nyid dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo yin pas de nyid dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: is its own nature, so it is not contradictory to itself.

original: de dag las zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: de dag las zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: If it is not to be said that it arises from those,

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang gi rgyu las yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rang gi rgyu las yin no //
translated: then it arises from its own cause that is like itself.

original: gal te rgyu med pa de'i tshe mi 'thad par 'gyur gyi gzhan @23b du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: gal te rgyu med pa de'i tshe mi 'thad par 'gyur gyi gzhan @23b du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: If it is causeless, then it is untenable, but not otherwise.

original: des na gzhan gyis 'di skad ces rang gsal bar byed pa nyid ni ma mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis 'di skad ces rang gsal bar byed pa nyid ni ma mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: Thus it is correct to say that self-illumination is not seen.

original: de la ni thams cad du rang gi ngo bos gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan btab zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la ni thams cad du rang gi ngo bos gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan btab zin pa nyid do //
translated: We have already responded to this by saying that it is because it is clear by way of its own nature in all cases.

original: yang brjod pa /üîΩde yi rig bya dan gzhan na //
analyzed: yang brjod pa / de yi rig bya dan gzhan na //
translated: Moreover, it is said:üîΩIt is difficult to accept that

original: tshor bya tshor byed 'thad bar dka' //
analyzed: tshor bya tshor byed 'thad bar dka' //
translated: what is to be known and the knower are different.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa'i blo rang nyid gsal ba'am /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa'i blo rang nyid gsal ba'am /
translated: If the mind that is different in substance from the object is clear by way of itself,

original: de lta ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: then it is not like that.

original: gal te rang nyid gsal ba yin na rang gi ngo bos gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang nyid gsal ba yin na rang gi ngo bos gsal ba yin no //
translated: If it is clear by way of itself, then it is clear by way of its own nature.

original: des na de ma gsal bar des na don gzhan gsal lo zhes bya ba'i tha snyad de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de ma gsal bar des na don gzhan gsal lo zhes bya ba'i tha snyad de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that it is not clear and that it makes another object clear.

original: gal te gsal na ni de yang de lta bu nyid du de'i tshe gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar de gzhan gyi gsal pa yin /
analyzed: gal te gsal na ni de yang de lta bu nyid du de'i tshe gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ji ltar de gzhan gyi gsal pa yin /
translated: If it is clear, then it is like that, and at that time it is clear by way of itself. Therefore, how can it make another clear?

original: de'i tshe ni gsal bya dang gsal byed dag khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gsal bya dang gsal byed dag khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, there is no difference between what is to be made clear and what makes it clear.

original: gal te de'i byed pa la rim gyis rtogs pa'i khyad par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de'i byed pa la rim gyis rtogs pa'i khyad par yod pa yin te /
translated: If you say that there is a difference in the way that they are known in sequence,üîΩthen it is like this:

original: 'di ltar / sgron ma la sogs nye ba na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sgron ma la sogs nye ba na //
translated: When a lamp and so on are nearby,

original: de yi khyad par rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: de yi khyad par rtogs pa yin //
translated: That is the realization of its distinction.

original: des na de gnyis de nyid yin //
analyzed: des na de gnyis de nyid yin //
translated: Therefore, those two are reality.

original: de ltar skyes par cis mi 'dod //
analyzed: de ltar skyes par cis mi 'dod //
translated: Why not accept that it is produced in that way?

original: khyad par gsal ba zhes bya ba ni de rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gsal ba zhes bya ba ni de rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis gsal ba yin no //
translated: The so-called distinction is the manifestation of its own nature.

original: des na rang gi ngo bo nyid de ltar gsal ba yin pa de'i phyir mthar yang rang nyid gsal ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gi ngo bo nyid de ltar gsal ba yin pa de'i phyir mthar yang rang nyid gsal ba kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, because its own nature is manifested in that way, in the end it is only manifested by itself.

original: 'on te rang nyid gsal ba zhes grags pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rang nyid gsal ba zhes grags pa med do zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that it is not known that it is manifested by itself,

original: tha snyad de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: that is not the case, because such a convention does not exist.

original: des na 'di skad brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na 'di skad brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, if it is said that this is the case,

original: nyams su myong ba dang mthun pa'i tha snyad chad mar bya ba yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin nam ci ste tha snyad thams cad tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang mthun pa'i tha snyad chad mar bya ba yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin nam ci ste tha snyad thams cad tshad ma yin na /
translated: is it not the case that a conventional expression that accords with experience is used, but not everything? But if all conventional expressions are valid cognitions,

original: de ltar gyur na phyi rol pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'ga' yang brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na phyi rol pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'ga' yang brjod par mi bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then in that case, in order to make non-Buddhists understand, nothing at all should be said.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rtogs pa de ltar khas blang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rtogs pa de ltar khas blang ngo //
translated: Therefore, one should accept things as they are understood.

original: gal te rig par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin par 'thad kyi rig par bya ba ni de ltar thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs so //üîΩrig par bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa la yang yod par 'thad do //
analyzed: gal te rig par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin par 'thad kyi rig par bya ba ni de ltar thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya bar rigs so // rig par bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa la yang yod par 'thad do //
translated: If you say that the object of knowledge is not always an object of knowledge, then it is correct to say that the object of knowledge is not an object of knowledge when it is not being cognized, but it is not correct to say that the object of knowledge is not an object of knowledge when it is being cognized.üîΩBut it is correct to say that the object of knowledge is an object of knowledge when it is being cognized, but it is not an object of knowledge when it is not being cognized.

original: gal te rig pa kho na yin na ni shes pa dang shes bya khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rig pa kho na yin na ni shes pa dang shes bya khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object of knowledge is not an object of knowledge when it is being cognized, then there would be no difference between knowledge and the object of knowledge.

original: de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: That is unacceptable.

original: rig bya las ni ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: rig bya las ni ma gtogs pa //
translated: Apart from the object of knowledge,

original: sngon po la sogs rtogs pa med //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs rtogs pa med //
translated: there is no knowledge of blue, etc.

original: rig bya min pa rtogs she na //
analyzed: rig bya min pa rtogs she na //
translated: If you say that the object of knowledge is not known,

original: de med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de med par ni ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how can it be without an object of knowledge?

original: rig par bya ba ma yin pa nyid rtogs so zhes bya bar ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: rig par bya ba ma yin pa nyid rtogs so zhes bya bar ni 'gal lo //
translated: It is contradictory to say that the object of knowledge is not known.

original: de lta na yang don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Even if that is so, this is the meaning of the statement:

original: @24a * // ma rtogs pa rtogs so zhes so //
analyzed: @24a * // ma rtogs pa rtogs so zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe unknown is known.‚Äù

original: 'on te mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yin na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum gyis ma rtogs pa rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yin na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: But if you say that the object is not perceived by direct perception but is perceived by inference, that is not correct.

original: rtogs pa las tha dad pa'i don gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin gyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa las tha dad pa'i don gzhan med do zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin gyi /
translated: Because the position is that there is no object other than the perception.

original: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rtogs pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is perceived by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang gzung ba'i rang bzhin mngon sum nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa yang gzung ba'i rang bzhin mngon sum nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: And the object perceived by inference is the nature of the object that is perceived by direct perception.

original: gal te de la gzhan gyis mthong ba 'am de lta ma yin pa de las gzhan pa'i don yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de la gzhan gyis mthong ba 'am de lta ma yin pa de las gzhan pa'i don yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the object is not perceived by direct perception, but is perceived by inference, and that there is no other object apart from that, that is not correct.

original: rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no perception.

original: ma rtogs pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin /
translated: How can you say that the object exists when it is not perceived?

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is perceived by inference,

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then inference would not be inference,

original: don mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would make the object manifest.

original: mngon du byed pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon du byed pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does not make the object manifest,

original: de yod pa yang yin la de med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di rigs sam ci /
analyzed: de yod pa yang yin la de med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di rigs sam ci /
translated: Is it reasonable to say that it both exists and does not exist?

original: mngon du byed pa med par rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa med par rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don ci yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúIt is realized without being manifested‚Äù?

original: rang gi ngo bo rtogs so zhen ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rtogs so zhen ni /
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúits own nature is realized,‚Äù

original: de nyid mngon du byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de nyid mngon du byed pa yin la /
translated: then it is manifested.

original: ma yin no zhe na ni ma rtogs pa nyid do zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: ma yin no zhe na ni ma rtogs pa nyid do zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: If it is not, then it is not realized.

original: rang gi ngo bos rtogs na ni //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos rtogs na ni //
translated: If it is realized by its own nature,

original: de nyid mngon du byas pa yin //
analyzed: de nyid mngon du byas pa yin //
translated: then it is manifested.

original: rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs sam //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs sam //
translated: If it is not realized by its own nature,

original: de ni rnam kun ma rtogs nyid //
analyzed: de ni rnam kun ma rtogs nyid //
translated: then it is not realized in any way.

original: rang gi ngo bos rtogs kyang de //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos rtogs kyang de //
translated: If it is realized by its own nature,

original: gal te mngon du byas min na//üîΩ'o na myong las sngon po yi //
analyzed: gal te mngon du byas min na// 'o na myong las sngon po yi //
translated: but it is not manifested,üîΩthen how is the nature of blue

original: rang bzhin ji ltar tha dad 'gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin ji ltar tha dad 'gyur //
translated: different from the experience of blue?üîΩThe difference in the experience of blue

original: rtogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa //
translated: is due to the difference in the realization of blue.

original: sngo sogs rang bzhin gcig pa nyid //üîΩgzhan tha dad pas de las gzhan //
analyzed: sngo sogs rang bzhin gcig pa nyid // gzhan tha dad pas de las gzhan //
translated: If the nature of blue is the same,üîΩhow can it be different from that?

original: tha dad ji ltar tshad can yin //
analyzed: tha dad ji ltar tshad can yin //
translated: How can it be limited?

original: de dang 'brel pas de nyid na //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pas de nyid na //
translated: If it is related to that,üîΩthen it is not different from that.

original: don gzhan yod par gal 'gyur //
analyzed: don gzhan yod par gal 'gyur //
translated: What other meaning could there be?

original: de dang gcig tu gyur ba ni ;
analyzed: de dang gcig tu gyur ba ni ;
translated: If it is identical with that,

original: ; de las gzhan par ga las 'dod //üîΩrjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni //
analyzed: ; de las gzhan par ga las 'dod // rjes 'gro ldog pa dag las ni //
translated: how could it be different from that?

original: tha dad rtogs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: tha dad rtogs pa ma yin te //
translated: It is not understood as differentüîΩfrom that which is concomitant and that which is not concomitant.üîΩThe concomitance and nonconcomitance

original: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa dag / mngon sum gyis ni rig ma yin //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa dag / mngon sum gyis ni rig ma yin //
translated: are not known through direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs na min //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs na min //
translated: If it is known through inference, it is not.

original: rjes dpag mngon sum sngon 'gro can //
analyzed: rjes dpag mngon sum sngon 'gro can //
translated: Inference is preceded by direct perception.

original: de med rjes dpag med pas na //
analyzed: de med rjes dpag med pas na //
translated: Since there is no inference without that,

original: long pa brgyud par 'gyur ba yin //üîΩgal te khyab byed med par ni //
analyzed: long pa brgyud par 'gyur ba yin // gal te khyab byed med par ni //
translated: it is like a blind person.üîΩIf the pervaded does not exist

original: khyab bya yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyab bya yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: without the pervader, how could it exist?üîΩHow could it be said to pervade

original: ma rtogs par ni ji ltar na //üîΩde yi khyab par byed par brjod //
analyzed: ma rtogs par ni ji ltar na // de yi khyab par byed par brjod //
translated: without being understood?

original: gal te de'i tshe rtogs na rtogs pa'i nang du chud pa nyid las ji ltar don yin /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe rtogs na rtogs pa'i nang du chud pa nyid las ji ltar don yin /
translated: If it is understood at that time, then how could it be an object since it is included within the understanding?

original: 'on te ma rtogs na ji ltar khyab par byed pa nyid du rtogs /
analyzed: 'on te ma rtogs na ji ltar khyab par byed pa nyid du rtogs /
translated: But if it is not understood, how could it be known to be a pervader?

original: @24b khyab par byed pa nyid du sngar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: @24b khyab par byed pa nyid du sngar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is known to be a pervader earlier,

original: rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the use of inference?

original: 'di'i dus su ma rtogs pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med pa ma yi no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i dus su ma rtogs pa de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med pa ma yi no zhe na /
translated: If it is not realized at that time, then inference is pointless.

original: 'o na sngar khyab par byed pa nyid du ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: 'o na sngar khyab par byed pa nyid du ji ltar rtogs /
translated: But how was the pervasion previously realized?üîΩThe cognition of the pervasion

original: sngon dang da ltar shes pa nyid //üîΩtha dad khyab byed ji ltar rtogs //üîΩde ni rtogs pa tsam zhe na //
analyzed: sngon dang da ltar shes pa nyid // tha dad khyab byed ji ltar rtogs // de ni rtogs pa tsam zhe na //
translated: Is different from the cognition of the present.üîΩIf you say that the pervasion is merely realized,

original: khyab pa de ni ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: khyab pa de ni ji ltar brjod //
translated: How can you say that it is realized?

original: gal te du ba'i rnam par ni //
analyzed: gal te du ba'i rnam par ni //
translated: If the form of smoke

original: rtogs pa me med mi 'byung na //
analyzed: rtogs pa me med mi 'byung na //
translated: Is realized without fire,

original: me yi rnam pa 'di yang ni //
analyzed: me yi rnam pa 'di yang ni //
translated: Then this form of fire

original: me med par ni 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: me med par ni 'dod ma yin //
translated: Would not be asserted without fire.

original: me'i 'bras bu du ba ji ltar rtogs pa tsam yin zhe na /
analyzed: me'i 'bras bu du ba ji ltar rtogs pa tsam yin zhe na /
translated: How is smoke the effect of fire merely realized?

original: 'di ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: 'di ltar me'i 'bras bu nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar me'i 'bras bu nyid yin na /
translated: If it is the effect of fire,

original: dud sogs phyi rol ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: dud sogs phyi rol ngo bo nyid //
translated: Smoke and so on would be external by nature.

original: de ni me yi 'bras bur yang //üîΩphyir nyid du ba grub na gyur //
analyzed: de ni me yi 'bras bur yang //üîΩphyir nyid du ba grub na gyur //
translated: If it is the effect of fire,üîΩIt would be established as smoke.

original: de'i phyir phan tshun rten pa dngos por rnam par gnas pa can ma yin pa 'di ni nye bar dgod par mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun rten pa dngos por rnam par gnas pa can ma yin pa 'di ni nye bar dgod par mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, this mutual dependence, which is not based on real entities, should not be posited.

original: 'dis ni ngo shes pa yang khyad du bsad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo shes pa yang khyad du bsad pa yin te /
translated: This also refutes the recognition of the object.

original: ji skad du ngo shes pa'i stobs nyid kyis rnam par shes pa tsam bzlog pa yin no zhes 'dzer te /
analyzed: ji skad du ngo shes pa'i stobs nyid kyis rnam par shes pa tsam bzlog pa yin no zhes 'dzer te /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúBy the power of recognition itself, consciousness is refuted.‚ÄùüîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / gal te myong ba'i nang gnas na //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gal te myong ba'i nang gnas na //
translated: If it exists in the experience,

original: ngo shes pa yi don ci yin //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yi don ci yin //
translated: what is the meaning of recognition?

original: gal te myong min don bdag na //
analyzed: gal te myong min don bdag na //
translated: If it does not exist in the experience,

original: rnam rig tsam du ji ltar 'gyur //üîΩbar na yod pa'i don ngo shes pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ni myong ba'i nang du 'dus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam rig tsam du ji ltar 'gyur // bar na yod pa'i don ngo shes pas rtogs par 'gyur ba ni myong ba'i nang du 'dus pa ma yin te /
translated: how can it be mere awareness?

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: The object that exists in the interval is not included in the experience, because it is cognized as hidden.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / lkog tu gyur par rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / lkog tu gyur par rtogs pa ni //
translated: The cognition of the hidden

original: rtogs par 'dus pa dngos nyid ni //
analyzed: rtogs par 'dus pa dngos nyid ni //
translated: is the nature of the included cognition.üîΩThe statement

original: rtogs par ma chud rtogs min zhes //
analyzed: rtogs par ma chud rtogs min zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúThe unincluded cognition is not cognition‚ÄùüîΩhas already been explained.

original: bya ba 'di yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: bya ba 'di yang bstan zin to //
translated: Thus:

original: ma rtogs pa bar na yod pa med na /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa bar na yod pa med na /
translated: If the non-realized does not exist in between,üîΩ

original: ji ltar ngo shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ngo shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the object of recognition does not exist in the interval, how can there be recognition?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma rigs mthun pa nyid rtogs pa tsam kho na las yin par mthong bas /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma rigs mthun pa nyid rtogs pa tsam kho na las yin par mthong bas /
translated: We see that it is just the mere understanding of the similarity of type between the former and the latter.

original: de kho na ltar 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de kho na ltar 'gyur mod /
translated: It is just as you say.

original: gzhan gyis ci shig bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ci shig bya ste /
translated: What else could it be?

original: bregs pa'i phyir sogs pa'i sgra dang sen mo ngo shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bregs pa'i phyir sogs pa'i sgra dang sen mo ngo shes pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the recognition of the sound of the word ‚Äúcut‚Äù and the recognition of a fingernail.

original: 'on te der ngo shes pa'i shes pa ni spyi la sogs pa'i yul can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der ngo shes pa'i shes pa ni spyi la sogs pa'i yul can yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the cognition of recognition has a universal, etc., as its object,

original: spyi nyid gcig yin no zhes /
analyzed: spyi nyid gcig yin no zhes /
translated: then a universal is one.

original: ngo shes pa des na gsal ba gcig nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: ngo shes pa des na gsal ba gcig nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, by that recognition, a single particular is not established.

original: spyi yang bar na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi yang bar na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And a universal does not exist in the interval,

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid cognition of it.

original: ngo shes pa nyid tshad ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa nyid tshad ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that recognition itself is a valid cognition, it is not,

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin tsam zhig ngo shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir de nyid ngo shes pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin tsam zhig ngo shes pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir de nyid ngo shes pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: because the mere nature of the former and the latter is the reason for recognition. Therefore, that itself is the object of recognition.

original: ngo shes pa'i de nyid @25a * //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i de nyid @25a * //
translated: The suchness that is recognizedüîΩ

original: ni bar gyi rang bzhin la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ni bar gyi rang bzhin la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The reality that is recognized is not the object of the present nature of consciousness,

original: bar gyi rang bzhin rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlkog tu gyur pa ma mthong ba ni dmigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bar gyi rang bzhin rig pa med pa'i phyir ro // lkog tu gyur pa ma mthong ba ni dmigs pa ma yin la /
translated: because the present nature of consciousness does not know the past.üîΩThe past is not the object of a consciousness that does not see it,

original: mthong ba na ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir de shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba na ni lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir de shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: but when it is seen, it is not past.

original: gal te lkog tu gyur na ji ltar shes pa yin /
analyzed: gal te lkog tu gyur na ji ltar shes pa yin /
translated: If it is past, how can it be known?

original: gnas skabs gang la yod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang la yod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it exists in a certain state,

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa nyid do //
translated: it is not past.

original: da ltar 'das pas lkog tu gyur kyang shes pa nyid ni mi nyams so //
analyzed: da ltar 'das pas lkog tu gyur kyang shes pa nyid ni mi nyams so //
translated: Even though the past is past, it is not the case that it is not known.

original: gal te nyams na don gyi don nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nyams na don gyi don nyid kyang nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not known, the object would not be an object.

original: gal te don kyang 'das na don nyid las nyams par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don kyang 'das na don nyid las nyams par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If the object were past, it would not be an object.

original: 'o na bar na yod pa de don nyid ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'o na bar na yod pa de don nyid ma yin te ;
translated: But the present that exists between the past and future is not an object,

original: de ni 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is past.

original: 'das pa lkog tu gyur pa yin yang don nyid gtong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa lkog tu gyur pa yin yang don nyid gtong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though the past is past, it is not the case that it is not an object.üîΩIf the present that exists between the past and future is not an object,

original: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction.

original: myong ba med pa ni myong ba yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: myong ba med pa ni myong ba yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the non-experience of an object be experience?

original: 'o na don byed pa med pa yang don nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na don byed pa med pa yang don nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Well, how can the non-performance of a function be a function?

original: myong ba med pa ni don bya ba byed nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: myong ba med pa ni don bya ba byed nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The non-experience of an object is not capable of performing a function.

original: de rjes su dpag pas rig pa ni spang zin to //
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pas rig pa ni spang zin to //
translated: The cognition of it through inference has already been refuted.

original: gzhan gyis bar rig na de nyid kyi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bar rig na de nyid kyi shes pa yin no //
translated: If it is cognized by another, then it is cognized by that itself.

original: gzhan gyis rig pa nyid ni ngo shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig pa nyid ni ngo shes pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not recognized by another,

original: des de dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid med pas ngo shes pa rgyu nyid du mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des de dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid med pas ngo shes pa rgyu nyid du mi 'grub po //
translated: because it does not exist simultaneously with it. Thus recognition is not established as a cause.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa ni shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du bag chags kyi stobs las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa ni shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du bag chags kyi stobs las skyes pa yin no //
translated: The form of inference arises from the power of the latent impressions in the form of a single cognition.

original: de'i phyir gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa mtha' dag kyang bag chags kyang stobs nyid la yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa mtha' dag kyang bag chags kyang stobs nyid la yin no //
translated: Therefore, the entire form of the clear appearance also arises from the power of the latent impressions.

original: gal te bag chags ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rnam par tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te bag chags ngo bo gcig yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rnam par tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the latent potentialities are of the same nature, how can consciousnesses be different?

original: bag chags tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: bag chags tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad do zhe na /
translated: If you say that they are different because the latent potentialities are different,üîΩthen if the latent potentialities generate consciousnesses that have aspects that are the limitless divisions of blue, yellow, and so on, then what is the difference between them and external objects?

original: gal te sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dbye ba mtha' yas pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i rnam pa can du skyed par byed pa'i bag chags yin na de'i tshe de dang phyi rol gyi don tha dad pa ci yod de bag chags zhes ming tsam
analyzed: gal te sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa dbye ba mtha' yas pa'i rnam par shes pa de'i rnam pa can du skyed par byed pa'i bag chags yin na de'i tshe de dang phyi rol gyi don tha dad pa ci yod de bag chags zhes ming tsam
translated: The term latent potentialities is merely a nominal designation.

original: du zad do zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: du zad do zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rnam shes snga mas byas pa yi //
analyzed: rnam shes snga mas byas pa yi //
translated: The potential created by a former consciousness

original: nus pa bag chags yin par brjod //
analyzed: nus pa bag chags yin par brjod //
translated: is called a latent potentiality.

original: de ni lus med yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni lus med yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Since it is not physical,

original: ji ltar don dang mtshungs pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar don dang mtshungs pa yin //
translated: how can it be similar to an object?

original: bag chags zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa snga mas bskyed pa'i nus pa yin par bag chags kyi rang bzhin rig pa dag gis rtogs so //
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa snga mas bskyed pa'i nus pa yin par bag chags kyi rang bzhin rig pa dag gis rtogs so //
translated: Those who know the nature of latent potentialities understand that latent potentialities are the potentials created by former consciousnesses.

original: don ni lus can gyi rang bzhin rtag tu nye bar 'tshe ba byed pa yin no //
analyzed: don ni lus can gyi rang bzhin rtag tu nye bar 'tshe ba byed pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the nature of the object is always to harm.

original: gal @25b te don rig pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na nye bar 'tshe ba'i rgyu yin gyi rtag tu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal @25b te don rig pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na nye bar 'tshe ba'i rgyu yin gyi rtag tu ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is the cause of harm when it is the state of the awareness of the object, it is not always so.

original: des na bag chags kyis stobs las byung ba'i snang ba'am /
analyzed: des na bag chags kyis stobs las byung ba'i snang ba'am /
translated: Therefore, it is either an appearance that arises from the power of latent impressions,

original: don nye bar 'tshe ba'i rgyu yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: don nye bar 'tshe ba'i rgyu yin yang rung ste /
translated: or it is the cause of the harm of the object.

original: 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between these two?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: phyir rol khyad par yod min yang //üîΩbsgoms pa yin ni khyad par gyi ;
analyzed: phyir rol khyad par yod min yang // bsgoms pa yin ni khyad par gyi ;
translated: Even though there is no difference in the external object,üîΩthere is a difference in the clarity, etc.

original: / gsal ba la sogs khyad 'gyur phyir //
analyzed: / gsal ba la sogs khyad 'gyur phyir //
translated: of the appearance due to the power of meditation.

original: snang ba don gyi ngo bo min //
analyzed: snang ba don gyi ngo bo min //
translated: The appearance is not the nature of the object.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba phyin ci log gi bag chags 'byor par gyur na /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs las byung ba phyin ci log gi bag chags 'byor par gyur na /
translated: When the latent impressions of error are developed through the power of meditation,

original: mi 'dod pa ldog cing 'dod pa 'os pa'i phyir 'di ni khyad che'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ldog cing 'dod pa 'os pa'i phyir 'di ni khyad che'o //
translated: the undesirable is eliminated and the desirable is obtained. Therefore, there is a great difference.

original: des na tha dad par snang ba mtha' dag ni blo'i ngo bo bag chags kyis byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na tha dad par snang ba mtha' dag ni blo'i ngo bo bag chags kyis byas pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, all appearances as different are just the nature of the mind created by latent impressions.

original: gal te bag chags rnam par shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir sad par byed pa yod na bag chags thams cad sad par 'gyur ba'i phyir mtha' yas par snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur bas 'chol ba chen
analyzed: gal te bag chags rnam par shes pa gcig gi bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir sad par byed pa yod na bag chags thams cad sad par 'gyur ba'i phyir mtha' yas par snang ba can gyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur bas 'chol ba chen
translated: If latent impressions are of the nature of a single consciousness, then if one latent impression is activated, all latent impressions would be activated, and consciousness would arise with infinite appearances.

original: por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: por 'gyur ro //
translated: This would be a great confusion.

original: phyi rol gyi don las len na ni skyon med de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don las len na ni skyon med de /
translated: If external objects are grasped, there is no error.

original: nye ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid mthong ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i don gang yin pa de nyid mthong ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that what is near is seen, that is not so,

original: nye ba ma yin pa yang mthong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: nye ba ma yin pa yang mthong bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it is accepted that what is not near is also seen.üîΩThus:üîΩSome desire to forget what they remember,

original: 'di ltar / dran pa brjed par 'dod pa dang // 'gas ni log par rig pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dran pa brjed par 'dod pa dang // 'gas ni log par rig pa ste //
translated: some have wrong knowledge.

original: gzhan dag med snang gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: gzhan dag med snang gzhan dag ni //
translated: Some assert that nonexistence appears,

original: thams cad thams cad la yod 'dod //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad la yod 'dod //
translated: and others that everything exists for everyone.

original: re zhig thams cad thams cad la yod pa de dag la ni skyon mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: re zhig thams cad thams cad la yod pa de dag la ni skyon mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: For those who assert that everything exists for everyone, the error is the same.

original: med pa snang ba la yang med pa thams cad snang bar thal lo //
analyzed: med pa snang ba la yang med pa thams cad snang bar thal lo //
translated: And it follows that if nonexistence appears, all nonexistents would appear.

original: dran pa brjed pa gang yin pa de la yang sngar du ma mthong bas ci'i phyir du ma ma mthong /
analyzed: dran pa brjed pa gang yin pa de la yang sngar du ma mthong bas ci'i phyir du ma ma mthong /
translated: But if you forget, then why don‚Äôt you see the nonexistence of the many?

original: rnam par shes par smra ba la yang de mtshungs pa'i phyir nye bar yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba la yang de mtshungs pa'i phyir nye bar yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is the same for the proponents of consciousness.

original: sngar zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa dran nam /
analyzed: sngar zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa dran nam /
translated: Do you remember the consciousness that entered the womb?

original: don yang rung ste /
analyzed: don yang rung ste /
translated: Or the object?

original: khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: khyad par ci yod /
translated: What is the difference?

original: phyin ci log tu snang ba yang sngar mthong ba la 'jug gam gzhan du yang rung ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu snang ba yang sngar mthong ba la 'jug gam gzhan du yang rung ste /
translated: And the appearance of something that is not there is the same whether it is something that was seen before or something else.

original: ci ste thams cad la ma yin zhe brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so //üîΩslar yang der bag chags de nyid nges par brjod dgos par mtshungs so //üîΩde ma thag pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid ni bag chags yin te /
analyzed: ci ste thams cad la ma yin zhe brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs so // slar yang der bag chags de nyid nges par brjod dgos par mtshungs so // de ma thag pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid ni bag chags yin te /
translated: If you say that it is not the case for all, then the objection and analysis are the same.üîΩAnd it is the same in that you must say that the latent imprint is just the nature of the immediately preceding consciousness.

original: snga ma'i bdag nyid snang ba ni //
analyzed: snga ma'i bdag nyid snang ba ni //
translated: The latent imprint is the appearance of the nature of the previous consciousness.

original: gsal zhing dod pa bag chags yin //
analyzed: gsal zhing dod pa bag chags yin //
translated: It is clear and vivid.üîΩSince it is the producer, the experience is of that nature.

original: skyed byed myong ba de lta'i bdag / yin phyir med par gal 'gyur //
analyzed: skyed byed myong ba de lta'i bdag / yin phyir med par gal 'gyur //
translated: How could it be nonexistent?

original: sad byed yod par gyur na blo //
analyzed: sad byed yod par gyur na blo //
translated: If there is an awakener, there is cognition.üîΩ

original: sngon po @26a * //
analyzed: sngon po @26a * //
translated: If there is an awakener, then there is consciousness.

original: dang ni ser po la //
analyzed: dang ni ser po la //
translated: Blue and yellow, etc.,üîΩappearances

original: sogs pa'i snang ba dang 'brel pa //
analyzed: sogs pa'i snang ba dang 'brel pa //
translated: are related to the prior cognition.

original: ji lta ji ltar skye bar mthong //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar skye bar mthong //
translated: We see that they arise in that way.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma mngon par 'dod pa dang gzhan du snang ba la /üîΩser ba la sogs pa'i shes pa snga ma gnas pa dang 'brel te las de'i mod dam dus gzhan du de ltar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma mngon par 'dod pa dang gzhan du snang ba la / ser ba la sogs pa'i shes pa snga ma gnas pa dang 'brel te las de'i mod dam dus gzhan du de ltar snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: In the case of the prior cognition of blue, etc.,üîΩthe prior cognition of yellow, etc., is related to the prior cognition of blue, etc., as its basis.

original: sad pa'i mthong bas rmi lam gyi snang ba bskyed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sad pa'i mthong bas rmi lam gyi snang ba bskyed pa bzhin no //
translated: The cognition that appears as blue, etc., arises from the prior cognition of blue, etc., either immediately or at another time, just as the appearances in a dream are produced by what one has seen while awake.

original: chod pa las ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: chod pa las ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: How can a cognition arise from something that is obstructed?

original: dran pa dang rmi lam gyi shes pa la sogs pa chos pa las kyang mthong ste /
analyzed: dran pa dang rmi lam gyi shes pa la sogs pa chos pa las kyang mthong ste /
translated: We see that memory, dream cognition, etc., arise from something obstructed.

original: mthong ba mi 'dod ngo zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba mi 'dod ngo zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that we do not accept that they arise from what is seen.

original: gal te de skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the prior cognition does not produce the later cognition,

original: 'on kyang smon pa la sogs pas de nyid snang ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang smon pa la sogs pas de nyid snang ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: but the later cognition appears as the prior cognition because of the power of aspiration, etc., that is not so.

original: 'das pa la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa la snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the past does not appear.

original: 'das pa yang snang bar mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'das pa yang snang bar mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the past is seen to appear,

original: med pa snang ngo zhes bya ba pa'i don ci yin /
analyzed: med pa snang ngo zhes bya ba pa'i don ci yin /
translated: what does it mean to say that the nonexistent appears?

original: de'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid yin no //
translated: It is just the conception of it.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba las de la dran pa skyed par byed la de ni de nyid kyi nus pa'i khyad par 'jog pa yin la nus pa'i khyad par de ni bag chags zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba las de la dran pa skyed par byed la de ni de nyid kyi nus pa'i khyad par 'jog pa yin la nus pa'i khyad par de ni bag chags zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, memory is produced from experience in regard to it, and that is the establishment of the special power of that. And that special power is conventionally called the residual impression.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di ni 'di kho na ltar dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'di ni 'di kho na ltar dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: The fact of cause and effect is perceived just in this way.

original: de'i phyir bag chags yod pa nyid dang / rnam shes snga ma'i bye brag la tshad ma med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bag chags yod pa nyid dang / rnam shes snga ma'i bye brag la tshad ma med pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the existence of the residual impression and the nonexistence of a special power of the prior consciousness are not established by a valid cognition.

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dngos po ni don thog ma med pa'i rgyun can bzhin du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dngos po ni don thog ma med pa'i rgyun can bzhin du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fact of the residual impression is established in the same way that the fact of the beginningless continuity of objects is established.

original: ji ltar phyi rol rgyu 'bras rgyun //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol rgyu 'bras rgyun //
translated: The continuity of external cause and effect

original: skye ba thog ma med pa ltar //üîΩde bzhin rnam par shes pa'i rgyun //
analyzed: skye ba thog ma med pa ltar // de bzhin rnam par shes pa'i rgyun //
translated: Just as there is no beginning to birth,

original: thog ma med par cis mi 'dong //
analyzed: thog ma med par cis mi 'dong //
translated: Why should there not be no beginningüîΩTo the continuum of consciousness?

original: bag chags kyi dbye ba la rgyu ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bag chags kyi dbye ba la rgyu ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the cause of the classification of latent potentialities?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: de yi rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the reason for that exists.

original: bag chags dbye pa yod pa nyid //
analyzed: bag chags dbye pa yod pa nyid //
translated: The classification of latent potentialities

original: rgyu mtshan shes pa'i bye brag ste //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan shes pa'i bye brag ste //
translated: Is the classification of the object of cognition.üîΩThe classification of that also

original: de yi dbye ba'ang de las yin //üîΩsngar zhugs pa'i shes pa'i bye brag nyid bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de yi dbye ba'ang de las yin // sngar zhugs pa'i shes pa'i bye brag nyid bag chags sad pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Is from that.üîΩThe classification of the consciousness that previously entered is the cause of the activation of the latent potentialities, and the classification of consciousness is from the classification of the latent potentialities themselves.

original: shes pa'i dbye ba yang bag chags kyi khyad par de nyid las yin pa'i phyir skyon ci yod /
analyzed: shes pa'i dbye ba yang bag chags kyi khyad par de nyid las yin pa'i phyir skyon ci yod /
translated: What is the fault?

original: de lta na phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na phan tshun rten pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, there is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,üîΩBecause in this way,

original: 'di ltar / gang gi phan tshun rten pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang gi phan tshun rten pa yin //
translated: What is mutually dependent?

original: nyes pa 'dir ni thal 'gyur ba //
analyzed: nyes pa 'dir ni thal 'gyur ba //
translated: This fault is not entailed.

original: nges bskyed bag chags de nyid ni //
analyzed: nges bskyed bag chags de nyid ni //
translated: The latent potentialities that are produced

original: shes te nyid kyi rgyu ma yin //
analyzed: shes te nyid kyi rgyu ma yin //
translated: Are not the cause of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gzhan gyi rgyu bag chags gzhan yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gzhan gyi rgyu bag chags gzhan yin la /
translated: But the cause of another type of consciousness is another latent impression.

original: sngar gyi bag chags kyi dbye bas bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan ni bag @26b chags gzhan gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sngar gyi bag chags kyi dbye bas bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan ni bag @26b chags gzhan gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: And the consciousness generated by the differentiation of the previous latent impression is the cause of another latent impression.

original: des na phan tshun rten pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: des na phan tshun rten pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Thus there is no fault of mutual dependence.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: don mthong ba la yang 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: don mthong ba la yang 'di mtshungs so //
translated: then the same would be true of the perception of an object.

original: 'di ltar don gyi bye brag rgyu yin na //
analyzed: 'di ltar don gyi bye brag rgyu yin na //
translated: In this way, if the differentiation of the object is the cause,

original: de yi dbye ba 'ang ji ltar yin //
analyzed: de yi dbye ba 'ang ji ltar yin //
translated: how can there be the differentiation of that?

original: shes pa'i dbye bas dbye zhe na //
analyzed: shes pa'i dbye bas dbye zhe na //
translated: If you say that it is differentiated by the differentiation of consciousness,

original: phan tshun rten par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: phan tshun rten par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: then there is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: don gyi dbye ba yang rgyu mtshan med pa kho nar shes pa tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi dbye ba yang rgyu mtshan med pa kho nar shes pa tha dad pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: And the differentiation of the object is not a cause of the difference of consciousness without a reason,

original: de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not tenable.

original: shes pa'i dbye ba las yin na phan tshun rten pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: shes pa'i dbye ba las yin na phan tshun rten pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: If it is due to the differentiation of consciousness, then there is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: don nyid kyi dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba'i shin tu gsal par ma 'brel pa nyid do //
analyzed: don nyid kyi dbye ba'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bya ba'i shin tu gsal par ma 'brel pa nyid do //
translated: The reason for the division of the object is the very object itself.

original: 'on te don gyi dbye ba gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan ni don gyi dbye ba gzhan yin la /
analyzed: 'on te don gyi dbye ba gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan ni don gyi dbye ba gzhan yin la /
translated: Or, if the reason for the division of the object is another division of the object,

original: de'i yang gzhan yin la 'di ni bag chags la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de'i yang gzhan yin la 'di ni bag chags la yang mtshungs so //
translated: then that also is another, and this is the same for the latent impressions.

original: gal te don gyi bye brag ni snang ba yin pas rnam par shes pa tha dad par byed do zhes bya ba 'di rigs kyi /
analyzed: gal te don gyi bye brag ni snang ba yin pas rnam par shes pa tha dad par byed do zhes bya ba 'di rigs kyi /
translated: If it is reasonable to say that the difference in the object is the cause of the difference in consciousness,

original: bag chags go ji ltar yin na ci zhig lan du 'gyur /
analyzed: bag chags go ji ltar yin na ci zhig lan du 'gyur /
translated: then what is the answer to the question, ‚ÄúHow is it for the latent impressions?‚Äù

original: gal te don bzhin du bag chags kyang snang ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te don bzhin du bag chags kyang snang ba yin na /
translated: If the latent impressions are like the object and appear,

original: de ni don nyid yin bas ming tsam zhig tha dad par zad do //
analyzed: de ni don nyid yin bas ming tsam zhig tha dad par zad do //
translated: then they are just the object itself, and there is only a difference in name.

original: de la bag chags 'dzin pa la byed pa yod pa ni 'dzin pa tha dad pa nyid skyed par 'gyur gyi gzung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la bag chags 'dzin pa la byed pa yod pa ni 'dzin pa tha dad pa nyid skyed par 'gyur gyi gzung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If the latent impressions are the cause of the difference in the grasping, then the difference in grasping will arise, but not the difference in the grasped.

original: de lta bu'i gzung ba myong ba las byung ba'i bag chags ni dran pa tsam skyed par mthong pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gzung ba myong ba las byung ba'i bag chags ni dran pa tsam skyed par mthong pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The latent impressions that arise from the experience of such an object are seen to produce mere memory.

original: 'di la lan /
analyzed: 'di la lan /
translated: The response to this is as follows:

original: 'dir ni rnam shes snga ma nyid //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam shes snga ma nyid //
translated: Here, the previous consciousness itself

original: bag chags yin zhes sngar brjod zin //
analyzed: bag chags yin zhes sngar brjod zin //
translated: has been stated to be the latent impression.

original: de yi rnam can shes skyed de //
analyzed: de yi rnam can shes skyed de //
translated: It produces a consciousness that has its aspect;

original: ji ltar tha dad byed ma yin //üîΩdper na lcags sgrog gis bcings pas //
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad byed ma yin // dper na lcags sgrog gis bcings pas //
translated: how is it not different?üîΩFor example, it is like the cause of the gait

original: 'khyor po yi ni 'gros byed pa //
analyzed: 'khyor po yi ni 'gros byed pa //

analyzed: bdag nyid med kyang de lta bu'i //

analyzed: tshul du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin bzhin //

original: 'dod 'jigs mya ngan la sogs la //
analyzed: 'dod 'jigs mya ngan la sogs la //

analyzed: don de dag ni yod min yang //

analyzed: bag chags dbye bas gzung ba yi //

original: rnam pa yang ni tha dad mthong //
analyzed: rnam pa yang ni tha dad mthong //
translated: the aspects of the apprehended are seen to be different.

analyzed: ci ste der yang yul dang dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid can phyi rol nyid dmigs pa yin te /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all consciousnesses have an object.

original: gal te de'i tshe der thob pa med pas de'i tshe nyid de nyid du med mod /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe der thob pa med pas de'i tshe nyid de nyid du med mod /

original: gzhan gyi tshe gzhan na med do zhes bya ba 'di la go tshad ma ci yod /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe gzhan na med do zhes bya ba 'di la go tshad ma ci yod /

original: 'di ltar bum pa gang na gang gi tshe ma dmigs bde'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa gang na gang gi tshe ma dmigs bde'i tshe /
translated: In that case, when a pot is not observed in a certain place, at that time

original: de na med kyi thams cad du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de na med kyi thams cad du ni ma yin no zhe na /

analyzed: 'dir smras pa / 'dir dmigs yul la sogs pa yis //
translated: Here we say:üîΩHow can it be different

analyzed: gzhan nyid yin par ji ltar 'gyur // sngo @27a * //
translated: in terms of the object of observation and so on?

original: stsogs nyid du mthong ba la //
analyzed: stsogs nyid du mthong ba la //
translated: When blue and so on are seen,

analyzed: rnam gzhan yod la yod dam ci // gal te yul gzhan pa dag kyang //
translated: is there another aspect or not?üîΩIf other objects

original: yul gzhan par ni dmigs yin na //
analyzed: yul gzhan par ni dmigs yin na //
translated: are observed as other objects,

original: sngon po yi ni rnam pa yang //
analyzed: sngon po yi ni rnam pa yang //
translated: then the aspect of blue

original: de ltar yin phyir 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yin phyir 'di mtshungs so //
translated: would be the same.

original: rnam pa gzhan la tshad ma med pa'i phyir gzhan du ma yin no zhes lan 'debs na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan la tshad ma med pa'i phyir gzhan du ma yin no zhes lan 'debs na /
translated: If you reply, ‚ÄúIt is not different because there is no valid knowledge of another aspect,‚Äù

original: yul gzhan du ma yin no zhes lan mtshungs so //
analyzed: yul gzhan du ma yin no zhes lan mtshungs so //
translated: then the reply is the same: ‚ÄúIt is not different.‚Äù

original: rnam pa la ni gnod par byed pa med la /
analyzed: rnam pa la ni gnod par byed pa med la /
translated: There is no refutation of the aspect.

original: yul la gnod pa yod pa des na yul dang 'brel pa de nyid med kyi rnam pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul la gnod pa yod pa des na yul dang 'brel pa de nyid med kyi rnam pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object is not nonexistent, then the connection with the object is not nonexistent, but the aspect is.

original: 'o na de la dmigs pa med pa des na shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma grub po //
analyzed: 'o na de la dmigs pa med pa des na shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa ma grub po //
translated: But if you say that the object is not nonexistent, then it is not established that all consciousnesses have objects.üîΩBut if you say that it has an object,

original: gal te de la yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te de la yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: then,

original: 'di ltar / yul dang brten pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: 'di ltar / yul dang brten pa ma gtogs par //
translated: apart from the object and the basis,

original: 'brel pa 'ga' yang mthong ba med //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'ga' yang mthong ba med //
translated: no connection is seen.

original: de gnyis dmigs na shes pa ni //
analyzed: de gnyis dmigs na shes pa ni //
translated: If those two are objects,

original: dmigs pa med par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could consciousness be without an object?

original: der ni yul dang de la brten pa nyid snang la de gnyis kyang bden pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: der ni yul dang de la brten pa nyid snang la de gnyis kyang bden pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: There, the object and the basis appear, and since those two are real, how could they be of the nature of not having an object?

original: 'brel ba ni de dag las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba ni de dag las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The connection is not different from those two.

original: des na rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid do zhe na /

original: gal te / 'brel pa la yang dmigs bcas na //
analyzed: gal te / 'brel pa la yang dmigs bcas na //
translated: But if you say that the connection has an object,

original: de lta nyid ni cis ma thob //
analyzed: de lta nyid ni cis ma thob //
translated: why is it not established in that way?

original: thob pa med kyang dmigs bcas zhes //
analyzed: thob pa med kyang dmigs bcas zhes //
translated: But to say that there is no attainment, and yet there is an object,

original: bya ba 'di ni cal col yin //
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni cal col yin //
translated: is mere prattle.

original: gal te thob pa med pa de lta na yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na 'o na log par snang ba yang med pa'i phyir khas blang dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: gal te thob pa med pa de lta na yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin na 'o na log par snang ba yang med pa'i phyir khas blang dang 'gal lo //
translated: If there is no attainment, and yet there is an object, then, since there is no appearance of an object, you contradict your own position.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar log par snang ba de bzhin du thams cad 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan du brtags pas ci bya zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin pa'i phyir yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar log par snang ba de bzhin du thams cad 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan du brtags pas ci bya zhes bya ba 'di ni bstan zin pa'i phyir yang mi brjod do //
translated: Moreover, since everything would be like the appearance of an object, what is the use of postulating anything else? This is not stated again because it has already been stated.

original: gnod par byed pa'i shas pa med pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i shas pa med pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not so, because there is no cognition that contradicts it.

original: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa med kyang log par snang ba yin pa'i phyir gnod pa byed pa bden pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa med kyang log par snang ba yin pa'i phyir gnod pa byed pa bden pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Even though there is no contradicting cognition, the appearance is false, and so the contradiction is not real.

original: gang du dus gzhan du gyur pa der ni bag chags nyid kyi byed pa rtogs kyi don gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du dus gzhan du gyur pa der ni bag chags nyid kyi byed pa rtogs kyi don gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: When there is a change at another time, the effect is understood to be due to the latent impressions, not to the object.

original: de'i rnam pa ni nyams su myong ba snga ma nyid las yin gyi yod pa ma yin pa'i don gyi rnam pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni nyams su myong ba snga ma nyid las yin gyi yod pa ma yin pa'i don gyi rnam pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The form of the object is the form of the prior experience, not the form of a nonexistent object.

original: ci ste shes pa skad cig ma byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: ci ste shes pa skad cig ma byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: If you say that the object is a thing that produces the cognition,

original: de la ma skyes pa ni bsgo bar bya ba ma yin la 'das pa'i don ni sgo bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ma skyes pa ni bsgo bar bya ba ma yin la 'das pa'i don ni sgo bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: then what has not yet arisen cannot be produced, and a past object cannot produce .

original: phan tshun 'brel pa med @27b ba lhan cig pa dag kyang bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun 'brel pa med @27b ba lhan cig pa dag kyang bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Nor can things that are not mutually related, or that are simultaneous, be the object produced and the producer.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa'i dngos po ni rgyu 'bras kyi khyad par nyid yin no zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa'i dngos po ni rgyu 'bras kyi khyad par nyid yin no zhes bstan zin to //
translated: We have already explained that the object produced and the producer are distinguished by their being cause and effect.

original: de ni skad cig ma dag kho na la yod kyi rtag pa la ni ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni skad cig ma dag kho na la yod kyi rtag pa la ni ma yin pa'i phyir skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni bzlog pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Since that is present only in momentary things and not in permanent things, the reason ‚Äúbecause they are momentary‚Äù proves the opposite of what you intended.

original: des na dran la 'dzin dbye yod //
analyzed: des na dran la 'dzin dbye yod //

analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa spangs gzhan min //

original: de ni don ni yod min pas //
analyzed: de ni don ni yod min pas //

analyzed: de lam mdun du nye ba nyid //

analyzed: rjes 'gro med par 'jig na yang //

analyzed: bag chags bsgo bya sgo byed kyi //

analyzed: don 'thad rtag pa la ma yin //

analyzed: khyad par can gyi skad cig na //

analyzed: rgya skyegs stsogs kyis bsgyur gang yang //
translated: Madder, lac, and so on,

original: de yi rang bzhin de 'bras la //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin de 'bras la //
translated: Its nature and effect

original: 'pho ba'i phyir na bag chags nyid //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i phyir na bag chags nyid //
translated: Are not transferred.

original: rigs pas 'thad pa'i bag chags gang yin 'di //
analyzed: rigs pas 'thad pa'i bag chags gang yin 'di //
translated: Whatever latent propensities are logically tenable

original: rab tu brtags te phyi rol don bzlog pa //üîΩde lta na yang phyi rol mngon zhen pa'i //
analyzed: rab tu brtags te phyi rol don bzlog pa // de lta na yang phyi rol mngon zhen pa'i //
translated: Are thoroughly imagined in order to reverse external objects.üîΩEven so, all these beings

original: gdon gyis 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad zin //
analyzed: gdon gyis 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad zin //
translated: Are possessed by the demon of clinging to external reality.

original: de phyir rnam pa'i rnam dbye ba //
analyzed: de phyir rnam pa'i rnam dbye ba //
translated: Therefore, all the different aspects

original: mtha' dag bag chags stobs las yin //
analyzed: mtha' dag bag chags stobs las yin //
translated: Are due to the power of latent propensities.

original: phyi rol don med de yi phyir //
analyzed: phyi rol don med de yi phyir //
translated: Since external objects do not exist,

original: blo ni dmigs pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: blo ni dmigs pa med pa nyid //
translated: The mind is devoid of objects.

original: de phyir shes pa thams cad ni @28b dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de phyir shes pa thams cad ni @28b dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, all cognitions are without an object,üîΩbecause they are cognitions, like a dream cognition.

original: shes pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: This is the pure inference.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa med nyid ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa med nyid ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: The absence of an object is just this:

original: bdag gi rnam pa rig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rnam pa rig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the awareness of the form of the self.

original: gal te shes pa thams cad phyogs su byed na dpe med pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpog ce na /
analyzed: gal te shes pa thams cad phyogs su byed na dpe med pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpog ce na /
translated: If all cognitions are taken as the subject, then how can you infer, since there is no example?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: don ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning is not understood.

original: tshad mas phyogs ni sgrub pa na //
analyzed: tshad mas phyogs ni sgrub pa na //
translated: When the subject is established by a valid cognition,

original: dpe ni rang nyid grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dpe ni rang nyid grub pa'i phyir //
translated: the example is established by itself.üîΩThe result of the valid cognition

original: thams cad ces bya la sogs pa'i //üîΩtshad 'bras 'di ni rigs par ldan //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya la sogs pa'i // tshad 'bras 'di ni rigs par ldan //
translated: is reasonable in all cases.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa sad pa'i shes pa nyid phyogs su byas pa yin no ;
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa sad pa'i shes pa nyid phyogs su byas pa yin no ;
translated: The waking cognition that is the basis of the dispute is taken as the subject.

original: / rmi lam gyi shes pa ni bsgoms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid du grub pas na dper byed do //
analyzed: / rmi lam gyi shes pa ni bsgoms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa nyid du grub pas na dper byed do //
translated: The consciousness of a dream is established as being without an object because it conforms with meditation and because it conforms with the cessation of meditation.

original: ji ltar khyab pa grub ce na //
analyzed: ji ltar khyab pa grub ce na //
translated: How is the pervasion established?

original: rigs gang gang las grub pa zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: rigs gang gang las grub pa zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: By the principle called ‚Äúthe establishment of the nature of things.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mtha' dag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mtha' dag med par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚Äù Otherwise, the entire relation of cause and effect would not exist,

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no valid cognition.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i de nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid yin par de rig pa dag 'dzer to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i de nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid yin par de rig pa dag 'dzer to //
translated: The nature of cause and effect is said by the wise to be the conformity with the presence and absence of the effect.

original: gus par bsgom pa dang 'brel pa //
analyzed: gus par bsgom pa dang 'brel pa //
translated: The dream consciousness is related to the meditation that is its cause.

original: sad tshe mthong ba rmi lam du //üîΩmthong 'gyur des na shes gzhan yang //
analyzed: sad tshe mthong ba rmi lam du // mthong 'gyur des na shes gzhan yang //
translated: When one awakens, one remembers the dream.üîΩTherefore, one understands that the other consciousnesses

original: de lta nyid ces rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: de lta nyid ces rtogs pa yin //
translated: are also just like that.

original: gal te rmi lam gyi shes pa ni shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam gyi shes pa ni shes pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the consciousness of a dream is not without an object because it is a consciousness,

original: 'on kyang gnod par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But because there is an object that is a refutation,

original: 'di ltar / de tshe de 'am gzhan gyi tshe //üîΩgzhan gyis rmi lam mthong ba'i ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / de tshe de 'am gzhan gyi tshe // gzhan gyis rmi lam mthong ba'i ni //
translated: at that time or at another time,üîΩthe object seen in a dream

original: sad pa'i lta bas mthong med pa //
analyzed: sad pa'i lta bas mthong med pa //
translated: is not seen by the perception of one who is awake.

original: de phyir de ni dmigs med nyid //üîΩgnod byed shes pas de yi yul //
analyzed: de phyir de ni dmigs med nyid // gnod byed shes pas de yi yul //
translated: Therefore, it is just non-apprehension.üîΩThe object of that refutation

original: dmigs pas bzlog par byas pas na //üîΩshes te dmigs pa med par ni //
analyzed: dmigs pas bzlog par byas pas na // shes te dmigs pa med par ni //
translated: is refuted by the perception of the refutation.üîΩIt is ascertained here that

original: byed do zhes 'dir rnam par nges //
analyzed: byed do zhes 'dir rnam par nges //
translated: the refutation is known without an object.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin du sad pa'i shes pa la ni de ltar gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin du sad pa'i shes pa la ni de ltar gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no such refutation of the perception of one who is awake, as there is of the perception in a dream,

original: de ji ltar dpe yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dpe yin zhe na /
translated: how can that be an example?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: gnod byed shes pas de yi yul //
analyzed: gnod byed shes pas de yi yul //
translated: because the object of that refutation

original: dbrog par nus par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: dbrog par nus par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: cannot be removed by the perception of the refutation.üîΩThe refutation does not have the function of drawing out the object,üîΩlike a hook, etc.,

original: lcags kyu stsogs bzhin shes pa la //üîΩ'dren pa'i byed pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: lcags kyu stsogs bzhin shes pa la // 'dren pa'i byed pa yod ma yin //
translated: drawing out consciousness.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how is it, then?

original: shes par byed pa'i bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i bya ba nyid do //
translated: It is the function of making known.

original: 'di la de lta bu'i yul gyi don med do zhes gzhan gyis shes par bya ba yin @29a * //
analyzed: 'di la de lta bu'i yul gyi don med do zhes gzhan gyis shes par bya ba yin @29a * //
translated: It is to be understood by others that such an object does not exist.

original: no ; ; dngos po med pa go bar byed pa yang mi dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: no ; ; dngos po med pa go bar byed pa yang mi dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: The non-existence of an entity is also understood only through non-apprehension,

original: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs so zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that one is a logical reason for negation.

original: 'gal ba yang mi dmigs pa nyid kyis sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang mi dmigs pa nyid kyis sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And contradiction is established by non-apprehension itself.

original: des na gnod par byed pas ni de gzhal byas stong ba nyid du rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gnod par byed pas ni de gzhal byas stong ba nyid du rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of refutation is to be understood as empty of the object of comprehension by the refuting cognition.

original: de med pa yang gzhan yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod pa'i byed pa ni de las gzhan dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa yang gzhan yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gnod pa'i byed pa ni de las gzhan dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: And the non-existence of that is the existence of something else, so the refuting cognition is the apprehension of something else.

original: de ni sad pa'i shes pa la thams cad yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sad pa'i shes pa la thams cad yod pa yin no //
translated: That is the case for the cognition of the waking state.üîΩIf it is the case that

original: gal te sad ba'i shes pa la //
analyzed: gal te sad ba'i shes pa la //
translated: in the waking state

original: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin no //
translated: it is not so,

original: zhes bya ba de ltar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam de ji ltar gnod ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam de ji ltar gnod ce na /
translated: then how can it be refuted?
